original: 'bras bu che dang / mi che ba dang / mi gdung ba dang / gya nom snang dang / shin tu mthong dang / 'og min dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang / ci'ang med pa'i skye mched dang /
analyzed: 'bras bu che dang / mi che ba dang / mi gdung ba dang / gya nom snang dang / shin tu mthong dang / 'og min dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang / ci'ang med pa'i skye mched dang /
translated: the great result, the not great result, the not tormented, the beautiful appearance, the very seeing, the highest, the sphere of infinite space, the sphere of infinite consciousness, the sphere of nothingness,

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched du skye ba'i chos rnams bcom ldan 'das bdag cag la ston par shes so //
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched du skye ba'i chos rnams bcom ldan 'das bdag cag la ston par shes so //
translated: and the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: 'jam dpal / 'khor 'di nyid kyi nang nas kha cig gis ni mir skye ba'i chos rnams /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / 'khor 'di nyid kyi nang nas kha cig gis ni mir skye ba'i chos rnams /
translated: Mañjuśrī, in this very retinue, some have the teachings for being born as a human,

original: kha cig gis ni 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal por 'gyur ba'i chos rnams /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal por 'gyur ba'i chos rnams /
translated: some have the teachings for becoming a universal monarch,

original: kha cig gis ni gling gnyis dang / gsum dang / bzhi pa'i 'khor los bsgyur ba dang / stong gnyis dang / stong gsum gyi stong chen po dang / stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag gi 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal por 'gyur ba'i chos rnams @181b bcom ldan 'das bdag cag la ston par shes so //
analyzed: kha cig gis ni gling gnyis dang / gsum dang / bzhi pa'i 'khor los bsgyur ba dang / stong gnyis dang / stong gsum gyi stong chen po dang / stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag gi 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal por 'gyur ba'i chos rnams @181b bcom ldan 'das bdag cag la ston par shes so //
translated: Some of them understand that the Blessed One is teaching the Dharma so that they may become universal monarchs ruling over one continent, two continents, three continents, or the four continents; or universal monarchs ruling over a double-thousand world system, a triple-thousand, great thousand world system; or universal monarchs ruling over as many world systems as there are sand-grains in the Ganges River.

original: 'jam dpal / 'khor 'di nyid kyi nang nas kha cig gis ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku 'dom do tsam du 'phags par shes so //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / 'khor 'di nyid kyi nang nas kha cig gis ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku 'dom do tsam du 'phags par shes so //
translated: Mañjuśrī, some in this very retinue understand the Tathāgata’s body to be as tall as one arm-span.

original: kha cig gis ni rgyang grags tsam du 'phags /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni rgyang grags tsam du 'phags /
translated: Some understand it to be as tall as an arrow-shot.

original: kha cig gis ni rgyang grags gnyis tsam du 'phags /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni rgyang grags gnyis tsam du 'phags /
translated: Some understand it to be as tall as two arrow-shots.

original: kha cig gis ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku dpag tshad tsam du 'phags par shes so //
analyzed: kha cig gis ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku dpag tshad tsam du 'phags par shes so //
translated: Some understand the Tathāgata’s body to be as tall as a league.

original: kha cig gis ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku dpag tshad gnyis tsam du 'phags par shes so //
analyzed: kha cig gis ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku dpag tshad gnyis tsam du 'phags par shes so //
translated: Some see the body of the Tathāgata as two yojanas tall.

original: kha cig gis ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku dpag tshad bcu tsam du 'phags par shes so //
analyzed: kha cig gis ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku dpag tshad bcu tsam du 'phags par shes so //
translated: Some see the body of the Tathāgata as ten yojanas tall.

original: 'khor 'di nyid kyi nang nas kha cig gis ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku dpag tshad stong du shes so //
analyzed: 'khor 'di nyid kyi nang nas kha cig gis ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku dpag tshad stong du shes so //
translated: Some in this very retinue see the body of the Tathāgata as a thousand yojanas tall.

original: kha cig gis ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku dpag tshad stong phrag bcu dang / nyi shu dang / sum cu dang / bzhi bcu dang / lnga bcu par shes so //
analyzed: kha cig gis ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku dpag tshad stong phrag bcu dang / nyi shu dang / sum cu dang / bzhi bcu dang / lnga bcu par shes so //
translated: Some see the body of the Tathāgata as ten thousand, twenty thousand, thirty thousand, forty thousand, or fifty thousand yojanas tall.

original: kha cig gis ni dpag tshad 'bum dang / kha cig gis ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku dpag tshad 'bum phrag bcu dang / nyi shu dang / sum cu dang / bzhi bcu dang / lnga bcu par shes so //
analyzed: kha cig gis ni dpag tshad 'bum dang / kha cig gis ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku dpag tshad 'bum phrag bcu dang / nyi shu dang / sum cu dang / bzhi bcu dang / lnga bcu par shes so //
translated: Some see the body of the Tathāgata as a hundred thousand yojanas tall, and some see the body of the Tathāgata as a million, ten million, a billion, a trillion, a quadrillion, or a quintillion yojanas tall.

original: kha cig gis ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku d pag tshad 'bum phrag brgyad khri bzhi stong par shes so //
analyzed: kha cig gis ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku d pag tshad 'bum phrag brgyad khri bzhi stong par shes so //
translated: Some see the body of the Tathāgata as eighty-four thousand hundred thousand yojanas tall.

original: 'khor 'di nyid kyi nang nas kha cig gis ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku dpag tshad 'bum phrag bgrang ba las 'das @182a *//🔽par shes so //
analyzed: 'khor 'di nyid kyi nang nas kha cig gis ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku dpag tshad 'bum phrag bgrang ba las 'das @182a *// par shes so //
translated: Some in this very retinue know the body of the Tathāgata to be beyond the measure of hundreds of thousands of leagues.

original: 'khor 'di nyid kyi nang nas kha cig gis ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gser gyi kha dog tu mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'khor 'di nyid kyi nang nas kha cig gis ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gser gyi kha dog tu mthong ngo //
translated: Some in this very retinue see the Tathāgata’s body as the color of gold.

original: kha cig gis ni nor bu rin po che bee d'urya'i kha dog tu /🔽kha cig gis ni nor bu rin po che chen po aandra rnyil gyi kha dog tu /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni nor bu rin po che bee d'urya'i kha dog tu / kha cig gis ni nor bu rin po che chen po aandra rnyil gyi kha dog tu /
translated: Some see it as the color of a precious beryl gem.🔽Some see it as the color of a great sapphire gem.

original: kha cig gis ni nor bu rin po che mthon ka chen po'i kha dog tu /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni nor bu rin po che mthon ka chen po'i kha dog tu /
translated: Some see it as the color of a great maṇi jewel.

original: kha cig gis ni nor bu rin po che skar 'od kyi kha dog tu /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni nor bu rin po che skar 'od kyi kha dog tu /
translated: Some see it as the color of a star-light maṇi jewel.

original: kha cig gis ni nor bu rin po che padma r'a ga'i kha dog tu /🔽kha cig gis ni nor bu rin po che brgya byin thogs pa'i kha dog tu /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni nor bu rin po che padma r'a ga'i kha dog tu / kha cig gis ni nor bu rin po che brgya byin thogs pa'i kha dog tu /
translated: Some see it as the color of a padmarāga maṇi jewel.🔽Some see it as the color of a maṇi jewel held by Śakra.

original: kha cig gis ni nor bu rin po che rdo rje snang ba'i kha dog tu /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni nor bu rin po che rdo rje snang ba'i kha dog tu /
translated: Some see it as the color of a maṇi jewel that shines like a vajra.

original: kha cig gis ni nor bu rin po che lha thams cad snang ba'i kha dog tu /🔽kha cig gis ni nor bu rin po che nyi zla snang ba'i kha dog tu /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni nor bu rin po che lha thams cad snang ba'i kha dog tu / kha cig gis ni nor bu rin po che nyi zla snang ba'i kha dog tu /
translated: Some saw the precious jewel as the color of all the gods.🔽Some saw the precious jewel as the color of the sun and moon.

original: kha cig gis ni nor bu rin po che chu 'dang gi kha dog tu /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni nor bu rin po che chu 'dang gi kha dog tu /
translated: Some saw the precious jewel as the color of a water crystal.

original: kha cig gis ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku nor bu rin po che shel gyi kha dog tu shes so //
analyzed: kha cig gis ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku nor bu rin po che shel gyi kha dog tu shes so //
translated: Some knew the Tathāgata’s body as the color of a crystal precious jewel.

original: kha cig gis ni nor bu rin po che dbang gi rgyal po'i kha dog tu /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni nor bu rin po che dbang gi rgyal po'i kha dog tu /
translated: Some saw the precious jewel as the color of the king of jewels.

original: kha cig gis ni nor bu rin po che 'od thams cad bsdus pa'i kha dog tu /🔽kha cig gis ni nor bu rin po che ri dvags kyi rgyal po seng ge ral pa can gyi kha dog tu /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni nor bu rin po che 'od thams cad bsdus pa'i kha dog tu / kha cig gis ni nor bu rin po che ri dvags kyi rgyal po seng ge ral pa can gyi kha dog tu /
translated: Some saw the precious jewel as the color of the gathering of all lights.🔽Some saw the precious jewel as the color of the king of beasts, the lion with a mane.

original: kha cig gis ni nor bu rin po che seng ge'i rgyal mtshan gyi rtse mo'i kha dog tu /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni nor bu rin po che seng ge'i rgyal mtshan gyi rtse mo'i kha dog tu /
translated: Some saw the precious jewel as the color of the top of a lion banner.

original: kha cig gis ni nor @182b bu rin po che rgya mtsho'i gnas rnam par dag pa rin po che bkod pa kun nas 'od zer snang ba'i kha dog tu shes so //
analyzed: kha cig gis ni nor @182b bu rin po che rgya mtsho'i gnas rnam par dag pa rin po che bkod pa kun nas 'od zer snang ba'i kha dog tu shes so //
translated: Some perceive the Tathāgata as the color of the precious gem that is the pure abode of the ocean.

original: 'jam dpal / 'khor 'di nyid kyi nang nas kha cig gis ni de bzhin gshegs pas yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che'i kha dog tu shes so //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / 'khor 'di nyid kyi nang nas kha cig gis ni de bzhin gshegs pas yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che'i kha dog tu shes so //
translated: Mañjuśrī, some in this very retinue perceive the Tathāgata as the color of the precious wish-fulfilling gem.

original: 'jam dpal / kha dog dang / spyod lam dang / dbyibs gang dang / gang kho nas sems can rnams 'dul bar 'gyur ba /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / kha dog dang / spyod lam dang / dbyibs gang dang / gang kho nas sems can rnams 'dul bar 'gyur ba /
translated: Mañjuśrī, whatever color, deportment, and shape will tame beings,

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin gshegs pa kha dog dang / spyod lam dang / dbyibs de dang / de kho nar sems can rnams kyis mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin gshegs pa kha dog dang / spyod lam dang / dbyibs de dang / de kho nar sems can rnams kyis mthong ngo //
translated: Mañjuśrī, the Tathāgata appears to beings in that very color, deportment, and shape.

original: 'jam dpal / chos bstan pa gang dang / gang gis sems can rnams yongs su smin par 'gyur ba'i chos de dang / de nyid de bzhin gshegs pa ston par sems can rnams kyis shes so //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / chos bstan pa gang dang / gang gis sems can rnams yongs su smin par 'gyur ba'i chos de dang / de nyid de bzhin gshegs pa ston par sems can rnams kyis shes so //
translated: Mañjuśrī, whatever Dharma teaching will ripen beings, the Tathāgata is perceived by beings as teaching just that Dharma.

original: 'jam dpal / spyod pa gang dang / gang gis sems can rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa la 'dzud cing 'dul bar 'gyur ba'i spyod pa de dang / de la de bzhin gshegs pa bzhugs par sems can rnams kyis shes so //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / spyod pa gang dang / gang gis sems can rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa la 'dzud cing 'dul bar 'gyur ba'i spyod pa de dang / de la de bzhin gshegs pa bzhugs par sems can rnams kyis shes so //
translated: Mañjuśrī, the beings who are to be guided by the Tathāgata, through whatever conduct, will understand that the Tathāgata abides in that very conduct.

original: 'jam dpal / gal te shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / gal te shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med /
translated: Mañjuśrī, if the eastern direction were filled with innumerable,

original: grangs med / bsam gyis mi khyab /
analyzed: grangs med / bsam gyis mi khyab /
translated: countless, inconceivable,

original: mtshungs pa med /
analyzed: mtshungs pa med /
translated: incomparable,

original: gzhal du med /🔽tshad med / brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa dag lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma @183a *//
analyzed: gzhal du med / tshad med / brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa dag lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma @183a *//
translated: immeasurable,

original: yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten skyong ba dang / mi dang / mi ma yin pa rnams kyis yongs su gang bar gyur la /
analyzed: yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten skyong ba dang / mi dang / mi ma yin pa rnams kyis yongs su gang bar gyur la /
translated: and inexpressibly more than inexpressible worlds of gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, mahoragas, Śakras, Brahmās, Lokapālas, humans, and non-humans,🔽and if all of them were to think of the Tathāgata with a one-pointed mind,

original: shar phyogs su ji lta ba de bzhin du lho dang / de bzhin du nub dang / de bzhin du byang dang / de bzhin du shar lho dang / de bzhin du lho nub dang / de bzhin du nub byang dang / de bzhin du byang shar dang /
analyzed: shar phyogs su ji lta ba de bzhin du lho dang / de bzhin du nub dang / de bzhin du byang dang / de bzhin du shar lho dang / de bzhin du lho nub dang / de bzhin du nub byang dang / de bzhin du byang shar dang /
translated: Just as in the east, so in the south, and likewise in the west, north, northeast, southeast, southwest, northwest, and in the nadir and zenith.

original: de bzhin du steng dang / de bzhin du 'og gi phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med /
analyzed: de bzhin du steng dang / de bzhin du 'og gi phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med /
translated: Just as in the east, so too in the south, and likewise in the west, and likewise in the north, and likewise in the northeast, and likewise in the southeast, and likewise in the southwest, and likewise in the northwest, and likewise above and below.🔽In the infinite,

original: grangs med / bsam gyis mi khyab /🔽mtshungs pa med /
analyzed: grangs med / bsam gyis mi khyab / mtshungs pa med /
translated: incalculable,

original: gzhal du med /
analyzed: gzhal du med /
translated: inconceivable,🔽immeasurable,🔽boundless,🔽inexpressible worlds in the ten directions,

original: tshad med / brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa dag lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / brgya byin dang /
analyzed: tshad med / brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa dag lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / brgya byin dang /
translated: with their gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, demigods, garuḍas, kiṃnaras, mahoragas, Śakras,

original: tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten skyong ba dang / mi dang / mi ma yin pa dag gis /🔽dper na / 'dam bu'i tshal lam /
analyzed: tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten skyong ba dang / mi dang / mi ma yin pa dag gis / dper na / 'dam bu'i tshal lam /
translated: Brahmās, Lokapālas, humans, and non-humans,🔽like a field of reeds,

original: bu ram shing gi tshal lam /
analyzed: bu ram shing gi tshal lam /
translated: a field of sugar cane,

original: til gyi zhing bzhin du yongs su gang bar gyur pa'i sems can de dag /
analyzed: til gyi zhing bzhin du yongs su gang bar gyur pa'i sems can de dag /
translated: and they are completely filled with sentient beings.

original: 'jam dpal / gal te de bzhin gshegs pa mthong bas 'dul ba yin na /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / gal te de bzhin gshegs pa mthong bas 'dul ba yin na /
translated: Mañjuśrī, if those sentient beings are to be disciplined by seeing the Tathāgata,

original: sems can de dang / de dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyan sngar 'dom gang tsam na 'khod par shes so //
analyzed: sems can de dang / de dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyan sngar 'dom gang tsam na 'khod par shes so //
translated: then they perceive the Tathāgata sitting in front of them, at a distance of an arrow-shot.

original: 'jam @183b dpal /
analyzed: 'jam @183b dpal /
translated: Mañjuśrī,

original: kha dog dang / spyod lam dang / gnas gang dang / gang gis sems can de dag 'dul bar 'gyur ba de dang / de kho nar de bzhin gshegs pa mdun na bzhugs par sems can de dag gis mthong ngo //
analyzed: kha dog dang / spyod lam dang / gnas gang dang / gang gis sems can de dag 'dul bar 'gyur ba de dang / de kho nar de bzhin gshegs pa mdun na bzhugs par sems can de dag gis mthong ngo //
translated: they see the Tathāgata sitting in front of them, in whatever color, deportment, and form is the one that will discipline those sentient beings.

original: 'jam dpal / chos bstan pa gang dang / gang gis sems can rnams yongs su min par 'gyur pa de dang / de nyid kyi chos ston par thos so //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / chos bstan pa gang dang / gang gis sems can rnams yongs su min par 'gyur pa de dang / de nyid kyi chos ston par thos so //
translated: Mañjuśrī, they hear the Tathāgata teaching the Dharma in whatever way the Dharma is taught that will discipline those sentient beings.

original: 'jam dpal spyod pa gang gis sems can de dag de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa la 'jug par 'gyur ba'i spyod pa de dang / de la de bzhin gshegs pa bzhugs te /
analyzed: 'jam dpal spyod pa gang gis sems can de dag de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa la 'jug par 'gyur ba'i spyod pa de dang / de la de bzhin gshegs pa bzhugs te /
translated: Mañjuśrī, the Tathāgata abides in that conduct by which those sentient beings enter the Tathāgata’s teaching.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzad pa thams cad lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzad pa thams cad lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par 'gyur ro //
translated: And the Tathāgata’s entire activity is spontaneous and nonconceptual.

original: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / 'di lta ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is like this:

original: dper na / zla ba yar gyi ngo'i dkyil 'khor nam phyed kyi dus na dzambu'i gling gi sems can thams cad kyis so so'i mdun na zla ba'i dkyil 'khor 'dug par shes kyang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ni sems can de dag gis bdag ci'i phyir zla ba'i dkyil 'khor du shes
analyzed: dper na / zla ba yar gyi ngo'i dkyil 'khor nam phyed kyi dus na dzambu'i gling gi sems can thams cad kyis so so'i mdun na zla ba'i dkyil 'khor 'dug par shes kyang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ni sems can de dag gis bdag ci'i phyir zla ba'i dkyil 'khor du shes
translated: For example, at midnight on the fifteenth day of the lunar month, the orb of the moon is at its full, and all the sentient beings of Jambudvīpa know that the orb of the moon is present before them.

original: par 'gyur bar bdag sems can de dag gi mdun na 'dug par bya'o //🔽snyam du mi rtog /
analyzed: par 'gyur bar bdag sems can de dag gi mdun na 'dug par bya'o // snyam du mi rtog /
translated: But the orb of the moon does not think, ‘I will make myself known to those sentient beings by becoming present before them.’

original: rnam par mi rtog mod kyi 'on kyang /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog mod kyi 'on kyang /
translated: It does not think or conceptualize in that way.

original: 'jam dpal / zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ni ma 'dres pa'i chos dang ldan pas lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par de lta bu'i bya ba 'di 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ni ma 'dres pa'i chos dang ldan pas lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par de lta bu'i bya ba 'di 'byung ngo //
translated: Mañjuśrī, the moon’s orb, endowed with unmixed qualities, spontaneously and nonconceptually performs such actions.

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du de @184a *//
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du de @184a *//
translated: Mañjuśrī, in the same way,

original: bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyang 'khor dpag tu med /🔽grangs med / bsam gyis mi khyab /
analyzed: bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyang 'khor dpag tu med / grangs med / bsam gyis mi khyab /
translated: the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfect and Complete Buddha,🔽in the midst of an infinite,🔽incalculable,🔽incomparable,

original: mtshungs pa med; gzhal du med /🔽tshad med / brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i dbus na bzhugs na de dag thams cad kyis kyang de bzhin gshegs pa mdun na bzhugs par mthong mod kyi /
analyzed: mtshungs pa med; gzhal du med / tshad med / brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i dbus na bzhugs na de dag thams cad kyis kyang de bzhin gshegs pa mdun na bzhugs par mthong mod kyi /
translated: immeasurable,🔽and inexpressibly vast assembly,

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin gshegs pa ni sems can de dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa mdun na bzhugs pa shes par 'gyur bar sems can de dag gis mdun du 'dug par bya'o snyam du mi rtog /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin gshegs pa ni sems can de dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa mdun na bzhugs pa shes par 'gyur bar sems can de dag gis mdun du 'dug par bya'o snyam du mi rtog /
translated: Mañjuśrī, the Tathāgata does not think, ‘Those sentient beings should see the Tathāgata sitting in front of them.’

original: rnam par mi rtog ste /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog ste /
translated: He is nonconceptual.

original: 'on kyang sems can rnams ji lta bus 'dul ba de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa mdun na bzhugs par shes so //
analyzed: 'on kyang sems can rnams ji lta bus 'dul ba de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa mdun na bzhugs par shes so //
translated: But the Tathāgata is known to be present in front of them, in whatever way sentient beings are to be trained.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: ma 'dres pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma 'dres pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he is endowed with the unshared qualities of a buddha.

original: 'jam dpal / dper na /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / dper na /
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is like this:

original: sems can rnams kyi las tha ma dang / 'bring dang / rab kyi rnam par smin pa'i dbang gis sems can rnams kyi 'du byed tha ma dang / 'bring dang / rab rnams 'byung bar 'du byed rnams ni mi rtog /🔽rnam par mi rtog ste /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi las tha ma dang / 'bring dang / rab kyi rnam par smin pa'i dbang gis sems can rnams kyi 'du byed tha ma dang / 'bring dang / rab rnams 'byung bar 'du byed rnams ni mi rtog / rnam par mi rtog ste /
translated: due to the ripening of sentient beings’ actions, whether inferior, middling, or superior, the inferior, middling, or superior formations of sentient beings arise. But the formations do not think or conceptualize.

original: 'on kyang 'du byed de dag lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par tha ma dang / 'bring dang / rab rnams kyi bya ba dag la 'jug go /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'du byed de dag lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par tha ma dang / 'bring dang / rab rnams kyi bya ba dag la 'jug go /
translated: Nevertheless, those formations, spontaneously and nonconceptually, engage in the activities of the inferior, middling, and superior.

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag @184b dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyang sems can rnams kyi las kyi rnam par smin pa tha ma dang / 'bring dang / rab kyi dbang gis de bzhin gshegs pa tha ma dang /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag @184b dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyang sems can rnams kyi las kyi rnam par smin pa tha ma dang / 'bring dang / rab kyi dbang gis de bzhin gshegs pa tha ma dang /
translated: Mañjuśrī, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, by the power of the maturation of the karma of sentient beings, whether inferior, middling, or superior, the Tathāgata appears to be inferior,🔽middling, or superior.

original: 'bring dang / rab tu sems can rnams kyis mthong yang /
analyzed: 'bring dang / rab tu sems can rnams kyis mthong yang /
translated: Mañjuśrī, the thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddhas are seen by sentient beings in accordance with the ripening of their karma, whether inferior, middling, or superior.

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin gshegs pa ni mi rtog /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin gshegs pa ni mi rtog /
translated: Mañjuśrī, the thus-gone ones are nonconceptual and

original: rnam par mi rtog ste /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog ste /
translated: non-apprehending.

original: 'on kyang de bzhin gshegs pa de'i mdzad pa de lta bus de lhun gyis grub par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'on kyang de bzhin gshegs pa de'i mdzad pa de lta bus de lhun gyis grub par 'byung ngo //
translated: Nevertheless, Mañjuśrī, the thus-gone ones’ activity occurs spontaneously in this way.

original: 'jam dpal / dper na /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / dper na /
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is like this:

original: nor bu rin po che bee d'urya rigs la ni ras tha dad pa nyid kyi dbang gis kha dog tha dad pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: nor bu rin po che bee d'urya rigs la ni ras tha dad pa nyid kyi dbang gis kha dog tha dad pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: due to the influence of different cloths, a vaiḍūrya gem will appear in different colors.

original: 'jam dpal / gal te nor bu rin po che bee d'urya ras ser po'i steng du bzhag na ni nor bu rin po che bee d'urya kha dog ser por 'gyur /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / gal te nor bu rin po che bee d'urya ras ser po'i steng du bzhag na ni nor bu rin po che bee d'urya kha dog ser por 'gyur /
translated: Mañjuśrī, if a vaiḍūrya gem is placed on a yellow cloth, the vaiḍūrya gem will appear yellow.

original: gal te ras dmar po'i steng du bzhag na ni nor bu rin po che bee d'urya kha dog dmar por 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te ras dmar po'i steng du bzhag na ni nor bu rin po che bee d'urya kha dog dmar por 'gyur /
translated: If it is placed on a red cloth, the precious gem vaiḍūrya will become red.

original: gal te ras sngon po'i steng du bzhag na ni nor bu rin po che bee d'urya kha dog sngon por 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te ras sngon po'i steng du bzhag na ni nor bu rin po che bee d'urya kha dog sngon por 'gyur te /
translated: If it is placed on a blue cloth, the precious gem vaiḍūrya will become blue.

original: de ltar ras kha dog ci dang / ci 'dra ba'i steng du bzhag pa de dang / de nyid kyi kha dog kho nar 'gyur yang /🔽'jam dpal / nor bu rin po che bee d'urya ni mi rtog /
analyzed: de ltar ras kha dog ci dang / ci 'dra ba'i steng du bzhag pa de dang / de nyid kyi kha dog kho nar 'gyur yang / 'jam dpal / nor bu rin po che bee d'urya ni mi rtog /
translated: In this way, no matter what color the cloth is that it is placed on, it will take on the exact same color.

original: rnam par mi rtog ste /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, the precious gem vaiḍūrya does not think or conceptualize.

original: 'on kyang lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par de'i bya ba de lta bu de 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'on kyang lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par de'i bya ba de lta bu de 'byung ngo //
translated: Nevertheless, its activity occurs spontaneously and nonconceptually.

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'ang sems can tha dad pa nyid kyi dbang gis kha dog tha dad pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'ang sems can tha dad pa nyid kyi dbang gis kha dog tha dad pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: Mañjuśrī, in the same way, the Thus-Gone One appears in different colors due to the different kinds of beings.

original: @185a *// 'jam dpal /
analyzed: @185a *// 'jam dpal /
translated: Mañjuśrī,

original: gal te sems can rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gser gyi kha dog tu mthong bas gdul bar bya ba yin na ni de dag gis ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gser gyi kha dog tu mthong ngo //🔽gal te sems can rnams nor bu rin po che bee d'urya'i kha dog lta bus gdul bar bya ba yin na ni de dag gis kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku nor bu rin po che bee d'urya'i kha dog tu mthong ngo //
analyzed: gal te sems can rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gser gyi kha dog tu mthong bas gdul bar bya ba yin na ni de dag gis ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gser gyi kha dog tu mthong ngo // gal te sems can rnams nor bu rin po che bee d'urya'i kha dog lta bus gdul bar bya ba yin na ni de dag gis kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku nor bu rin po che bee d'urya'i kha dog tu mthong ngo //
translated: If beings are to be converted by seeing the Tathāgata’s body as the color of gold, then they see the Tathāgata’s body as the color of gold.🔽If beings are to be converted by seeing the Tathāgata’s body as the color of a precious sapphire gem, then they see the Tathāgata’s body as the color of a precious sapphire gem.

original: gal te sems can rnams mu tig gi kha dog lta bus gdul bar bya ba yin na ni de dag gis kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku mu tig gi kha dog tu mthong ngo //
analyzed: gal te sems can rnams mu tig gi kha dog lta bus gdul bar bya ba yin na ni de dag gis kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku mu tig gi kha dog tu mthong ngo //
translated: If beings are to be converted by seeing the Tathāgata’s body as the color of a pearl, then they see the Tathāgata’s body as the color of a pearl.

original: gal te sems can rnams nor bu rin po che aanda rnyil gyi kha dog lta bus gdul bar bya ba yin na ni de dag gis kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku nor bu rin po che aanda rnyil gyi kha dog tu mthong ngo //🔽'jam dpal / gal te sems can rnams nor bu rin po che mthon ka chen po'i kha dog lta bus gdul bar bya ba yin na ni de dag gis kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku nor bu rin po che mthon ka chen po'i kha dog tu mthong ngo //
analyzed: gal te sems can rnams nor bu rin po che aanda rnyil gyi kha dog lta bus gdul bar bya ba yin na ni de dag gis kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku nor bu rin po che aanda rnyil gyi kha dog tu mthong ngo // 'jam dpal / gal te sems can rnams nor bu rin po che mthon ka chen po'i kha dog lta bus gdul bar bya ba yin na ni de dag gis kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku nor bu rin po che mthon ka chen po'i kha dog tu mthong ngo //
translated: If beings are to be guided by the color of a sapphire, they will see the Tathāgata’s body as the color of a sapphire.🔽Mañjuśrī, if beings are to be guided by the color of a great lapis lazuli gem, they will see the Tathāgata’s body as the color of a great lapis lazuli gem.

original: gal te sems can rnams nor bu rin po che 'od thams cad bsdus pa'i kha dog lta bus gdul bar bya ba yin na ni de dag gis kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku nor bu rin po che 'od thams cad bsdus pa'i kha dog tu mthong ngo //
analyzed: gal te sems can rnams nor bu rin po che 'od thams cad bsdus pa'i kha dog lta bus gdul bar bya ba yin na ni de dag gis kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku nor bu rin po che 'od thams cad bsdus pa'i kha dog tu mthong ngo //
translated: If beings are to be guided by the color of a gem that gathers all lights, they will see the Tathāgata’s body as the color of a gem that gathers all lights.

original: @185b gal te sems can rnams nor bu rin po che dbang gi rgyal po'i kha dog lta bus gdul bar bya ba yin na ni de dag gis kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku nor bu rin po che dbang gi rgyal po'i kha dog tu mthong ngo //🔽gal te sems can rnams nor bu rin po che rgya mtsho'i gnas rnam par dag pa rin po che bkod pa kun nas 'od zer snang ba'i kha dog lta bus gdul bar bya ba yin na ni de dag gis kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku nor bu rin
analyzed: @185b gal te sems can rnams nor bu rin po che dbang gi rgyal po'i kha dog lta bus gdul bar bya ba yin na ni de dag gis kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku nor bu rin po che dbang gi rgyal po'i kha dog tu mthong ngo // gal te sems can rnams nor bu rin po che rgya mtsho'i gnas rnam par dag pa rin po che bkod pa kun nas 'od zer snang ba'i kha dog lta bus gdul bar bya ba yin na ni de dag gis kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku nor bu rin
translated: If sentient beings are to be guided by the color of the sovereign wish-fulfilling jewel, they will see the Tathāgata’s body as the color of the sovereign wish-fulfilling jewel.

original: po che rgya mtsho'i gnas rnam par dag pa rin po che bkod pa kun nas 'od zer snang ba'i kha dog tu mthong ngo //
analyzed: po che rgya mtsho'i gnas rnam par dag pa rin po che bkod pa kun nas 'od zer snang ba'i kha dog tu mthong ngo //
translated: If sentient beings are to be guided by the color of the pure array of jewels that is the abode of the ocean, they will see the Tathāgata’s body as the color of the pure array of jewels that is the abode of the ocean.

original: gal te sems can rnams nor bu rin po che'i rgyal po seng ge ral pa can gyi kha dog lta bus gdul bar bya ba yin na ni de dag gis kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku nor bu rin po che'i rgyal po seng ge ral pa can gyi🔽kha dog tu mthong ngo //🔽gal te sems can rnams nor bu rin po che seng ge'i rgyal mtshan gyi rtse mo'i kha dog lta bus gdul bar bya ba yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te sems can rnams nor bu rin po che'i rgyal po seng ge ral pa can gyi kha dog lta bus gdul bar bya ba yin na ni de dag gis kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku nor bu rin po che'i rgyal po seng ge ral pa can gyi kha dog tu mthong ngo // gal te sems can rnams nor bu rin po che seng ge'i rgyal mtshan gyi rtse mo'i kha dog lta bus gdul bar bya ba yin na ni /
translated: If beings are to be guided by the color of the king of precious jewels, the lion’s mane, then they will see the Tathāgata’s body as the color of the king of precious jewels, the lion’s mane.

original: de dag gis kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku nor bu rin po che seng ge'i rgyal mtshan gyi rtse mo'i kha dog tu mthong ngo //
analyzed: de dag gis kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku nor bu rin po che seng ge'i rgyal mtshan gyi rtse mo'i kha dog tu mthong ngo //
translated: If beings are to be guided by the color of the precious jewel at the top of the lion’s banner, then they will see the Tathāgata’s body as the color of the precious jewel at the top of the lion’s banner.

original: 'jam dpal / gal te sems can rnams nor bu rin po che glog gi sgron ma'i kha dog lta bus gdul bar bya ba yin na ni de dag gis kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku nor bu rin po che glog gi sgron ma'i kha dog tu mthong @186a *//
analyzed: 'jam dpal / gal te sems can rnams nor bu rin po che glog gi sgron ma'i kha dog lta bus gdul bar bya ba yin na ni de dag gis kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku nor bu rin po che glog gi sgron ma'i kha dog tu mthong @186a *//
translated: Mañjuśrī, if beings are to be guided by the color of the precious jewel of the lightning lamp, then they will see the Tathāgata’s body as the color of the precious jewel of the lightning lamp.

original: ngo; ;gal te sems can rnams nor bu rin po che chu 'dang gi kha dog lta bus gdul bar bya ba yin na ni de dag gis kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku nor bu rin po che chu 'dang gi kha dog tu mthong ngo //🔽de bzhin du sems can rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten skyong ba'i kha dog tu mthong bas gdul bar bya ba'ang yin na ni de dag gis kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang /
analyzed: ngo; ;gal te sems can rnams nor bu rin po che chu 'dang gi kha dog lta bus gdul bar bya ba yin na ni de dag gis kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku nor bu rin po che chu 'dang gi kha dog tu mthong ngo // de bzhin du sems can rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten skyong ba'i kha dog tu mthong bas gdul bar bya ba'ang yin na ni de dag gis kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang /
translated: If sentient beings are to be guided by the color of the wish-fulfilling jewel, then they will see the Tathāgata’s body as the color of the wish-fulfilling jewel.

original: 'jig rten skyong ba'i kha dog tu mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'jig rten skyong ba'i kha dog tu mthong ngo //
translated: In the same way, if sentient beings are to be guided by seeing the Tathāgata’s body as the color of Śakra, Brahmā, or the world guardians, then they will see the Tathāgata’s body as the color of Śakra, Brahmā, or the world guardians.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te sems can rnams sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dvags dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten du skyes pa'i bar gyi kha dog gis gdul bar bya ba yin na ni de dag gis kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku sems can dmyal ba dang /🔽dud 'gro dang / yi dvags dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten du skyes pa'i bar gyi kha dog tu mthong ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te sems can rnams sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dvags dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten du skyes pa'i bar gyi kha dog gis gdul bar bya ba yin na ni de dag gis kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dvags dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten du skyes pa'i bar gyi kha dog tu mthong ngo //
translated: In the same way, if beings are to be guided by the color of the beings in the hells, the animal realm, the world of hungry ghosts, and the world of the Lord of Death, then the Tathāgata’s body appears to them in the color of the beings in the hells, the animal realm, the world of hungry ghosts, and the world of the Lord of Death.🔽If beings are to be guided by the color of the gods, then the Tathāgata appears to them in the color of the gods.

original: gzugs med par skyes pa'i bar gyi gzugs dang / lus dang / kha dog dang / spyod lam gang dang / gang gis sems can rnams 'dul bar 'gyur ba'i gzugs dang; lus dang / kha dog dang / spyod lam de dang / de lta bu de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzugs med par skyes pa'i bar gyi gzugs dang / lus dang / kha dog dang / spyod lam gang dang / gang gis sems can rnams 'dul bar 'gyur ba'i gzugs dang; lus dang / kha dog dang / spyod lam de dang / de lta bu de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ngo //
translated: If beings are to be guided by the color of the form realm, the formless realm, or any form, body, color, or deportment, then the Tathāgata appears to them in that form, body, color, and deportment.

original: de bzhin du sgo nga las skyes pa dang / mngal nas skyes pa dang / drod gsher @186b las skyes pa dang / rdzus te skyes pa dang / gzugs can dang / gzugs can ma yin pa dang / 'du shes can dang / 'du shes can ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du sgo nga las skyes pa dang / mngal nas skyes pa dang / drod gsher @186b las skyes pa dang / rdzus te skyes pa dang / gzugs can dang / gzugs can ma yin pa dang / 'du shes can dang / 'du shes can ma yin pa dang /
translated: In the same way, the Tathāgata is seen in the form, body, color, and deportment of beings born from eggs, born from wombs, born from heat and moisture, and born miraculously; in the form, body, color, and deportment of those with form, those without form, those with perception, those without perception,🔽and those with neither perception nor non-perception. In whatever form, body, color, and deportment beings are to be disciplined, the Tathāgata is seen in that very form, body, color, and deportment.

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi sems can rnams kyi gzugs dang / lus dang / kha dog dang / spyod lam gang dang / gang gis 'dul bar 'gyur ba'i gzugs dang / lus dang / kha dog dang / spyod lam de dang / der de bzhin gshegs pa mthong yang de bzhin gshegs pa ni sems can 'di dag gis gser gyi kha dog mthong bar gyur la /
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi sems can rnams kyi gzugs dang / lus dang / kha dog dang / spyod lam gang dang / gang gis 'dul bar 'gyur ba'i gzugs dang / lus dang / kha dog dang / spyod lam de dang / der de bzhin gshegs pa mthong yang de bzhin gshegs pa ni sems can 'di dag gis gser gyi kha dog mthong bar gyur la /
translated: But may these beings see the Tathāgata as having the color of gold,

original: nor bu rin po che bee d'urya'i kha dog tu mthong bar ni ma gyur cig /
analyzed: nor bu rin po che bee d'urya'i kha dog tu mthong bar ni ma gyur cig /
translated: and may they not see him as having the color of a beryl gem.

original: sems can 'di dag gis ni nor bu rin po che bee d'urya'i kha dog tu mthong bar gyur la /
analyzed: sems can 'di dag gis ni nor bu rin po che bee d'urya'i kha dog tu mthong bar gyur la /
translated: May these beings see the Tathāgata as having the color of a beryl gem,🔽and may they not see him as having the color of a crystal gem.

original: nor bu rin po che aanda rnyil gyi kha dog tu mthong bar ni ma gyur cig /
analyzed: nor bu rin po che aanda rnyil gyi kha dog tu mthong bar ni ma gyur cig /
translated: May they not see the color of the precious sapphire.

original: sems can 'di dag gis ni nor bu rin po che aanda rnyil gyi kha dog tu mthong bar gyur la /
analyzed: sems can 'di dag gis ni nor bu rin po che aanda rnyil gyi kha dog tu mthong bar gyur la /
translated: May these beings see the color of the precious sapphire.🔽May they not see the color of the precious great lapis lazuli.

original: nor bu rin po che mthon ka chen po'i kha dog tu mthong bar ni ma gyur cig ;sems can 'di dag gis ni nor bu rin po che mthon ka chen po'i kha dog tu mthong bar gyur la /
analyzed: nor bu rin po che mthon ka chen po'i kha dog tu mthong bar ni ma gyur cig ;sems can 'di dag gis ni nor bu rin po che mthon ka chen po'i kha dog tu mthong bar gyur la /
translated: May these beings see the color of the precious great lapis lazuli.

original: nor bu rin po che 'od thams cad bsdus pa'i kha dog tu mthong bar ni ma gyur cig /
analyzed: nor bu rin po che 'od thams cad bsdus pa'i kha dog tu mthong bar ni ma gyur cig /
translated: May they not see the color of the precious jewel that gathers all lights.

original: sems can 'di dag gis ni nor bu rin po che 'od thams cad bsdus pa'i kha dog tu mthong bar gyur la /🔽nor bu rin po che dbang gi rgyal po'i kha dog tu mthong @187a *//
analyzed: sems can 'di dag gis ni nor bu rin po che 'od thams cad bsdus pa'i kha dog tu mthong bar gyur la / nor bu rin po che dbang gi rgyal po'i kha dog tu mthong @187a *//
translated: May these beings see the color of the precious jewel that gathers all lights.

original: bar ni ma gyur cig /
analyzed: bar ni ma gyur cig /
translated: May they not see the color of the precious king of jewels.

original: sems can 'di dag gis ni nor bu rin po che dbang gi rgyal po'i kha dog tu mthong bar gyur la /
analyzed: sems can 'di dag gis ni nor bu rin po che dbang gi rgyal po'i kha dog tu mthong bar gyur la /
translated: May these beings see the color of the precious king of jewels.

original: nor bu rin po che rgya mtsho'i gnas rnam par dag pa rin po che bkod pa kun nas 'od zer snang ba'i kha dog tu mthong bar ni ma gyur cig /
analyzed: nor bu rin po che rgya mtsho'i gnas rnam par dag pa rin po che bkod pa kun nas 'od zer snang ba'i kha dog tu mthong bar ni ma gyur cig /
translated: May they not see the ocean’s pure realm of precious jewels as the color of the light of the all-illuminating array of precious jewels.

original: sems can 'di dag gis ni nor bu rin po che rgya mtsho'i gnas rnam par dag pa rin po che bkod pa kun nas 'od zer snang ba'i kha dog tu mthong bar gyur la /
analyzed: sems can 'di dag gis ni nor bu rin po che rgya mtsho'i gnas rnam par dag pa rin po che bkod pa kun nas 'od zer snang ba'i kha dog tu mthong bar gyur la /
translated: May these beings see the ocean’s pure realm of precious jewels as the color of the light of the all-illuminating array of precious jewels,

original: nor bu rin po che'i rgyal po seng ge ral pa can gyi kha dog tu mthong bar ni ma gyur cig /
analyzed: nor bu rin po che'i rgyal po seng ge ral pa can gyi kha dog tu mthong bar ni ma gyur cig /
translated: but may they not see it as the color of the precious king of jewels, the lion’s mane.

original: sems can 'di dag gis ni nor bu rin po che'i rgyal po seng ge ral pa can gyi kha dog tu mthong bar gyur la /
analyzed: sems can 'di dag gis ni nor bu rin po che'i rgyal po seng ge ral pa can gyi kha dog tu mthong bar gyur la /
translated: May these beings see the ocean’s pure realm of precious jewels as the color of the precious king of jewels, the lion’s mane,

original: nor bu rin po che seng ge'i rgyal mtshan gyi rtse mo'i kha dog tu mthong bar ni ma gyur cig /
analyzed: nor bu rin po che seng ge'i rgyal mtshan gyi rtse mo'i kha dog tu mthong bar ni ma gyur cig /
translated: but may they not see it as the color of the precious jewel at the top of the lion victory banner.

original: sems can 'di dag gis ni nor bu rin po che seng ge'i rgyal mtshan gyi rtse mo'i kha dog tu mthong bar gyur la /
analyzed: sems can 'di dag gis ni nor bu rin po che seng ge'i rgyal mtshan gyi rtse mo'i kha dog tu mthong bar gyur la /
translated: May these beings see the ocean’s pure realm of precious jewels as the color of the precious jewel at the top of the lion victory banner,🔽but may they not see it as the color of the precious jewel of the king of the ocean’s crest.

original: nor bu rin po che rgya byin thogs pa'i kha dog tu mthong bar ni ma gyur cig /
analyzed: nor bu rin po che rgya byin thogs pa'i kha dog tu mthong bar ni ma gyur cig /
translated: May they not see the precious jewel held by Indra in its true color.

original: sems can 'di dag gis ni nor bu rin po che brgya byin thogs pa'i kha dog tu mthong bar gyur la /
analyzed: sems can 'di dag gis ni nor bu rin po che brgya byin thogs pa'i kha dog tu mthong bar gyur la /
translated: May these beings see the precious jewel held by Indra in its true color,

original: nor bu rin po che rdo rje snang ba'i kha dog tu mthong bar ni ma gyur cig /
analyzed: nor bu rin po che rdo rje snang ba'i kha dog tu mthong bar ni ma gyur cig /
translated: but may they not see the precious jewel of the shining vajra in its true color.

original: sems can 'di dag gis ni nor bu rin po che rdo rje snang ba'i kha dog tu mthong bar gyur la /
analyzed: sems can 'di dag gis ni nor bu rin po che rdo rje snang ba'i kha dog tu mthong bar gyur la /
translated: May these beings see the precious jewel of the shining vajra in its true color,

original: nor bu rin po che lha thams cad snang ba'i @187b kha dog tu mthong bar ni ma gyur cig /
analyzed: nor bu rin po che lha thams cad snang ba'i @187b kha dog tu mthong bar ni ma gyur cig /
translated: but may they not see the precious jewel that illuminates all the gods in its true color.

original: sems can 'di dag gis ni nor bu rin po che lha thams cad snang ba'i kha dog tu mthong bar gyur la /
analyzed: sems can 'di dag gis ni nor bu rin po che lha thams cad snang ba'i kha dog tu mthong bar gyur la /
translated: May these beings see the precious jewel that illuminates all the gods in its true color,

original: nor bu rin po che nyi zla snang ba'i kha dog tu mthong bar ni ma gyur cig /
analyzed: nor bu rin po che nyi zla snang ba'i kha dog tu mthong bar ni ma gyur cig /
translated: but may they not see the precious jewel that illuminates the sun and moon in its true color.

original: sems can 'di dag gis ni nor bu rin po che nyi zla snang ba'i kha dog tu mthong bar gyur la /
analyzed: sems can 'di dag gis ni nor bu rin po che nyi zla snang ba'i kha dog tu mthong bar gyur la /
translated: May these beings see the precious jewel that illuminates the sun and moon in its true color,

original: nor bu rin po che glog gi sgron ma'i kha dog tu mthong bar ni ma gyur cig /
analyzed: nor bu rin po che glog gi sgron ma'i kha dog tu mthong bar ni ma gyur cig /
translated: May they not see the precious jewel as the color of lightning.

original: sems can 'di dag gis ni nor bu rin po che glog gi sgron ma'i kha dog tu mthong bar gyur la /
analyzed: sems can 'di dag gis ni nor bu rin po che glog gi sgron ma'i kha dog tu mthong bar gyur la /
translated: May these beings see the precious jewel as the color of lightning,

original: nor bu rin po che'i rgyal po yid bzhin gyi kha dog tu mthong bar ni ma gyur cig ces mi rtog /
analyzed: nor bu rin po che'i rgyal po yid bzhin gyi kha dog tu mthong bar ni ma gyur cig ces mi rtog /
translated: but may they not see the precious king of jewels as the color of the wish-fulfilling gem.

original: rnam par mi rtog go /🔽de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog go / de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: ’ He does not think like that, and he does not conceptualize like that.

original: 'gro ba thams cad du skyes pa'i sems can rnams la'ang brjod par bya ste /🔽'jam dpal / de bzhin gshegs pa ni mi rtog /
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad du skyes pa'i sems can rnams la'ang brjod par bya ste / 'jam dpal / de bzhin gshegs pa ni mi rtog /
translated: In the same way, it should be said of all beings born in all the world systems in the ten directions.

original: rnam par mi rtog mod kyi /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog mod kyi /
translated: Mañjuśrī, the Tathāgata does not think or conceptualize,

original: 'on kyang lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par de'i mdzad pa de lta bu de 'byung ngo ////🔽bam po gnyis pa /
analyzed: 'on kyang lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par de'i mdzad pa de lta bu de 'byung ngo //// bam po gnyis pa /
translated: but nevertheless, without any deliberation, such is his activity.

original: 'jam dpal / dper na /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / dper na /
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is like this:

original: nor bu rin po che dbang gi rgyal po gang du 'byung ba der lcags dang / lcags las byas pa'i yo byad rnams mi 'byung mod kyi /
analyzed: nor bu rin po che dbang gi rgyal po gang du 'byung ba der lcags dang / lcags las byas pa'i yo byad rnams mi 'byung mod kyi /
translated: Wherever the precious king of jewels appears, iron and iron products do not appear.

original: 'jam dpal / 'on kyang nor bu rin po che dbang gi rgyal po ni mi rtog /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / 'on kyang nor bu rin po che dbang gi rgyal po ni mi rtog /
translated: Mañjuśrī, however, the precious jewel, the king of gems, is nonconceptual.

original: rnam par mi rtog ste /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, however, the sovereign wish-fulfilling jewel does not think,

original: 'di snyam du bdag gang du 'byung ba der lcags dang / lcags las byas pa'i yo byad rnams 'byung bar ma @188a *//
analyzed: 'di snyam du bdag gang du 'byung ba der lcags dang / lcags las byas pa'i yo byad rnams 'byung bar ma @188a *//
translated: ‘Wherever I am, let there be no iron or iron-based objects.

original: gyur cig snyam du mi sems mod kyi /
analyzed: gyur cig snyam du mi sems mod kyi /
translated: But you do not think, May they be so!🔽

original: 'on kyang lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par de'i bya ba de lta bu de 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'on kyang lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par de'i bya ba de lta bu de 'byung ngo //
translated: But still, without thinking, without conceptualizing, that activity occurs spontaneously.

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi zhing gang du de bzhin gshegs pa byung ba der mu stegs can spyod pa pa dang / kun tu rgyu dang / gcer bu pa la sogs pa mu stegs can gyi gnas thams cad mi 'byung /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi zhing gang du de bzhin gshegs pa byung ba der mu stegs can spyod pa pa dang / kun tu rgyu dang / gcer bu pa la sogs pa mu stegs can gyi gnas thams cad mi 'byung /
translated: Mañjuśrī, in the same way, in a buddhafield where a thus-gone one has appeared, no tīrthikas, such as Ājīvikas, Pārasīkas, or naked ascetics, will appear.

original: der lta bar gyur pa thams cad mi 'byung /
analyzed: der lta bar gyur pa thams cad mi 'byung /
translated: No views will appear there.

original: der 'khrug pa thams cad mi 'byung /🔽der mtshams med pa lnga po dag mi 'byung /
analyzed: der 'khrug pa thams cad mi 'byung / der mtshams med pa lnga po dag mi 'byung /
translated: No conflicts will appear there.🔽No acts of immediate retribution will appear there.

original: der mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams mi 'byung /
analyzed: der mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams mi 'byung /
translated: No paths of nonvirtuous action will appear there.

original: der rgyal po'i bka' lung dang / chos gces pa 'dor ba mi 'byung /
analyzed: der rgyal po'i bka' lung dang / chos gces pa 'dor ba mi 'byung /
translated: There, the king’s orders and the cherished Dharma will not be abandoned.

original: der nyi zla'i 'od dag mi 'byung /
analyzed: der nyi zla'i 'od dag mi 'byung /
translated: There, the light of the sun and moon do not shine.

original: der brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten skyong ba dag dang lha thams cad kyi 'od dag mi 'byung /
analyzed: der brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten skyong ba dag dang lha thams cad kyi 'od dag mi 'byung /
translated: There, the light of Śakra, Brahmā, the Lokapālas, and all the gods do not shine.

original: der nor bu rin po che'i 'od rnams dang / me'i 'od rnams dang / glog gi 'od rnams mi 'byung /
analyzed: der nor bu rin po che'i 'od rnams dang / me'i 'od rnams dang / glog gi 'od rnams mi 'byung /
translated: There, the light of precious jewels, the light of fire, and the light of lightning do not shine.

original: der yud tsam dang / yud tsam phyed dang / zla ba dang / zla ba phyed dang / lor bgrang ba rnams mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: der yud tsam dang / yud tsam phyed dang / zla ba dang / zla ba phyed dang / lor bgrang ba rnams mi 'byung ste /
translated: There, the counting of moments, half-moments, months, half-months, and years does not occur.

original: 'jam dpal / gzhan dun sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs ni ma gtogs so //🔽'jam dpal / de bzhin gshegs pa ni mi rtog /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / gzhan dun sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs ni ma gtogs so // 'jam dpal / de bzhin gshegs pa ni mi rtog /
translated: Mañjuśrī, except for the blessing of the Tathāgata in order to ripen sentient beings.

original: rnam par mi rtog ste /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, the Tathāgata does not think or conceptualize.

original: 'on kyang sems can gyi dbang gis @188b lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par de'i mdzad pa de lta bu de 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'on kyang sems can gyi dbang gis @188b lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par de'i mdzad pa de lta bu de 'byung ngo //
translated: Nevertheless, by the power of sentient beings, that deed of his occurs spontaneously and non-conceptually.

original: 'jam dpal / dper na /🔽nor bu rin po che mthong ka chen po'i 'od kyis reg pa de dag thams cad nor bu rin po che mthon ka chen po'i kha dog tu 'gyur yang nor bu rin po cha mthon ka chen po ni mi rtog /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / dper na / nor bu rin po che mthong ka chen po'i 'od kyis reg pa de dag thams cad nor bu rin po che mthon ka chen po'i kha dog tu 'gyur yang nor bu rin po cha mthon ka chen po ni mi rtog /
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is like this:

original: rnam par mi rtog ste /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog ste /
translated: All those who are touched by the light of the great vaiḍūrya gem become the color of the great vaiḍūrya gem, but the great vaiḍūrya gem does not think or conceptualize.

original: 'on kyang lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par de'i bya ba de lta bu de 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'on kyang lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par de'i bya ba de lta bu de 'byung ngo //
translated: Nevertheless, without deliberation or thought, such activity occurs spontaneously.

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du gang dag de bzhin gshegs pa la dmigs pa'i yid la byed pa'i 'od kyis reg pa de dag thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi kha dog tu 'gyur yang de bzhin gshegs pa ni mi rtog /🔽rnam par mi rtog ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du gang dag de bzhin gshegs pa la dmigs pa'i yid la byed pa'i 'od kyis reg pa de dag thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi kha dog tu 'gyur yang de bzhin gshegs pa ni mi rtog / rnam par mi rtog ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, in the same way, all those who are touched by the light of the attention focused on the Tathāgata become the color of omniscience, but the Tathāgata does not think or conceptualize.

original: 'on kyang 'jam dpal lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzad pa de lta bu de 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'jam dpal lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzad pa de lta bu de 'byung ngo //
translated: Nevertheless, Mañjuśrī, such activity of the Tathāgata occurs spontaneously, without deliberation or thought.

original: 'jam dpal / dper na /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / dper na /
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is like this:

original: nor bu rin po che chen po bee d'urya byi dor legs par byas pa mgo'i rgyan nam /🔽mgul ba'i rgyan nam /
analyzed: nor bu rin po che chen po bee d'urya byi dor legs par byas pa mgo'i rgyan nam / mgul ba'i rgyan nam /
translated: It is like a polished precious gem of beryl that is worn as a head ornament,🔽or a necklace,

original: lag pa'i rgyan nam /
analyzed: lag pa'i rgyan nam /
translated: or an armlet,

original: rkang pa'i rgyan yang rung ste /
analyzed: rkang pa'i rgyan yang rung ste /
translated: or an anklet.

original: gang dang / gang gis logs na rgyan du 'dug pa de dang / der rgyan du shin tu lam me /
analyzed: gang dang / gang gis logs na rgyan du 'dug pa de dang / der rgyan du shin tu lam me /
translated: Wherever it is placed, it is very bright,

original: lhan ne / lhang nge'o //
analyzed: lhan ne / lhang nge'o //
translated: shining, and radiant.

original: nor bu rin po che bee d'urya de nyid kyi mthus rgyan de dag kyang shin tu lam me /
analyzed: nor bu rin po che bee d'urya de nyid kyi mthus rgyan de dag kyang shin tu lam me /
translated: By the power of that precious gem of beryl, those ornaments are very bright,🔽shining, and radiant.

original: lhan ne / lhang nger 'dug kyang nor bu rin po che chen po bee d'urya mi rtog /🔽rnam par mi rtog ste /🔽'on kyang lhun @189a *//
analyzed: lhan ne / lhang nger 'dug kyang nor bu rin po che chen po bee d'urya mi rtog / rnam par mi rtog ste / 'on kyang lhun @189a *//
translated: But the precious gem of beryl does not think or conceptualize.

original: kyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par de'i bya ba de lta bu de 'byung ngo //
analyzed: kyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par de'i bya ba de lta bu de 'byung ngo //
translated: Nevertheless, that action occurs spontaneously and nonconceptually.

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyang spyod lam gyi gnas gang dang / gang gis nyan thos kyi spyod pa'am /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyang spyod lam gyi gnas gang dang / gang gis nyan thos kyi spyod pa'am /
translated: Mañjuśrī, in the same way, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, by whatever conduct he abides in, whether the conduct of a śrāvaka,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi spyod pa'am /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi spyod pa'am /
translated: the conduct of a pratyekabuddha,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa 'am; de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod pa'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa 'am; de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod pa'am /
translated: the conduct of a bodhisattva, the conduct of a tathāgata,

original: spyod pa po dang / kun tu rgyu dang / gcer bu pa'i spyod pa'am /
analyzed: spyod pa po dang / kun tu rgyu dang / gcer bu pa'i spyod pa'am /
translated: the conduct of a practitioner, a wandering mendicant, or a naked ascetic,

original: dud 'gro dang / yi dvags dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten dang / sha za dang / grul bum dang / srin po'i spyod pa'am /
analyzed: dud 'gro dang / yi dvags dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten dang / sha za dang / grul bum dang / srin po'i spyod pa'am /
translated: the conduct of an animal, a hungry ghost, a world of Yama, a flesh-eater, a kumbhāṇḍa, or a rākṣasa,

original: lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za'i spyod pa'am /
analyzed: lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za'i spyod pa'am /
translated: the conduct of a god, a nāga, a yakṣa, or a gandharva,

original: spyod pa gang dang / gang la gnas pa'i spyod pa de dang / de nyid shin tu lam me /
analyzed: spyod pa gang dang / gang la gnas pa'i spyod pa de dang / de nyid shin tu lam me /
translated: whatever conduct he abides in, that very conduct is extremely radiant,

original: lhan ne / lhang nge'o //
analyzed: lhan ne / lhang nge'o //
translated: luminous, and clear.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa de nyid kyi mthus spyod pa de shin tu lam me /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de nyid kyi mthus spyod pa de shin tu lam me /
translated: By the power of the Tathāgata himself, that conduct is extremely radiant,

original: lhan ne / lhang nger rnam par mdzes kyang 'jam dpal /
analyzed: lhan ne / lhang nger rnam par mdzes kyang 'jam dpal /
translated: It is beautiful,🔽clear, and radiant.🔽

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni mi rtog /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni mi rtog /

analyzed: 'on kyang lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par de'i mdzad pa de lta bu de 'byung ngo //
translated: Nevertheless, his deeds occur spontaneously and non-conceptually.

original: 'jam dpal / dper na /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / dper na /
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is like this:

original: sa la gnas /
analyzed: sa la gnas /
translated: Based on the earth,

original: sa la brten nas sa bon thams cad dang / rtsva dang / shing gel pa dang / sman dang / nags tshal rnams skye zhing 'phel la shin tu @189b rgyas pa nyid du 'gyur yang /
analyzed: sa la brten nas sa bon thams cad dang / rtsva dang / shing gel pa dang / sman dang / nags tshal rnams skye zhing 'phel la shin tu @189b rgyas pa nyid du 'gyur yang /
translated: all seeds, grasses, bushes, medicinal herbs, and forests grow, increase, and flourish.

original: 'jam dpal / sa ni mi rtog /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / sa ni mi rtog /
translated: Mañjuśrī, the earth is nonconceptual and

original: rnam par mi rtog ste /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog ste /
translated: non-discriminating.

original: 'on kyang lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par de'i bya ba de lta bu de 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'on kyang lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par de'i bya ba de lta bu de 'byung ngo //
translated: Nevertheless, its activities occur spontaneously and non-conceptually.

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa la gnas /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa la gnas /
translated: Mañjuśrī, in the same way, based on the Tathāgata,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la brten nas sems can thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad skye zhing 'phel te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la brten nas sems can thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad skye zhing 'phel te /
translated: the roots of virtue of all sentient beings grow and increase.

original: shin tu rgyas pa nyid du 'gyur yang de bzhin gshegs pa ni mi rtog /
analyzed: shin tu rgyas pa nyid du 'gyur yang de bzhin gshegs pa ni mi rtog /
translated: Although it is the extensive display, the Thus-Gone One is nonconceptual.

original: rnam par mi rtog ste /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog ste /
translated: He is free from conceptualization.

original: 'on kyang lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par de'i mdzad pa de lta bu de 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'on kyang lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par de'i mdzad pa de lta bu de 'byung ngo //
translated: Nevertheless, his deeds occur spontaneously and nonconceptually.

original: 'jam dpal / dper na /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / dper na /
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is like this:

original: sprin chen pos dzambu'i gling thams cad khebs par byas nas rtsva dang / shing gel ba dang / sman dang / nags tshal rnam pa tha dad pa rnams su char pa chen po rab tu bab ste /
analyzed: sprin chen pos dzambu'i gling thams cad khebs par byas nas rtsva dang / shing gel ba dang / sman dang / nags tshal rnam pa tha dad pa rnams su char pa chen po rab tu bab ste /
translated: A great cloud covers the entire world of Jambudvīpa and sends down a great rain on the various types of grass, bushes, herbs, and forests.

original: ro gcig pa'i chu'i rgyun des rtsva dang / shing gel ba dang / sman dang / nags tshal rnam pa tha dad pa rnams skye bar byed cing gnas rnam pa tha dad pa rnams su chu de ro tha dad pa dang / kha dog tha dad par yang gnas la /
analyzed: ro gcig pa'i chu'i rgyun des rtsva dang / shing gel ba dang / sman dang / nags tshal rnam pa tha dad pa rnams skye bar byed cing gnas rnam pa tha dad pa rnams su chu de ro tha dad pa dang / kha dog tha dad par yang gnas la /
translated: The water that has a single taste causes the various types of grass, bushes, herbs, and forests to grow. In the various places, that water has different tastes and different colors.

original: 'jam dpal / sprin ni mi rtog /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / sprin ni mi rtog /
translated: Mañjuśrī, the cloud is nonconceptual.

original: rnam par mi rtog ste /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog ste /
translated: It is free from conceptualization.

original: 'on kyang lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par bya ba tha dad pa rnams 'byung ngo //🔽'jam dpal / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i @190a *//
analyzed: 'on kyang lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par bya ba tha dad pa rnams 'byung ngo // 'jam dpal / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i @190a *//
translated: Nevertheless, they arise separately, spontaneously and non-conceptually.

original: sangs rgyas kyang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams rab 'byams thams cad sangs rgyas kyi sku'i sprin gyis khyab par mdzad de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams rab 'byams thams cad sangs rgyas kyi sku'i sprin gyis khyab par mdzad de /
translated: Mañjuśrī, in the same way, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, covers the entire infinite world systems of the ten directions with clouds of Buddha-bodies.

original: sems can dge ba'i rtsa ba sna tshogs bsags pa /
analyzed: sems can dge ba'i rtsa ba sna tshogs bsags pa /
translated: For sentient beings who have accumulated various roots of virtue,

original: smon lam dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa dang / mos pa tha dad cing mos pa tha dad pa la gnas pa /
analyzed: smon lam dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa dang / mos pa tha dad cing mos pa tha dad pa la gnas pa /
translated: who have different aspirations, superior intentions, and interests, and who abide in different interests,

original: thams cad la chos kyi char chen po mngon par phab ste /
analyzed: thams cad la chos kyi char chen po mngon par phab ste /
translated: he sends down a great rain of Dharma.

original: 'jam dpal / chos kyi char de'ang ro gcig pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / chos kyi char de'ang ro gcig pa yin mod kyi /
translated: Mañjuśrī, although that rain of Dharma has one taste,

original: 'jam dpal / sems can dge ba'i rtsa ba sna tshogs bsags pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / sems can dge ba'i rtsa ba sna tshogs bsags pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī, for sentient beings who have accumulated various roots of virtue,

original: smon lam dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa dang / mos pa tha dad cing mos pa tha dad pa la gnas pa /
analyzed: smon lam dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa dang / mos pa tha dad cing mos pa tha dad pa la gnas pa /
translated: who have different aspirations, superior intentions, and interests, and who abide in different interests,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / smon lam dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa dang / mos pa tha dad pa la zhugs pa rnams la rnam pa tha dad pa nyid kyi chos tha dad pa kho na'i char bas nus pa ji lta ba dang / mthu ji lta ba bzhin du dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed kyang /🔽'jam dpal / de bzhin gshegs pa ni mi rtog /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / smon lam dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa dang / mos pa tha dad pa la zhugs pa rnams la rnam pa tha dad pa nyid kyi chos tha dad pa kho na'i char bas nus pa ji lta ba dang / mthu ji lta ba bzhin du dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed kyang / 'jam dpal / de bzhin gshegs pa ni mi rtog /
translated: He is able to generate the roots of virtue in those who have entered into different roots of virtue, aspirations, superior intentions, and interests, in accordance with their different aspects and in accordance with their abilities and powers.

original: rnam par mi rtog ste /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, the Tathāgata does not think or conceptualize.

original: 'di lta ste /🔽sems can 'di dag la ni nyan thos kyi ye shes su 'gyur ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dag rnam par bskyed par bya'o //🔽sems can 'di dag la ni sangs rgyas kyi ye shes su 'gyur ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dag rnam par bskyed pa bya'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste / sems can 'di dag la ni nyan thos kyi ye shes su 'gyur ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dag rnam par bskyed par bya'o // sems can 'di dag la ni sangs rgyas kyi ye shes su 'gyur ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dag rnam par bskyed pa bya'o //
translated: He is like this:🔽‘In these sentient beings, I will generate the roots of virtue that will lead to the wisdom of the hearers.🔽In these sentient beings, I will generate the roots of virtue that will lead to the wisdom of the solitary buddhas.

original: sems can 'di dag la ni sangs @190b rgyas kyi ye shes su 'gyur ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dag rnam par bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can 'di dag la ni sangs @190b rgyas kyi ye shes su 'gyur ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dag rnam par bskyed par bya'o //
translated: In these sentient beings, I will generate the roots of virtue that will lead to the wisdom of the buddhas.’

original: sems can 'di dag la ni rgyal chen bzhi pa'i lha'i gnas su skye ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dag rnam par bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can 'di dag la ni rgyal chen bzhi pa'i lha'i gnas su skye ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dag rnam par bskyed par bya'o //
translated: I will create roots of virtue in these beings for being born in the realm of the Four Great Kings.

original: sems can 'di dag la ni sum cu rtsa gsum gyi gnas su skye ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dag rnam par bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can 'di dag la ni sum cu rtsa gsum gyi gnas su skye ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dag rnam par bskyed par bya'o //
translated: I will create roots of virtue in these beings for being born in the realm of the Thirty-Three.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te 'thab bral rnams dang / dga' ldan rnams dang / 'phrul dga' rnams dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed rnams dang / de bzhin du tshangs pa rnams dang / tshangs chen rnams dang / tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don rnams dang / 'od chung rnams dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te 'thab bral rnams dang / dga' ldan rnams dang / 'phrul dga' rnams dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed rnams dang / de bzhin du tshangs pa rnams dang / tshangs chen rnams dang / tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don rnams dang / 'od chung rnams dang /
translated: And to the same effect: in the Yāma realm, in the Tuṣita realm, in the Nirmāṇarati realm, in the Paranirmitavaśavartin realm, in the Brahmā realm, in the Mahā-brahmā realm, in the Brahmapurohita realm, in the Parīttābha realm,

original: tshad med 'od rnams dang / 'od gsal rnams dang / dge chung rnams dang / tshad med dge rnams dang / dge rgyas rnams dang / sprin med rnams dang / bsod nams skyes rnams dang / 'bras bu che ba rnams dang / mi che ba rnams dang /
analyzed: tshad med 'od rnams dang / 'od gsal rnams dang / dge chung rnams dang / tshad med dge rnams dang / dge rgyas rnams dang / sprin med rnams dang / bsod nams skyes rnams dang / 'bras bu che ba rnams dang / mi che ba rnams dang /
translated: the gods of the Heaven of Immeasurable Radiance, the Heaven of Luminous Radiance, the Heaven of Limited Virtue, the Heaven of Immeasurable Virtue, the Heaven of Perfected Virtue, the Heaven Free from Strife, the Heaven of Joy, the Heaven of Delighting in Emanations, the Heaven of Making Use of Others’ Emanations, and the Heaven of No Hardship,

original: mi gdung ba rnams dang / gya nom snang rnams dang; shin tu mthong rnams dang / gnas gtsang ma'i ris rnams dang / 'og min rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba dag rnam par bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: mi gdung ba rnams dang / gya nom snang rnams dang; shin tu mthong rnams dang / gnas gtsang ma'i ris rnams dang / 'og min rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba dag rnam par bskyed par bya'o //
translated: the Heaven of Excellent Vision, the Heaven of Perfect Vision, the Pure Abodes, and the Heaven of Supreme Peak, and the roots of virtue of the gods of the Heaven of No Thought.

original: bdud kyi ris kyi lha rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba dag rnam par bskyed par bya'o snyam du /
analyzed: bdud kyi ris kyi lha rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba dag rnam par bskyed par bya'o snyam du /
translated: I will cause the roots of virtue of the gods of the class of Māra to grow.”

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin gshegs pa ni mi rtog /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin gshegs pa ni mi rtog /
translated: Mañjuśrī, the Tathāgata does not think or conceptualize.

original: rnam par mi rtog go /🔽sems can 'di dag la ni rgyal por skye ba'i @191a *//
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog go / sems can 'di dag la ni rgyal por skye ba'i @191a *//
translated: He is without thought and without conceptualization.🔽‘I will cause the roots of virtue of various kinds that lead to rebirth as a king to grow in these sentient beings.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba sna tshogs dag rnam par bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba sna tshogs dag rnam par bskyed par bya'o //
translated: I will cause the roots of virtue of various kinds that lead to rebirth as a universal monarch to grow in these sentient beings.’

original: sems can 'di dag la ni mir skye ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba sna tshogs dag rnam par bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can 'di dag la ni mir skye ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba sna tshogs dag rnam par bskyed par bya'o //
translated: I will cause these sentient beings to generate various roots of virtue that lead to rebirth as a human.

original: sems can 'di dag la ni dbang phyug tu 'gyur ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba sna tshogs dag rnam par bskyed par bya'o snyam du /
analyzed: sems can 'di dag la ni dbang phyug tu 'gyur ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba sna tshogs dag rnam par bskyed par bya'o snyam du /
translated: I will cause these sentient beings to generate various roots of virtue that lead to rebirth as a powerful human.

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin gshegs pa ni mi rtog /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin gshegs pa ni mi rtog /
translated: Mañjuśrī, the Tathāgata does not think or conceptualize.

original: rnam par mi rtog ste /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog ste /
translated: He is nonconceptual.

original: 'on kyang de bzhin gshegs pa ni lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par sems can smon lam dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa dang / mos pa ji lta ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba ji ltar bsags pa bzhin du mdzad pa de lta bu de 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang de bzhin gshegs pa ni lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par sems can smon lam dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa dang / mos pa ji lta ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba ji ltar bsags pa bzhin du mdzad pa de lta bu de 'byung ste /
translated: Nevertheless, Mañjuśrī, the Tathāgata’s spontaneous and nonconceptual activity occurs in accordance with the aspirations, superior intentions, interests, and accumulated roots of virtue of sentient beings.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni thams cad du btang snyoms su bzhugs shing btang snyoms la rnam par mi rtog go /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni thams cad du btang snyoms su bzhugs shing btang snyoms la rnam par mi rtog go /
translated: The Tathāgata remains impartial toward all and is nonconceptual with regard to impartiality.

original: 'jam dpal / dper na /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / dper na /
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is like this:

original: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor shar ma thag tu 'od zer bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag grangs med pa btang bas dzambu'i gling gi mun pa mun nag thams cad med par 'gyur yang nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor ni mi rtog /
analyzed: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor shar ma thag tu 'od zer bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag grangs med pa btang bas dzambu'i gling gi mun pa mun nag thams cad med par 'gyur yang nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor ni mi rtog /
translated: As soon as the orb of the sun rises, it sends out countless hundreds of thousands of millions of billions of light rays, and all the darkness of the world is removed.

original: rnam par mi rtog ste /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog ste /
translated: But the orb of the sun does not think,🔽‘I will remove the darkness of the world.’

original: 'on kyang lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par bya ba de lta bu da 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'on kyang lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par bya ba de lta bu da 'byung ngo //
translated: And yet, Mañjuśrī, that is what happens, spontaneously and nonconceptually.

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor shar ma thag tu ye shes kyi 'od zer bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag @191b grangs med pa btang bas sems can rnams kyi lta bar 'gyur ba'i mun pa thams cad med par gyur te /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor shar ma thag tu ye shes kyi 'od zer bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag @191b grangs med pa btang bas sems can rnams kyi lta bar 'gyur ba'i mun pa thams cad med par gyur te /
translated: In the same way, Mañjuśrī, as soon as the orb of the sun of the Tathāgata rises, it sends out the light rays of wisdom, and all the darkness of the world of beings is removed.🔽But the Tathāgata does not think,

original: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis 'jig rten gyi khams su lta bar gyur pa 'byung ba ni ma gtogs so //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis 'jig rten gyi khams su lta bar gyur pa 'byung ba ni ma gtogs so //
translated: ‘I will remove the darkness of the world of beings.’🔽And yet, Mañjuśrī, that is what happens, spontaneously and nonconceptually.

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin gshegs pa ni ngas sems can rnams kyi lta bar gyur pa bsal la snyam mam /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin gshegs pa ni ngas sems can rnams kyi lta bar gyur pa bsal la snyam mam /
translated: Mañjuśrī, do you think that the Tathāgata thinks, ‘I will remove the views of sentient beings’?🔽🔽

original: bsal bar bya'o snyam du mi rtog /
analyzed: bsal bar bya'o snyam du mi rtog /
translated: Mañjuśrī, the Tathāgata does not think, ‘I will dispel the views of sentient beings,’ or ‘I will dispel the views of sentient beings.’

original: rnam par mi rtog mod kyi 'on kyang /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog mod kyi 'on kyang /
translated: He does not think or conceptualize.🔽Mañjuśrī,

original: 'jam dpal / lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzad pa de lta bu de 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzad pa de lta bu de 'byung ste /
translated: the Tathāgata’s activity is spontaneous and nonconceptual.

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin gshegs pa ni thams cad du rnam par mi rtog cing mnyam ste btang snyoms pa'o //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin gshegs pa ni thams cad du rnam par mi rtog cing mnyam ste btang snyoms pa'o //
translated: Mañjuśrī, the Tathāgata is impartial, nonconceptual, and the same in all respects.

original: 'jam dpal / dper na /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / dper na /
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is like this:

original: sgyu ma sprul pa ni sgyu ma mkhan gyi dbang gis bya ba rnam pa sna tshogs dang / lus tha dad pa sna tshogs ston kyang /
