analyzed: sgyu ma sprul pa ni sgyu ma mkhan gyi dbang gis bya ba rnam pa sna tshogs dang / lus tha dad pa sna tshogs ston kyang /
translated: An illusory emanation displays various activities and different bodies through the power of the magician.

original: 'jam dpal / sgyu ma sprul pa de ni brjod du med pa; ma skyes pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / sgyu ma sprul pa de ni brjod du med pa; ma skyes pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī, that illusory emanation is inexpressible, unborn,

original: ma 'gags pa /
analyzed: ma 'gags pa /
translated: unceased,

original: yi ge med pa /
analyzed: yi ge med pa /
translated: without syllables,

original: sgra med pa /
analyzed: sgra med pa /
translated: without sound,

original: yul med pa /
analyzed: yul med pa /
translated: without objects,

original: dngos po med pa /
analyzed: dngos po med pa /
translated: without things,

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa /
translated: inconceivable,

original: mtshan nyid med pa /
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa /
translated: without characteristics,

original: gnyis su med pa /
analyzed: gnyis su med pa /
translated: and nondual.

original: kun tu spyod pa med pa /
analyzed: kun tu spyod pa med pa /
translated: It is not a mental process.

original: chos kyi dbyings dang mnyam zhing gnyen po med pa yin yang /🔽'jam dpal / sgyu ma sprul pa ni sgyu ma mkhan gyi dbang gis lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par @192a *//
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings dang mnyam zhing gnyen po med pa yin yang / 'jam dpal / sgyu ma sprul pa ni sgyu ma mkhan gyi dbang gis lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par @192a *//
translated: It is equal to the realm of phenomena and has no antidote.

original: bya ba sna tshogs ston to //
analyzed: bya ba sna tshogs ston to //
translated: Mañjuśrī, an illusory emanation, through the power of the magician, manifests various actions spontaneously and without thought.

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyang sems can gyi dbang gis 'khor gyi nang na gzugs kyi sku dang / kha dog dang / sbyod pa dang / spyod lam dang / bya ba la 'jug pa'i gnas sna tshogs 'byung mod kyi /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyang sems can gyi dbang gis 'khor gyi nang na gzugs kyi sku dang / kha dog dang / sbyod pa dang / spyod lam dang / bya ba la 'jug pa'i gnas sna tshogs 'byung mod kyi /
translated: Mañjuśrī, in the same way, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfect and Complete Buddha, through the power of sentient beings, manifests various appearances in the midst of the assembly, such as the form body, color, conduct, deportment, and engagement in activities.

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin gshegs pa de ni brjod du med pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin gshegs pa de ni brjod du med pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī, the Tathāgata is inexpressible,

original: ma skyes pa /
analyzed: ma skyes pa /
translated: unborn,

original: ma 'gags pa /
analyzed: ma 'gags pa /
translated: unceasing,

original: yi ge med pa /
analyzed: yi ge med pa /
translated: without letters,

original: sgra med pa /
analyzed: sgra med pa /
translated: without sound,

original: yul med pa /
analyzed: yul med pa /
translated: without object,

original: dngos po med pa /
analyzed: dngos po med pa /
translated: without substance,

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa /
translated: inconceivable,

original: mtshan nyid med pa /
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa /
translated: without characteristics,

original: gnyis su med pa /
analyzed: gnyis su med pa /
translated: nondual,

original: kun tu spyod pa med pa /
analyzed: kun tu spyod pa med pa /
translated: and not a mental process.

original: chos kyi dbyings dang mtshungs shing gnyen po med pa /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings dang mtshungs shing gnyen po med pa /
translated: It is similar to the dharmadhātu and has no antidote.

original: khams gsum las yang dag par 'das pa ste /
analyzed: khams gsum las yang dag par 'das pa ste /
translated: It is beyond the three realms.

original: 'on kyang 'jam dpal de bzhin gshegs pa ni lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par sems can gyi dbang gis mdzad pa sna tshogs dag ston to /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'jam dpal de bzhin gshegs pa ni lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par sems can gyi dbang gis mdzad pa sna tshogs dag ston to /
translated: However, Mañjuśrī, the Tathāgata displays various activities effortlessly and nonconceptually due to the power of sentient beings.

original: 'jam dpal / dper na /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / dper na /
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is like this:

original: nyi ma ni gcig kho na yin na ri'i rgyal po ri rab kyi dbang gis gling bzhi rnams su sems can rnams kyis rnam pa mang po la mthong ste /🔽kha cig gis ni de 'char bar mthong /
analyzed: nyi ma ni gcig kho na yin na ri'i rgyal po ri rab kyi dbang gis gling bzhi rnams su sems can rnams kyis rnam pa mang po la mthong ste / kha cig gis ni de 'char bar mthong /
translated: The sun is only one, but due to the power of Sumeru, the king of mountains, sentient beings in the four continents see it in many ways.🔽Some see it rising.

original: kha cig gis ni shar zin par mthong /🔽kha cig gis bag dros pa tsam du mthong /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni shar zin par mthong / kha cig gis bag dros pa tsam du mthong /
translated: Some see it already risen.🔽Some see it as just dawn.

original: kha cig gis ni dros chen tsam du shes /🔽kha @192b cig gis ni nam phyed /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni dros chen tsam du shes / kha @192b cig gis ni nam phyed /
translated: Some know it as just midday.🔽Some see it as midnight.

original: kha cig gis ni nyi ma phyed /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni nyi ma phyed /
translated: Some see it as noon.

original: kha cig gis ni nyi ma mel tshe thun gcig tsam du shar bar shes /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni nyi ma mel tshe thun gcig tsam du shar bar shes /
translated: Some know it as risen for just one watch of the day.

original: kha cig gis ni nyi ma phyed yol tsam du shes /🔽kha cig gis ni nyi ma snur tsam du shes /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni nyi ma phyed yol tsam du shes / kha cig gis ni nyi ma snur tsam du shes /
translated: Some perceive it as being at noon,🔽some as being at sunset,

original: kha cig gis ni tho rangs tsam du shes te /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni tho rangs tsam du shes te /
translated: and some as being at dawn.

original: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gcig yin mod kyi /
analyzed: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gcig yin mod kyi /
translated: Although it is only one sun disk,🔽it is seen differently by the beings of the four continents.

original: 'on kyang gling bzhi dag tu sems can rnams kyi gzhan dang / gzhan dag tu mthong yang nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor ni mi rtog /🔽rnam par mi rtog ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang gling bzhi dag tu sems can rnams kyi gzhan dang / gzhan dag tu mthong yang nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor ni mi rtog / rnam par mi rtog ste /
translated: Yet the sun disk does not think or conceptualize.

original: lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog bzhin du ri rab kyi dbang gis gling bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams su bya ba sna tshogs ston to //
analyzed: lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog bzhin du ri rab kyi dbang gis gling bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams su bya ba sna tshogs ston to //
translated: Without any effort and without any thought, by the power of Mount Meru, it displays various activities in the world system of the four continents.

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyang sems can gyi dbang gis 'khor gcig kho na'i nang nas kyang sems can kha cig gis ni de bzhin gshegs pa mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar shes /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyang sems can gyi dbang gis 'khor gcig kho na'i nang nas kyang sems can kha cig gis ni de bzhin gshegs pa mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar shes /
translated: Mañjuśrī, in the same way, the tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas, by the power of sentient beings, in a single retinue, some sentient beings know that the tathāgatas have attained perfect buddhahood,

original: kha cig gis ni yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar shes /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar shes /
translated: Some understood that the Blessed One had attained parinirvāṇa.

original: kha cig gis ni bcom ldan 'das mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par shes so //
analyzed: kha cig gis ni bcom ldan 'das mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par shes so //
translated: Some understood that the Blessed One had attained perfect buddhahood.

original: 'khor de nyid kyi nang nas kha cig gis ni bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'das bar shes /
analyzed: 'khor de nyid kyi nang nas kha cig gis ni bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'das bar shes /
translated: Some in the assembly understood that the Blessed One had attained parinirvāṇa.

original: kha cig gis ni de bzhin gshegs pa bcom ldan 'das mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas lo bcu lon @193a *//
analyzed: kha cig gis ni de bzhin gshegs pa bcom ldan 'das mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas lo bcu lon @193a *//
translated: Some understood that ten years had passed since the Tathāgata, the Blessed One, had attained perfect buddhahood.

original: par shes / kha cig gis ni de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas lo bcu lon par shes /
analyzed: par shes / kha cig gis ni de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas lo bcu lon par shes /
translated: Some understood that ten years had passed since the Tathāgata had attained parinirvāṇa.

original: kha cig gis ni bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa snying por gyur par shes /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa snying por gyur par shes /
translated: Some understood that the essence of the Blessed One’s teaching had been revealed.

original: kha cig gis ni bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa nub par shes /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa nub par shes /
translated: Some understood that the Blessed One’s teaching had declined.

original: kha cig gis ni bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bstan nas lo bcu dang / nyi shu dang / sum cu dang / bzhi bcu dang / lnga bcu lon par shes /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bstan nas lo bcu dang / nyi shu dang / sum cu dang / bzhi bcu dang / lnga bcu lon par shes /
translated: Some understood that ten, twenty, thirty, forty, or fifty years had passed since the Blessed One had taught the Dharma.

original: kha cig gis ni bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas lo bcu dang; nyi shu dang / sum cu dang / bzhi bcu dang / lnga bcu lon par shes /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas lo bcu dang; nyi shu dang / sum cu dang / bzhi bcu dang / lnga bcu lon par shes /
translated: Some knew that the Bhagavān had passed into parinirvāṇa ten, twenty, thirty, forty, or fifty years before.

original: kha cig gis ni bcom ldan 'das mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas lo brgya dang / lo stong lon par shes /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni bcom ldan 'das mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas lo brgya dang / lo stong lon par shes /
translated: Some knew that the Bhagavān had attained perfect buddhahood one hundred years, or one thousand years, before.

original: kha cig gis ni bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas lo brgya dang / lo stong lon par shes /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas lo brgya dang / lo stong lon par shes /
translated: Some knew that the Bhagavān had passed into parinirvāṇa one hundred years, or one thousand years, before.

original: kha cig gis ni bcom ldan 'das mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas lo stong phrag bcu dang / nyi shu dang / sum cu dang / bzhi bcu dang / lnga bcu lon par shes /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni bcom ldan 'das mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas lo stong phrag bcu dang / nyi shu dang / sum cu dang / bzhi bcu dang / lnga bcu lon par shes /
translated: Some knew that the Bhagavān had attained perfect buddhahood ten, twenty, thirty, forty, or fifty thousand years before.

original: kha cig gis ni bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas lo stong phrag bcu dang / nyi shu dang / sum cu dang / bzhi bcu dang / lnga bcu lon par shes /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas lo stong phrag bcu dang / nyi shu dang / sum cu dang / bzhi bcu dang / lnga bcu lon par shes /
translated: Some knew that the Bhagavān had passed into parinirvāṇa ten, twenty, thirty, forty, or fifty thousand years before.

original: kha cig gis ni bcom ldan 'das mngon par rdzogs @193b par sangs rgyas nas bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag bcu dang / nyi shu dang / sum cu dang / bzhi bcu dang / lnga bcu lon par shes /🔽kha cig gis ni bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag bcu dang / nyi shu dang / sum cu dang / bzhi bcu dang / lnga bcu lon par shes so //
analyzed: kha cig gis ni bcom ldan 'das mngon par rdzogs @193b par sangs rgyas nas bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag bcu dang / nyi shu dang / sum cu dang / bzhi bcu dang / lnga bcu lon par shes / kha cig gis ni bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag bcu dang / nyi shu dang / sum cu dang / bzhi bcu dang / lnga bcu lon par shes so //
translated: Some understood that the Bhagavān had attained perfect buddhahood ten, twenty, thirty, forty, or fifty hundred thousand quintillion eons ago.🔽Some understood that the Bhagavān had attained perfect buddhahood a hundred thousand quintillion eons ago and had passed into nirvāṇa.

original: 'jam dpal / 'khor 'di nyid kyi nang nas lha dang / mi kha cig gis ni bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas bskal pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa lon par shes /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / 'khor 'di nyid kyi nang nas lha dang / mi kha cig gis ni bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas bskal pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa lon par shes /
translated: Mañjuśrī, some devas and humans in this very retinue understood that the Bhagavān Śākyamuni had attained perfect buddhahood an inexpressible number of inexpressibly many eons ago.

original: 'jam dpal / 'khor 'di nyid kyi nang nas lha dang / mi kha cig gis ni bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas bskal pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa lon par shes kyang /🔽'jam dpal / de bzhin gshegs pa ni mi rtog /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / 'khor 'di nyid kyi nang nas lha dang / mi kha cig gis ni bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas bskal pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa lon par shes kyang / 'jam dpal / de bzhin gshegs pa ni mi rtog /
translated: Mañjuśrī, some gods and humans in this very retinue know that the Blessed One, the Śākya Sage, has been in nirvāṇa for inexpressibly inexpressible eons.

original: rnam par mi rtog ste /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, the Tathāgata does not think or conceptualize.

original: 'on kyang lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog bzhin du sems can gyi dbang gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzad pa de lta bu de 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'on kyang lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog bzhin du sems can gyi dbang gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzad pa de lta bu de 'byung ngo //
translated: Nevertheless, without deliberate effort and without conceptualization, such deeds of the Tathāgata occur due to the power of sentient beings.

original: 'jam dpal / dper na /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / dper na /
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is like this:

original: dzambu'i gling du rlung gi dkyil 'khor chen po langs pas rtsva dang / shing gel pa dang / sman dang / nags tshal dang / lo ma thams cad g-yo /
analyzed: dzambu'i gling du rlung gi dkyil 'khor chen po langs pas rtsva dang / shing gel pa dang / sman dang / nags tshal dang / lo ma thams cad g-yo /
translated: In the world of Jambudvīpa, when a great wind-circle arises, all the grass, bushes, herbs, forests, and leaves move,

original: rab tu g-yo /
analyzed: rab tu g-yo /
translated: move greatly,

original: kun tu rab tu g-yo //
analyzed: kun tu rab tu g-yo //
translated: and move everywhere.

original: 'gul / rab tu 'gul /
analyzed: 'gul / rab tu 'gul /
translated: They shake, shake greatly,

original: kun tu rab 'gul /🔽'ur 'ur / rab tu @194a *//
analyzed: kun tu rab 'gul / 'ur 'ur / rab tu @194a *//
translated: and shake everywhere.🔽They roar, roar greatly,

original: 'ur 'ur / kun tu rab tu 'ur 'ur /
analyzed: 'ur 'ur / kun tu rab tu 'ur 'ur /
translated: and roar everywhere.

original: 'khrugs / rab tu 'khrugs /
analyzed: 'khrugs / rab tu 'khrugs /
translated: They are agitated, very agitated,🔽and completely and very agitated.

original: kun tu rab tu 'khrugs shing lo ma kha cig ni shar phyogs su dma' la nub phyogs su mtho /
analyzed: kun tu rab tu 'khrugs shing lo ma kha cig ni shar phyogs su dma' la nub phyogs su mtho /
translated: Some leaves are low in the east and high in the west,

original: kha cig ni nub phyogs su dma' la shar phyogs su mtho /
analyzed: kha cig ni nub phyogs su dma' la shar phyogs su mtho /
translated: some are low in the west and high in the east,

original: lo ma kha cig ni mtha' dma' la dbus su mtho //🔽kha cig ni byang phyogs dma' la lho phyogs su mtho'ang rtsva dang / shing gel pa dang / sman dang / nags tshal dang / lo ma rnams mi rtog /
analyzed: lo ma kha cig ni mtha' dma' la dbus su mtho // kha cig ni byang phyogs dma' la lho phyogs su mtho'ang rtsva dang / shing gel pa dang / sman dang / nags tshal dang / lo ma rnams mi rtog /
translated: some leaves are low in the middle and high on the edges,🔽and some are low in the north and high in the south.

original: rnam par mi rtog ste /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog ste /
translated: Yet the grass, the bushes, the herbs, the forests, and the leaves do not think or conceive.

original: 'on kyang / 'jam dpal /
analyzed: 'on kyang / 'jam dpal /
translated: Mañjuśrī,

original: rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi dbang gis bya ba sna tshogs ston to //🔽'jam dpal / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyang mi rtog /
analyzed: rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi dbang gis bya ba sna tshogs ston to // 'jam dpal / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyang mi rtog /
translated: it is through the power of the wind-disk that various activities are displayed.

original: rnam par mi rtog ste /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, in the same way, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfect and Complete Buddha does not think or conceive.

original: 'on kyang sems can gyi dbang gis rtag tu skad cig skad cig la gzugs kyi sku dang / kha dog dang / spyod pa dang / smon lam dang / bya ba la 'jug pa'i gnas grangs med pa dag phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas mu med pa rnams su 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'on kyang sems can gyi dbang gis rtag tu skad cig skad cig la gzugs kyi sku dang / kha dog dang / spyod pa dang / smon lam dang / bya ba la 'jug pa'i gnas grangs med pa dag phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas mu med pa rnams su 'byung ngo //
translated: However, due to the power of sentient beings, the form bodies, colors, conduct, aspirations, and activities of the Tathāgata arise in countless places in the infinite world systems of the ten directions, moment by moment.

original: 'jam dpal / sems can rnams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa la dmigs pa yid la byed pa ji snyed 'byung ba de snyed kyi bskal par sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dvags dang / gshin rje'i @194b 'jig rten du skye ba'i rgyun chad cing ldog ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / sems can rnams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa la dmigs pa yid la byed pa ji snyed 'byung ba de snyed kyi bskal par sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dvags dang / gshin rje'i @194b 'jig rten du skye ba'i rgyun chad cing ldog ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, for as many eons as the thoughts of sentient beings arise in relation to the Tathāgata, for that many eons the continuum of births in the hells, animal realm, ghost realm, and world of Yama is severed and stopped.

original: 'jam dpal / de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni yon tan tshad med pa dang ldan te /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni yon tan tshad med pa dang ldan te /
translated: Mañjuśrī, thus the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One possesses immeasurable qualities.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa gcig la dmigs pa'i yon tan gyi mtha' yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin bsam gyis mi khyab pa la gnas pa rnams kyis kyang bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag dpag tu med pa grangs med pa dag gis kyang rtogs par mi nus so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa gcig la dmigs pa'i yon tan gyi mtha' yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin bsam gyis mi khyab pa la gnas pa rnams kyis kyang bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag dpag tu med pa grangs med pa dag gis kyang rtogs par mi nus so //
translated: The qualities of focusing on a single Thus-Gone One are such that even bodhisattva great beings who abide in inconceivable liberation and meditative absorption cannot comprehend them even in countless quintillions of eons.

original: 'jam dpal / stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi lha rnams dang / mi rnams ni ches nyung gi phyi rol gyi drang srong mngon par shes pa lnga dang ldan pa 'dod pa dag la 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyis lha'i mig gis shing rta'i phang lo'i tshad tsam gyi sa phyogs gcig na sems can dag mthong ba ni ches
analyzed: 'jam dpal / stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi lha rnams dang / mi rnams ni ches nyung gi phyi rol gyi drang srong mngon par shes pa lnga dang ldan pa 'dod pa dag la 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyis lha'i mig gis shing rta'i phang lo'i tshad tsam gyi sa phyogs gcig na sems can dag mthong ba ni ches
translated: Mañjuśrī, the gods and humans of the worlds of the great trichiliocosm are far fewer in number than the non-human ṛṣis who possess the five kinds of supernormal knowledge and are free from desire for sensual pleasures, who with their divine eye see sentient beings in a single location, an area the size of a chariot’s yoke, who are free from desire for sensual pleasures, and who are far more numerous.

original: mang ngo // 'jam dpal /
analyzed: mang ngo // 'jam dpal /
translated: Mañjuśrī,

original: phyi rol gyi drang srong mngon par shes pa lnga dang ldan pa 'dod pa dag la 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyis lha'i mig gis stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na sems can dag mthong ba ni ches nyung gi /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi drang srong mngon par shes pa lnga dang ldan pa 'dod pa dag la 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyis lha'i mig gis stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na sems can dag mthong ba ni ches nyung gi /
translated: The external sages who possess the five superknowledges, who are free from attachment to the desires, see with their divine eye only a very small number of sentient beings in the worlds of the great trichiliocosm.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos dgra bcom pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos dgra bcom pa /
translated: The hearers of the Tathāgata, the arhats,

original: zag pa zad pa /
analyzed: zag pa zad pa /
translated: those who have exhausted the defilements,

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad la bsam gtan @195a *//
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad la bsam gtan @195a *//
translated: those who are absorbed in the eight liberations,

original: pas lha'i mig gis shing rta'i phang lo'i tshad tsam gyi sa phyogs gcig na sems can dag mthong ba ni ches mang ngo //
analyzed: pas lha'i mig gis shing rta'i phang lo'i tshad tsam gyi sa phyogs gcig na sems can dag mthong ba ni ches mang ngo //
translated: see with their divine eye a much greater number of sentient beings in a single place, an area the size of a chariot’s yoke.

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos dgra bcom pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos dgra bcom pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī, the hearers of the Tathāgata, the arhats,

original: zag pa zad pa /
analyzed: zag pa zad pa /
translated: those who have exhausted the defilements,

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad la bsam gtan pas lha'i mig gis stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na sems can ji snyed mthong ba de bas ni /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad la bsam gtan pas lha'i mig gis stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na sems can ji snyed mthong ba de bas ni /
translated: those who are absorbed in the eight liberations, see with their divine eye a much greater number of sentient beings in the worlds of the great trichiliocosm than

original: 'jam dpal / rang sangs rgyas kyis lha'i mig gis shing rta'i phang lo'i tshad tsam gyi sa phyogs gcig na sems can dag mthong ba ni ches mang ngo //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / rang sangs rgyas kyis lha'i mig gis shing rta'i phang lo'i tshad tsam gyi sa phyogs gcig na sems can dag mthong ba ni ches mang ngo //
translated: Mañjuśrī, the pratyekabuddhas, with their divine eye, see many more sentient beings in a single area the size of a chariot’s yoke than that.

original: 'jam dpal / rang sangs rgyas kyis lha'i mig gis stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na /🔽sems can ji snyed mthong ba de bas ni /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / rang sangs rgyas kyis lha'i mig gis stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na / sems can ji snyed mthong ba de bas ni /
translated: Mañjuśrī, the pratyekabuddhas, with their divine eye, see sentient beings in a great trichiliocosm.🔽Mañjuśrī, the bodhisattvas, with their divine eye, see many more sentient beings in a single area the size of a chariot’s yoke than that.

original: 'jam dpal / byang chub sems dpa' rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin bsam gyis mi khyab pa la gnas pas lha'i mig gis shing rta'i phang lo'i tshad tsam gyi sa phyogs gcig na sems can dag mthong ba ni ches mang ngo //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / byang chub sems dpa' rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin bsam gyis mi khyab pa la gnas pas lha'i mig gis shing rta'i phang lo'i tshad tsam gyi sa phyogs gcig na sems can dag mthong ba ni ches mang ngo //
translated: Mañjuśrī, the bodhisattvas, with their divine eye, see many more sentient beings in a single area the size of a chariot’s yoke than that.

original: 'jam dpal / byang chub sems dpa' rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin bsam gyis mi khyab pa la gnas pas lha'i mig gis stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na sems can ji snyed mthong ba de bas ni /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / byang chub sems dpa' rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin bsam gyis mi khyab pa la gnas pas lha'i mig gis stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na sems can ji snyed mthong ba de bas ni /
translated: Mañjuśrī, a bodhisattva who has attained the inconceivable liberation and meditative absorption sees with his divine eye as many sentient beings as there are in the trichiliocosm.

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin gshegs pas @195b lha'i sbyan gyis shing rta'i phang lo'i tshad tsam gyi sa phyogs gcig na sems can dag gzigs pa ni chos grangs med do //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin gshegs pas @195b lha'i sbyan gyis shing rta'i phang lo'i tshad tsam gyi sa phyogs gcig na sems can dag gzigs pa ni chos grangs med do //
translated: Mañjuśrī, the Tathāgata sees with his divine eye sentient beings in a place the size of a chariot’s hub.

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams rab 'byams thams cad na shing rta'i phang lo'i tshad tsam gyi sa phyogs thams cad na gnas pa'i sems can re re'i sems dang / sems las byung ba'i chos byung ba dang / 'byung ba dang /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams rab 'byams thams cad na shing rta'i phang lo'i tshad tsam gyi sa phyogs thams cad na gnas pa'i sems can re re'i sems dang / sems las byung ba'i chos byung ba dang / 'byung ba dang /
translated: Mañjuśrī, in the same way, in all the infinite world systems of the ten directions, in every place the size of a chariot’s hub, there are sentient beings, each with their own thoughts and mental factors, their own phenomena that arise and cease.

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba gang dag gzigs pa de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnam par thar pa dang ting nge 'dzin bsam gyis mi khyab pa la gnas pa rnams kyis kyang bskal pa gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed du'ang bgrang ba'am /
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba gang dag gzigs pa de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnam par thar pa dang ting nge 'dzin bsam gyis mi khyab pa la gnas pa rnams kyis kyang bskal pa gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed du'ang bgrang ba'am /
translated: Those who are seen to be born are counted by bodhisattvas who are established in inconceivable liberation and concentration for as many eons as there are grains of sand in the Ganges River.

original: bsam pa'am / grangs su bya bar sla ba ma yin te /
analyzed: bsam pa'am / grangs su bya bar sla ba ma yin te /
translated: Those whom he sees as destined to become buddhas are not easily enumerated, considered, or counted by bodhisattvas dwelling in inconceivable liberation and concentration, even for eons equal to the sands of the Ganges River.

original: 'jam dpal / sems can 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba de dag gis sems dang sems las byung ba de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis lhun gyis grub par skad cig thang cig yud tsam cig la rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / sems can 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba de dag gis sems dang sems las byung ba de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis lhun gyis grub par skad cig thang cig yud tsam cig la rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: Mañjuśrī, the minds and mental factors of those sentient beings, past, future, and present, are known by the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, spontaneously, in a single moment, an instant, a second.

original: 'jam dpal / phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du gtogs pa'i sems can thams cad kyi sems dang sems las 'byung ba rnams rgyu gang dang / dmigs pa gang dang / rkyen gang gis ji ltar byung ba dang / 'byung ba dang / 'byung bar 'gyur @196a *//
analyzed: 'jam dpal / phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du gtogs pa'i sems can thams cad kyi sems dang sems las 'byung ba rnams rgyu gang dang / dmigs pa gang dang / rkyen gang gis ji ltar byung ba dang / 'byung ba dang / 'byung bar 'gyur @196a *//
translated: Mañjuśrī, the Tathāgata, by means of his effortless knowledge, in a single instant, a single moment, a single fraction of time, correctly knows the minds and mental factors of all sentient beings included in all the world systems in the ten directions, and he knows their causes, their objects, and their conditions, as well as how they arise, how they have arisen, and how they will arise.

original: ba dang / sems can de dag gi spyod pa dang / spyod lam dang / bya ba la 'jug pa'i gnas gang dag byung ba dang / 'byung ba dang / 'byung bar 'gyur ba de dag de bzhin gshegs pas lhun gyis grub pa'i ye shes kyis rnam par mi rtog par skad cig thang cig yud tsam cig la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: ba dang / sems can de dag gi spyod pa dang / spyod lam dang / bya ba la 'jug pa'i gnas gang dag byung ba dang / 'byung ba dang / 'byung bar 'gyur ba de dag de bzhin gshegs pas lhun gyis grub pa'i ye shes kyis rnam par mi rtog par skad cig thang cig yud tsam cig la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He also knows the activities, conduct, and engagement in actions of those sentient beings, and he knows the bases from which they arise, have arisen, and will arise.

original: 'jam dpal / sems can de dag ji ltar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'dul ba'ang lhun gyis grub pa'i ye shes kyi rnam par mi rtog par skad cig thang cig yud tsam cig la rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / sems can de dag ji ltar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'dul ba'ang lhun gyis grub pa'i ye shes kyi rnam par mi rtog par skad cig thang cig yud tsam cig la rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: Mañjuśrī, the Tathāgata also knows in a single instant, a single moment, a single second, with his spontaneously present nonconceptual gnosis, how those sentient beings are to be trained for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: 'jam dpal / sems can re re'i ma rig pa'i gnas kyi sa'i nyon mongs pa gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma bas mang ba de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas lhun gyis grub pa'i ye shes kyis rnam par mi rtog par skad cig thang cig yud tsam cig la rab tu mkhyen
analyzed: 'jam dpal / sems can re re'i ma rig pa'i gnas kyi sa'i nyon mongs pa gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma bas mang ba de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas lhun gyis grub pa'i ye shes kyis rnam par mi rtog par skad cig thang cig yud tsam cig la rab tu mkhyen
translated: Mañjuśrī, the Tathāgata also knows in a single instant, a single moment, a single second, with his spontaneously present nonconceptual gnosis, the afflictions of the ground of the realm of sentient beings’ ignorance, which are more numerous than the sands of the Ganges River.

original: to // 'jam dpal /
analyzed: to // 'jam dpal /
translated: Mañjuśrī,

original: rgyu gang dang / dmigs pa gang dang / rkyen gang gis nyon mongs pa de dag ji ltar 'byung ba dang / thabs kyi shes pa gang gis sems can de dag gis nyon mongs pa ji ltar zhi bar 'gyur ba de dag kyang lhun gyis grub pa'i ye shes kyis rnam par mi rtog par skad cig thang cig yud tsam cig la rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: rgyu gang dang / dmigs pa gang dang / rkyen gang gis nyon mongs pa de dag ji ltar 'byung ba dang / thabs kyi shes pa gang gis sems can de dag gis nyon mongs pa ji ltar zhi bar 'gyur ba de dag kyang lhun gyis grub pa'i ye shes kyis rnam par mi rtog par skad cig thang cig yud tsam cig la rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: By what causes, what objects, and what conditions do those afflictions arise? By what knowledge of methods will those sentient beings’ afflictions be pacified? He knows all of that nonconceptually in a single instant, a single moment, a single occasion, through his spontaneously present wisdom.

original: 'jam dpal / de ltar @196b na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams ni ye shes bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang ldan no //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de ltar @196b na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams ni ye shes bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang ldan no //
translated: Mañjuśrī, thus the tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas possess inconceivable wisdom.

original: 'jam dpal / dper na /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / dper na /
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is like this:

original: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ni nyi ma'i dbang gis dzambu'i gling du gzugs dang / kha dog dang / gzi brjid dang / 'od rab 'bring tha mar snang yang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ni 'bri ba dang / 'phel ba'ang med de /
analyzed: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ni nyi ma'i dbang gis dzambu'i gling du gzugs dang / kha dog dang / gzi brjid dang / 'od rab 'bring tha mar snang yang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ni 'bri ba dang / 'phel ba'ang med de /
translated: The orb of the moon, by the power of the sun, appears in the world of humans with forms, colors, radiance, and light that are either great, medium, or small. Yet the orb of the moon neither increases nor decreases.

original: 'on kyang sems can rnams kyi las kyi rnam par smin pas nyi ma bgrang ba dang / yud tsam dang / yud tsam phyed kyi grangs brtsi bar bya ba de lta bu de 'ang 'byung la; 'jam dpal /🔽zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ni mi rtog /
analyzed: 'on kyang sems can rnams kyi las kyi rnam par smin pas nyi ma bgrang ba dang / yud tsam dang / yud tsam phyed kyi grangs brtsi bar bya ba de lta bu de 'ang 'byung la; 'jam dpal / zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ni mi rtog /
translated: and the counting of moments and half-moments, occurs.🔽Mañjuśrī,

original: rnam par mi rtog ste /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog ste /
translated: the orb of the moon does not think or conceptualize.

original: 'on kyang lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par de'i bya ba de lta bu de 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'on kyang lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par de'i bya ba de lta bu de 'byung ngo //
translated: However, without deliberation or conceptualization, such activity occurs spontaneously.

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams rab 'byams thams cad du bsam pa rab 'bring tha mas sems can rnams kyis de bzhin gshegs pa gzugs dang /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams rab 'byams thams cad du bsam pa rab 'bring tha mas sems can rnams kyis de bzhin gshegs pa gzugs dang /
translated: Mañjuśrī, in the same way, the thus-gone, worthy, perfect Buddha, in all the infinite world systems of the ten directions, is seen by sentient beings with superior, middling, and lesser intentions as the Thus-Gone One with superior, middling, and lesser forms,

original: kha dog dang / gzi brjid dang / 'od rab 'bring tha mar mthong yang /
analyzed: kha dog dang / gzi brjid dang / 'od rab 'bring tha mar mthong yang /
translated: complexion, splendor, and radiance.

original: 'jam dpal; sems can gang gi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / spyod pa dang / mos pa dang / smon lam gyi stobs dang / byin gyi rlabs ci 'dra ba yin pa de 'dra bar de bzhin gshegs pa @197a *//
analyzed: 'jam dpal; sems can gang gi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / spyod pa dang / mos pa dang / smon lam gyi stobs dang / byin gyi rlabs ci 'dra ba yin pa de 'dra bar de bzhin gshegs pa @197a *//
translated: Mañjuśrī, the tathāgatas are seen in accordance with the power of the roots of virtue, conduct, aspirations, and blessings of sentient beings.

original: mthong ste / 'jam dpal /
analyzed: mthong ste / 'jam dpal /
translated: Mañjuśrī,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la ni rab 'bring tha ma med do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la ni rab 'bring tha ma med do //
translated: the tathāgatas are not high, middling, or low.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni chos kyi sku ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni chos kyi sku ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, the tathāgatas, the worthy ones, the perfectly complete buddhas are the body of the Dharma,

original: shin tu ma skyes pa /🔽ma byung ba /
analyzed: shin tu ma skyes pa / ma byung ba /
translated: utterly unborn,🔽unoriginated,

original: ma 'gags pa yin na /
analyzed: ma 'gags pa yin na /
translated: and unceasing.

original: 'jam dpal / 'on kyang sems can rnams kyi bsam pa rab 'bring tha mas de bzhin gshegs pa rab 'bring tha mar mthong yang /🔽'jam dpal / de bzhin gshegs pa ni mi rtog /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / 'on kyang sems can rnams kyi bsam pa rab 'bring tha mas de bzhin gshegs pa rab 'bring tha mar mthong yang / 'jam dpal / de bzhin gshegs pa ni mi rtog /
translated: Mañjuśrī, nevertheless, sentient beings see the tathāgatas as high, middling, or low, according to their high, middling, or low thoughts.

original: rnam par mi rtog ste /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, the tathāgatas do not think or conceptualize.

original: 'on kyang lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par de'i bya ba de lta bu de 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'on kyang lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par de'i bya ba de lta bu de 'byung ngo //
translated: Nevertheless, this activity occurs spontaneously and nonconceptually.

original: 'jam dpal / stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di na lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di na lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang /
translated: Mañjuśrī, in this great trichiliocosm, there are gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, mahoragas,

original: brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten skyong ba dang / mi dang / mi ma yin pa rnams dang / tha na dud 'gro'i skye gnas su song ba'i sems can gang dag de bzhin gshegs pa la bshos gsol ba dang / gang dag bshos mi gsol ba dang /
analyzed: brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten skyong ba dang / mi dang / mi ma yin pa rnams dang / tha na dud 'gro'i skye gnas su song ba'i sems can gang dag de bzhin gshegs pa la bshos gsol ba dang / gang dag bshos mi gsol ba dang /
translated: Śakra, Brahmā, Lokapāla, humans, non-humans, and even animals who have offered food to the Tathāgata, and those who have not.

original: gang dag mthong ba dang / gang dag mi mthong ba dang / gang dag stong pa dang / gang dag mi stong pa dang / gang dag gshe ba dang / gang dag mi gshe ba dang / gang @197b dag reg pa dang / gang dag mi reg pa de dag thams cad kyi bya ba de lta bu rnams kyang sangs rgyas kyi mthus lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par 'byung ngo //🔽'jam dpal / dper na; gang dag gis nor bu rin po che mthon ka chen po mthong ba dang / reg pa dang / spyod yul du gnas pa de dag thams cad ni nor bu rin po che mthon ka chen po'i kha dog tu 'gyur yang nor bu rin po che mthon ka chen po ni mi rtog /
analyzed: gang dag mthong ba dang / gang dag mi mthong ba dang / gang dag stong pa dang / gang dag mi stong pa dang / gang dag gshe ba dang / gang dag mi gshe ba dang / gang @197b dag reg pa dang / gang dag mi reg pa de dag thams cad kyi bya ba de lta bu rnams kyang sangs rgyas kyi mthus lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par 'byung ngo // 'jam dpal / dper na; gang dag gis nor bu rin po che mthon ka chen po mthong ba dang / reg pa dang / spyod yul du gnas pa de dag thams cad ni nor bu rin po che mthon ka chen po'i kha dog tu 'gyur yang nor bu rin po che mthon ka chen po ni mi rtog /
translated: All of these activities, whether they are seen or unseen, empty or not empty, reviled or not reviled, touched or not touched, are spontaneously and nonconceptually accomplished by the power of the Buddha.

original: rnam par mi rtog go /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog go /
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is like this: those who see the great vaiḍūrya gem, touch it, or stay within its range all become the color of the great vaiḍūrya gem. However, the great vaiḍūrya gem does not think or conceptualize.

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du sems can gang dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa tha na ri mor bris pa dang / gzugs su byas pa mthong ba dang / reg pa dang / de'i spyod yul yang shes pa de dag thams cad ni gzugs dang /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du sems can gang dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa tha na ri mor bris pa dang / gzugs su byas pa mthong ba dang / reg pa dang / de'i spyod yul yang shes pa de dag thams cad ni gzugs dang /
translated: Mañjuśrī, in the same way, all those sentient beings who see the Tathāgata, even if it is only a painting or a statue, and who touch it or know of it, will attain the inconceivable perfection of form and complexion.

original: kha dog bsam gyis mi khyab pa yongs su 'grub pa thob par 'gyur yang de bzhin gshegs pa ni mi rtog go /
analyzed: kha dog bsam gyis mi khyab pa yongs su 'grub pa thob par 'gyur yang de bzhin gshegs pa ni mi rtog go /
translated: But the Tathāgata does not think,

original: rnam par mi rtog /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog /
translated: does not conceptualize,

original: 'jam dpal / dper na rtsi'i rgyal po legs par mthong zhes bya ba sems can gnod sems kyi sems dang ldan pa'am /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / dper na rtsi'i rgyal po legs par mthong zhes bya ba sems can gnod sems kyi sems dang ldan pa'am /
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is like the king of medicines called “good to see.” Sentient beings who see it, whether they have a malicious mind

original: dang ba'i sems dang ldan pa'ang rung /
analyzed: dang ba'i sems dang ldan pa'ang rung /
translated: or a pure mind,

original: gang dag gis mthong ba de dag gi mig rnam par dag par 'gyur /🔽gnod sems kyi sems dang ldan pa'am /
analyzed: gang dag gis mthong ba de dag gi mig rnam par dag par 'gyur / gnod sems kyi sems dang ldan pa'am /
translated: will have their eyes purified.🔽Whether they have a malicious mind

original: dang ba'i sems dang ldan pa'ang rung /
analyzed: dang ba'i sems dang ldan pa'ang rung /
translated: or a pure mind,

original: gang dag gis rna bas de rlung gis bskyed pa'i sgra thos pa de dag gis rna ba rnam par dag par 'gyur /🔽gnod sems kyi sems dang ldan pa'am /
analyzed: gang dag gis rna bas de rlung gis bskyed pa'i sgra thos pa de dag gis rna ba rnam par dag par 'gyur / gnod sems kyi sems dang ldan pa'am /
translated: Those who hear the sound of the wind will have their ears purified.🔽Whether they have a mind of malice

original: dang ba'i sems dang ldan pa'ang rung @198a *//
analyzed: dang ba'i sems dang ldan pa'ang rung @198a *//
translated: or a mind of faith,

original: gang dag gis dri tshor ba de dag gi sna rnam par dag par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang dag gis dri tshor ba de dag gi sna rnam par dag par 'gyur /
translated: those who smell the scent will have their noses purified.

original: gnod sems kyi sems dang ldan pa'am /
analyzed: gnod sems kyi sems dang ldan pa'am /
translated: Whether they have a mind of malice🔽or a mind of faith,

original: dad pa'i sems dang ldan pa'ang rung; gang dag gi lces de'i ro myong ba de dag gi lce'i dbang po rnam par dag par 'gyur //🔽gnod sems kyi sems dang ldan pa'am /
analyzed: dad pa'i sems dang ldan pa'ang rung; gang dag gi lces de'i ro myong ba de dag gi lce'i dbang po rnam par dag par 'gyur // gnod sems kyi sems dang ldan pa'am /
translated: those who taste its flavor will have their sense of taste purified.🔽Whether they have a mind of malice

original: dang ba'i sems dang ldan pa'ang rung /
analyzed: dang ba'i sems dang ldan pa'ang rung /
translated: or a mind of faith,

original: gang dag lus kyis reg pa de dag gi lus rnam par dag par 'gyur yang /
analyzed: gang dag lus kyis reg pa de dag gi lus rnam par dag par 'gyur yang /
translated: those who touch it with their bodies will have their bodies purified.

original: 'jam dpal / rtsi'i rgyal po legs par mthong ba ni mi rtog /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / rtsi'i rgyal po legs par mthong ba ni mi rtog /
translated: Mañjuśrī, the king of ointments, Seeing Well, does not conceptualize.

original: rnam par mi rtog ste /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog ste /
translated: It does not conceptualize.

original: 'on kyang lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par de'i bya ba de lta bu de 'byung ngo /
analyzed: 'on kyang lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par de'i bya ba de lta bu de 'byung ngo /
translated: Nevertheless, that activity occurs in that way, spontaneously and nonconceptually.

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du gnod sems kyi sems dang ldan pa'am /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du gnod sems kyi sems dang ldan pa'am /
translated: Mañjuśrī, in the same way, those who have a malicious mind

original: dad pa'i sems dang ldan pa'ang rung /
analyzed: dad pa'i sems dang ldan pa'ang rung /
translated: or a mind of faith

original: gang dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa than ri mor bris pa dang / gzugs su byas pa mthong ba de dag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba des mig rnam par dag par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa than ri mor bris pa dang / gzugs su byas pa mthong ba de dag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba des mig rnam par dag par 'gyur /
translated: and see a tathāgata painted in a picture or made in a statue, by that root of virtue their eyes will be purified.

original: tha na dud 'gro'i skye gnas su song ba'ang rung ste /🔽gnod sems kyi sems dang ldan pa'am /
analyzed: tha na dud 'gro'i skye gnas su song ba'ang rung ste / gnod sems kyi sems dang ldan pa'am /
translated: Even those who have gone to the animal realm,🔽whether they have a malicious mind

original: dang ba'i sems dang ldan pa'ang rung /
analyzed: dang ba'i sems dang ldan pa'ang rung /
translated: or a mind of faith,

original: gang dag gis de la sangs rgyas zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: gang dag gis de la sangs rgyas zhes bya ba'am /
translated: if they hear the word ‘Buddha,’

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba'am /
translated: the word ‘tathāgata,’

original: 'jig rten mgon po zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: 'jig rten mgon po zhes bya ba'am /
translated: the word ‘lord of the world,’

original: thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya ba'i sgra thos pa de dag dge ba'i rtsa ba des rna ba'i dbang po rnam par dag @198b par 'gyur /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya ba'i sgra thos pa de dag dge ba'i rtsa ba des rna ba'i dbang po rnam par dag @198b par 'gyur /
translated: or the word ‘omniscient one,’ by that root of virtue their faculty of hearing will be purified.

original: gnod sems kyi sems dang ldan pa'am /
analyzed: gnod sems kyi sems dang ldan pa'am /
translated: To have a mind of malice.🔽🔽

original: dang ba'i sems dang ldan pa'ang rung /
analyzed: dang ba'i sems dang ldan pa'ang rung /
translated: Whether they have a malicious attitude or a pure attitude,🔽those who smell the fragrance of his good qualities

original: gang dag gis de'i yon tan gyi dri tshor ba de dag dge ba'i rtsa ba des sna rnam par dag par 'gyur /🔽gnod sems kyi sems dang ldan pa'am /
analyzed: gang dag gis de'i yon tan gyi dri tshor ba de dag dge ba'i rtsa ba des sna rnam par dag par 'gyur / gnod sems kyi sems dang ldan pa'am /
translated: will, through that root of merit, attain a pure nose.

original: dang ba'i sems dang ldan pa'ang rung /
analyzed: dang ba'i sems dang ldan pa'ang rung /
translated: Whether they have a malicious attitude or a pure attitude,🔽those who taste the flavor of his Dharma

original: gang dag gis de'i chos kyi ro myong ba de dag dge ba'i rtsa ba des lce rnam par dag par 'gyur /🔽gnod sems kyi sems dang ldan pa'am /
analyzed: gang dag gis de'i chos kyi ro myong ba de dag dge ba'i rtsa ba des lce rnam par dag par 'gyur / gnod sems kyi sems dang ldan pa'am /
translated: will, through that root of merit, attain a pure tongue.

original: dang ba'i sems dang ldan pa'ang rung /
analyzed: dang ba'i sems dang ldan pa'ang rung /
translated: Whether they have a malicious attitude or a pure attitude,🔽those who touch his body

original: gang dag gis lus kyi reg pa de dag dge ba'i rtsa ba des lus rnam par dag par 'gyur yang /
analyzed: gang dag gis lus kyi reg pa de dag dge ba'i rtsa ba des lus rnam par dag par 'gyur yang /
translated: will, through that root of merit, attain a pure body.

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin gshegs pa ni mi rtog /🔽rnam par mi rtog ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin gshegs pa ni mi rtog / rnam par mi rtog ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, the Tathāgata does not think or conceptualize.🔽He is free from thoughts and conceptualization.

original: ma 'dres pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i phyir lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par de'i bya ba de lta bu de 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ma 'dres pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i phyir lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par de'i bya ba de lta bu de 'byung ngo //
translated: Because he possesses unmixed qualities, his actions occur spontaneously and nonconceptually.

original: 'jam dpal / dper na /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / dper na /
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is like this:

original: rtsi'i rgyal po 'bral ba zhes bya bas bskus pa'i rnga sgra sems can zug rdus zug pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: rtsi'i rgyal po 'bral ba zhes bya bas bskus pa'i rnga sgra sems can zug rdus zug pa dang bcas pa /
translated: The sound of a drum anointed with the king of medicines called “separation” is heard by sentient beings who are afflicted by pain and

original: dug dang bcas pa gang dag gis thos pa de dag gis zug rdu thams cad 'byung zhing dug kyang mi gdug par 'gyur yang /
analyzed: dug dang bcas pa gang dag gis thos pa de dag gis zug rdu thams cad 'byung zhing dug kyang mi gdug par 'gyur yang /
translated: poison. All their pain is removed and the poison is neutralized.

original: 'jam dpal / rtsi'i rgyal po 'bral ba ni mi rtog /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / rtsi'i rgyal po 'bral ba ni mi rtog /
translated: Mañjuśrī, the king of medicines called “separation” does not think,

original: rnam par mi rtog ste /🔽'on kyang sems can rnams kyi las kyi rnam par smin pa'i dbang dang / rgyu rkyen tshogs pas lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par rtsi'i rgyal po 'bral ba'i bya ba @199a *//
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog ste / 'on kyang sems can rnams kyi las kyi rnam par smin pa'i dbang dang / rgyu rkyen tshogs pas lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par rtsi'i rgyal po 'bral ba'i bya ba @199a *//
translated: nor does it conceptualize.

original: de lta bu de 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de lta bu de 'byung ngo //
translated: Nevertheless, by the power of the maturation of sentient beings’ karma and the coming together of causes and conditions, the activity of the king of medicines called “separation” occurs spontaneously and nonconceptually.

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i mtshan thos ma thag tu sems can rnams kyi lta bar gyur pa'i zug rdu dag 'byung zhing 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi dug kyang mi gdug par 'gyur yang /🔽'jam dpal / de bzhin gshegs pa ni mi rtog /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i mtshan thos ma thag tu sems can rnams kyi lta bar gyur pa'i zug rdu dag 'byung zhing 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi dug kyang mi gdug par 'gyur yang / 'jam dpal / de bzhin gshegs pa ni mi rtog /
translated: Mañjuśrī, in the same way, as soon as sentient beings hear the name of the Tathāgata, the splinters of their views are extracted, and the poisons of desire, anger, and ignorance are neutralized.

original: rnam par mi rtog ste /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, the Tathāgata does not think or conceptualize.

original: 'on kyang / 'jam dpal /
analyzed: 'on kyang / 'jam dpal /
translated: Mañjuśrī,

original: lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzad pa de lta bu de 'byung ngo //
analyzed: lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzad pa de lta bu de 'byung ngo //
translated: such activity of the Tathāgata occurs spontaneously and nonconceptually.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: ma 'dres ba'i chos dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma 'dres ba'i chos dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he possesses unshared qualities.🔽Mañjuśrī, the atoms in the world systems of a billion-world universe are fewer

original: 'jam dpal / stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams gyi rdul phra rab kyi rdul rnams ni ches nyung gi /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams gyi rdul phra rab kyi rdul rnams ni ches nyung gi /
translated: than

original: bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pas sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag tu 'jig rten gyi khams re rer yang rdul phra rab kyi rdul re re la bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi po
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pas sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag tu 'jig rten gyi khams re rer yang rdul phra rab kyi rdul re re la bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi po
translated: Bhagavān Śākyamuni, when he was practicing bodhisattva conduct in the past, brought sentient beings to full maturity in each world system of the ten directions, as numerous as the grains of sand in the Ganges river, by means of the four means of attraction,

original: dag gis sems can yongs su smin par mdzad pa dag ni ches mang ngo //
analyzed: dag gis sems can yongs su smin par mdzad pa dag ni ches mang ngo //
translated: one for each atom.

original: 'jam dpal / phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag gi rdul phra rab kyi rdul rnams ni ches nyung gi /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag gi rdul phra rab kyi rdul rnams ni ches nyung gi /
translated: Mañjuśrī, the atoms in the world systems of the ten directions, as numerous as the grains of sand in the Ganges river, are far fewer in number.

original: bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pas rgyun mi gcod par lhun gyis grub cing rnam @199b par mi rtog par phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas mu med pa dag tu rdul phra rab kyi rdul re re la sems can bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pas rgyun mi gcod par lhun gyis grub cing rnam @199b par mi rtog par phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas mu med pa dag tu rdul phra rab kyi rdul re re la sems can bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs
translated: Bhagavān Śākyamuni, without interruption, spontaneously and nonconceptually, in each atom of the infinite and limitless world systems of the ten directions, brings sentient beings to full maturity in unsurpassable, complete, and perfect

original: pa'i byang chub tu yongs su smin par mdzad zin pa dang / yongs su smin par mdzad pa dang / yongs su smin par mdzad par 'gyur ba dag ni ches mang ste /
analyzed: pa'i byang chub tu yongs su smin par mdzad zin pa dang / yongs su smin par mdzad pa dang / yongs su smin par mdzad par 'gyur ba dag ni ches mang ste /
translated: The tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas have already brought to maturity, are bringing to maturity, and will bring to maturity many, many beings in the unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: 'jam dpal / de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni sems can yongs su smin par mdzad pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang ldan no //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni sems can yongs su smin par mdzad pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang ldan no //
translated: Mañjuśrī, in this way the tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas possess inconceivable maturity of beings.

original: 'jam dpal / dper na /🔽zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ni nyi ma'i dbang gis 'bri ba dang / skye ba dang / mi snang bar 'gyur bar yang snang la /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / dper na / zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ni nyi ma'i dbang gis 'bri ba dang / skye ba dang / mi snang bar 'gyur bar yang snang la /
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is like this:🔽The orb of the moon appears to wane, to wax, and to disappear due to the power of the sun.

original: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la ni 'bri ba dang / mi snang ba dang / skye ba med de /
analyzed: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la ni 'bri ba dang / mi snang ba dang / skye ba med de /
translated: But the orb of the moon does not really wane, disappear, or wax.

original: 'on kyang sems can rnams kyi sngon gyi dge ba'i las kyi rnam par smin pas nyi ma'i grangs dang / yud tsam dang / yud tsam phyed dang / zla ba phyed dang / zla ba dang / lo bgrang ba'i grangs bzhag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on kyang sems can rnams kyi sngon gyi dge ba'i las kyi rnam par smin pas nyi ma'i grangs dang / yud tsam dang / yud tsam phyed dang / zla ba phyed dang / zla ba dang / lo bgrang ba'i grangs bzhag pa'i phyir /
translated: However, due to the ripening of sentient beings’ previous virtuous karma, the number of days, the number of moments, the number of half-moments, the number of half-months, the number of months, and the number of years are established.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyi sa bya ba de lta bu dag 'byung yang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyi sa bya ba de lta bu dag 'byung yang /
translated: Thus, Mañjuśrī, such activities occur through the blessing of the Tathāgata.

original: 'jam dpal / zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la ni 'bri ba'am /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la ni 'bri ba'am /
translated: Mañjuśrī, the orb of the moon does not diminish,

original: 'phel ba'am / mi snang bar 'gyur ba med de /
analyzed: 'phel ba'am / mi snang bar 'gyur ba med de /
translated: increase, or disappear.

original: 'on kyang / 'jam dpal /🔽sems can rnams kyi sdon gyi dge ba'i las kyi rnam par smin pa dang / nyi ma'i dbang gis lhun @200a *//
analyzed: 'on kyang / 'jam dpal / sems can rnams kyi sdon gyi dge ba'i las kyi rnam par smin pa dang / nyi ma'i dbang gis lhun @200a *//
translated: However, Mañjuśrī,

original: gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi bya ba de lta bu de 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi bya ba de lta bu de 'byung ngo //
translated: due to the ripening of sentient beings’ previous virtuous karma and the power of the sun, such activities of the orb of the moon occur spontaneously and nonconceptually.

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyang sngon dge ba'i rtsa ba'i tshogs bsags pa'i sems can rnams kyi nga rgyal dang / rgyags pa dang / dregs pa yang dag par gzhom pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyang sngon dge ba'i rtsa ba'i tshogs bsags pa'i sems can rnams kyi nga rgyal dang / rgyags pa dang / dregs pa yang dag par gzhom pa'i phyir dang /
translated: Mañjuśrī, in the same way, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfect and Complete Buddha, in order to destroy the pride, conceit, and arrogance of sentient beings who have previously accumulated the accumulations of roots of virtue,

original: sngon gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i tshogs rnams yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa la gzud pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i dam pa'i chos 'grib pa dang nub par kun tu ston te /
analyzed: sngon gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i tshogs rnams yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa la gzud pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i dam pa'i chos 'grib pa dang nub par kun tu ston te /
translated: in order to ripen the previously accumulated roots of virtue, and in order to lead them into the teachings of the Tathāgata, he demonstrates the decline and disappearance of the Tathāgata’s sublime Dharma.

original: 'jam dpal / sems can gyi dbang gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i dam pa'i chos nub pa dang / 'grib pa dang / 'phel bar 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / sems can gyi dbang gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i dam pa'i chos nub pa dang / 'grib pa dang / 'phel bar 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is due to the power of sentient beings that the Tathāgata’s sublime Dharma declines, disappears, and increases.

original: 'on kyang 'jam dpal sems can gyi dbang gis lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzad pa de lta bu de 'byung ngo /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'jam dpal sems can gyi dbang gis lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzad pa de lta bu de 'byung ngo /
translated: However, Mañjuśrī, it is by the power of sentient beings that such activity of the Tathāgata occurs spontaneously and nonconceptually.

original: 'jam dpal / dper na /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / dper na /
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is like this:

original: nam mkha' la gnas /
analyzed: nam mkha' la gnas /
translated: It abides in space.

original: nam mkha' la brten nas sems can thams cad kyi bya ba sna tshogs dag 'byung yang nam mkha' ni ma skyes pa /🔽ma 'gags pa /
analyzed: nam mkha' la brten nas sems can thams cad kyi bya ba sna tshogs dag 'byung yang nam mkha' ni ma skyes pa / ma 'gags pa /
translated: It is based on space that the various activities of all sentient beings occur, yet space is unborn,🔽 unceasing,

original: 'dus ma byas pa /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas pa /
translated: unconditioned,

original: yi ge med pa /
analyzed: yi ge med pa /
translated: without syllables,

original: sgra med pa /
analyzed: sgra med pa /
translated: without sound,

original: brjod du med pa /
analyzed: brjod du med pa /
translated: inexpressible,

original: brjod par bya ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: brjod par bya ba ma yin nam /
translated: not an object of expression,

original: gnyis su med pa /
analyzed: gnyis su med pa /
translated: nondual,

original: gnyen @200b po med pa ste /
analyzed: gnyen @200b po med pa ste /
translated: and without a companion.

original: 'on kyang lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par de'i bya ba sna tshogs dag 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'on kyang lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par de'i bya ba sna tshogs dag 'byung ngo //
translated: However, its various activities occur spontaneously and nonconceptually.

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la gnas /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la gnas /
translated: Mañjuśrī, in the same way, the various activities of the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfect and Complete Buddha occur based on the Tathāgata.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la brten nas sems can thams cad kyi bya ba thams cad 'byung yang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la brten nas sems can thams cad kyi bya ba thams cad 'byung yang /
translated: All the activities of all sentient beings occur in dependence on the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One.

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin gshegs pa ni mi skye mi 'gags te /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin gshegs pa ni mi skye mi 'gags te /
translated: Mañjuśrī, the Tathāgata does not arise or cease.

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin gshegs pa ni 'dus ma byas pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin gshegs pa ni 'dus ma byas pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī, the Tathāgata is unconditioned,

original: yi ge med pa /
analyzed: yi ge med pa /
translated: without letters,

original: sgra med pa /
analyzed: sgra med pa /
translated: without sound,

original: brjod du med pa /
analyzed: brjod du med pa /
translated: inexpressible,

original: brjod par bya ba ma yin pa /
analyzed: brjod par bya ba ma yin pa /
translated: not an object of expression,

original: gnyis su med pa /
analyzed: gnyis su med pa /
translated: nondual,

original: gnyen po med pa ste /
analyzed: gnyen po med pa ste /
translated: without antidote.

original: 'on kyang sngon gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / spyod pa dang / smon lam gyi stobs dang / byin gyi rlabs kyis lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par sems can rnams la de'i chos kyi mdzad pa sna tshogs dag kyang 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'on kyang sngon gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / spyod pa dang / smon lam gyi stobs dang / byin gyi rlabs kyis lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par sems can rnams la de'i chos kyi mdzad pa sna tshogs dag kyang 'byung ngo //
translated: Nevertheless, through the power of his previous roots of virtue, conduct, and aspirations, and through his blessings, various activities of his Dharma occur for sentient beings in an effortless and nonconceptual way.

original: 'jam dpal / theg pa chen po la mos pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas la dmigs pa'i yid la bya ba gcig gis kyang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyis khams grangs med dpag tu med pa dag tu rdul phra rab kyi rdul re re la sems can dpag tu med grangs
analyzed: 'jam dpal / theg pa chen po la mos pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas la dmigs pa'i yid la bya ba gcig gis kyang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyis khams grangs med dpag tu med pa dag tu rdul phra rab kyi rdul re re la sems can dpag tu med grangs
translated: Manjushri, even a single mental activity of bodhisattvas who aspire to the Great Vehicle, focused on the Buddha, will, in each of the countless atoms in the infinite world systems of the ten directions, cause infinite sentient beings to attain the ten grounds.

original: med pa dag ni bla na med pa'i ye shes rtogs par 'gyur bar byed /🔽sems can dpag tu med grangs med pa dag ni nyan thos dang / @201a *//
analyzed: med pa dag ni bla na med pa'i ye shes rtogs par 'gyur bar byed / sems can dpag tu med grangs med pa dag ni nyan thos dang / @201a *//
translated: Manjusri, a bodhisattva who is devoted to the Great Vehicle can, by means of a single mental activity focused on the Buddha, cause countless, immeasurable numbers of sentient beings, on each of the atoms in the countless, immeasurable world systems in the ten directions, to realize unsurpassed pristine awareness.

original: rang sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur bar byed /🔽sems can dpag tu med grangs med pa dag ni tshangs pa thob par byed /🔽sems can dpag tu med grangs med pa dag ni gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha'i 'jig rten du skye ba thob par byed /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur bar byed / sems can dpag tu med grangs med pa dag ni tshangs pa thob par byed / sems can dpag tu med grangs med pa dag ni gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha'i 'jig rten du skye ba thob par byed /
translated: He can cause countless, immeasurable numbers of sentient beings to become shravakas and pratyekabuddhas.🔽He can cause countless, immeasurable numbers of sentient beings to attain the state of Brahma.🔽He can cause countless, immeasurable numbers of sentient beings to attain birth in the Paranirmita-vasavartin divine world.

original: sems can dpag tu med grangs med pa dag ni 'phrul dga'i lha'i 'jig rten du skye ba thob par byed /
analyzed: sems can dpag tu med grangs med pa dag ni 'phrul dga'i lha'i 'jig rten du skye ba thob par byed /
translated: He can cause countless, immeasurable numbers of sentient beings to attain birth in the Nirmāṇarati divine world.

original: sems can dpag tu med grangs med pa dag ni dga' ldan gyi lha'i 'jig rten du skye ba thob par byed /
analyzed: sems can dpag tu med grangs med pa dag ni dga' ldan gyi lha'i 'jig rten du skye ba thob par byed /
translated: They cause countless, innumerable sentient beings to attain birth in the world of the Tushita gods.

original: sems can dpag tu med grangs med pa dag ni 'thab bral gyi lha'i gnas su skye ba thob par byed /
analyzed: sems can dpag tu med grangs med pa dag ni 'thab bral gyi lha'i gnas su skye ba thob par byed /
translated: They cause countless, innumerable sentient beings to attain birth in the god realm of the Yāma gods.

original: sems can dpag tu med grangs med pa dag ni sum cu rtsa gsum lha'i gnas su skye ba thob par byed /
analyzed: sems can dpag tu med grangs med pa dag ni sum cu rtsa gsum lha'i gnas su skye ba thob par byed /
translated: They cause countless, innumerable sentient beings to attain birth in the god realm of the Thirty-Three.

original: sems can dpag tu med grangs med bdag ni rgyal chen bzhi pa'i lha'i gnas su skye ba thob par byed /
analyzed: sems can dpag tu med grangs med bdag ni rgyal chen bzhi pa'i lha'i gnas su skye ba thob par byed /
translated: They cause countless, innumerable sentient beings to attain birth in the god realm of the Four Great Kings.

original: sems can dpag tu med grangs med pa dag ni lha'i rgyal po thob par byed /🔽sems can dpag tu med grangs med pa dag ni 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po thob par byed /
analyzed: sems can dpag tu med grangs med pa dag ni lha'i rgyal po thob par byed / sems can dpag tu med grangs med pa dag ni 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po thob par byed /
translated: They cause countless, innumerable sentient beings to attain the state of a god king.🔽They cause countless, innumerable sentient beings to attain the state of a universal monarch.

original: sems can dpag tu med grangs med pa dag ni stobs kyi 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po thob par byed /
analyzed: sems can dpag tu med grangs med pa dag ni stobs kyi 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po thob par byed /
translated: They cause countless, innumerable sentient beings to attain the state of a powerful universal monarch.

original: sems can dpag tu med grangs med pa dag ni klu'i dbang po thob par byed /
analyzed: sems can dpag tu med grangs med pa dag ni klu'i dbang po thob par byed /
translated: They cause countless, innumerable sentient beings to attain the state of a nāga lord.

original: sems can dpag tu med grangs med pa dag ni gnod sbyin gyi dbang po thob par byed /🔽sems can @201b dpag tu med grangs med pa dag ni dri  pa'i  dbang po thob par byed /
analyzed: sems can dpag tu med grangs med pa dag ni gnod sbyin gyi dbang po thob par byed / sems can @201b dpag tu med grangs med pa dag ni dri  pa'i  dbang po thob par byed /
translated: They cause countless, innumerable sentient beings to attain the state of a yakṣa lord.🔽They cause countless, innumerable sentient beings to attain the state of a gandharva lord.

original: sems can dpag tu med grangs med pa dag ni lha ma yin gyi dbang po thob par byed /🔽sems can dpag tu med grangs med pa dag ni mi'am ci'i dbang po thob par byed /
analyzed: sems can dpag tu med grangs med pa dag ni lha ma yin gyi dbang po thob par byed / sems can dpag tu med grangs med pa dag ni mi'am ci'i dbang po thob par byed /
translated: They cause countless, innumerable sentient beings to attain the state of an asura lord.🔽They cause countless, innumerable sentient beings to attain the state of a kinnara lord.

original: sems can dpag tu med grangs med pa dag ni lto 'phye chen po'i dbang po thob par byed /🔽sems can dpag tu med grangs med pa dag ni mi'i dbang  po thob par byed /
analyzed: sems can dpag tu med grangs med pa dag ni lto 'phye chen po'i dbang po thob par byed / sems can dpag tu med grangs med pa dag ni mi'i dbang  po thob par byed /
translated: They cause countless, innumerable sentient beings to attain the state of a mahoraga lord.🔽They cause countless, innumerable sentient beings to attain the state of a human lord.

original: sems can dpag tu med grangs med pa dag ni mir skye ba thob par byed /
analyzed: sems can dpag tu med grangs med pa dag ni mir skye ba thob par byed /
translated: They cause countless, innumerable sentient beings to attain birth as a human.

original: sems can dpag tu med grangs med pa dag ni rigs chen por skye ba thob par byed na thal mo sbyor ba lta ci smos /🔽bdug pa phul ba lta ci smos /🔽de bzhin du mar me phul ba lta ci smos /
analyzed: sems can dpag tu med grangs med pa dag ni rigs chen por skye ba thob par byed na thal mo sbyor ba lta ci smos / bdug pa phul ba lta ci smos / de bzhin du mar me phul ba lta ci smos /
translated: What need is there to mention joining one’s palms?🔽What need is there to mention offering incense?🔽What need is there to mention offering lamps?

original: spos phul ba lta ci smos /
analyzed: spos phul ba lta ci smos /
translated: What need is there to mention offering perfume?

original: me tog phul ba lta ci smos /
analyzed: me tog phul ba lta ci smos /
translated: What need is there to mention offering flowers?

original: mchod pa rnam pa mang po gzhan phul ba lta ci smos /
analyzed: mchod pa rnam pa mang po gzhan phul ba lta ci smos /
translated: What need is there to mention offering many other kinds of worship?

original: tshigs su bcad pa gcig tsam yang nyan pa dang / klog pa dang / 'dzin pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gcig tsam yang nyan pa dang / klog pa dang / 'dzin pa lta ci smos /
translated: What need is there to mention listening to, reading, or memorizing just one verse?

original: dam pa'i chos rnam pa mang po yongs su 'dzin pa lta ci smos te /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos rnam pa mang po yongs su 'dzin pa lta ci smos te /
translated: What need is there to mention upholding many kinds of the true Dharma?

original: de bas chos grangs med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pas nye bar gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas chos grangs med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pas nye bar gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the activity of the buddhas is present through countless teachings.

original: 'jam dpal / byang chub sems dpa' bskal pa'am /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / byang chub sems dpa' bskal pa'am /
translated: Mañjuśrī, a bodhisattva who teaches this Dharma discourse

original: bskal pa brgya'am /
analyzed: bskal pa brgya'am /
translated: to bodhisattvas for one eon or

original: bskal pa dpag tu med grangs med par sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dvags dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten du skye ba @202a *//
analyzed: bskal pa dpag tu med grangs med par sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dvags dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten du skye ba @202a *//
translated: For countless, immeasurable eons, they are born in the realms of hell beings, animals, hungry ghosts, and the world of Yama.

original: thob pa ni sla yi /
analyzed: thob pa ni sla yi /
translated: It is easier for them to attain birth in the realms of hell beings, animals, hungry ghosts, and the world of Yama for countless, immeasurable eons

original: byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas mnyes par ma byas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas mnyes par ma byas /
translated: than for bodhisattvas who have not pleased the Buddha,

original: chos dang / dge 'dun mnyes par ma byas pa ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: chos dang / dge 'dun mnyes par ma byas pa ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: the Dharma, and the Saṅgha.

original: 'jam dpal / de las sangs rgyas mi mnyes par byed pa dang / chos dang / dge 'dun mi mnyes par byed pa ni tha na bdag gi chung ma la mi tshangs par spyod pa las byung ba'i tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de las sangs rgyas mi mnyes par byed pa dang / chos dang / dge 'dun mi mnyes par byed pa ni tha na bdag gi chung ma la mi tshangs par spyod pa las byung ba'i tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang /
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is easier for them to displease the Buddha, the Dharma, and the Saṅgha, even if it is just by improper mental activity arising from sexual misconduct with their own wives🔽than for bodhisattvas who have pleased the Buddha, the Dharma, and the Saṅgha.

original: byang chub sems dpa' la rnam par zhe sdang ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' la brnyas pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' la khyad du gsod pa dang / chos spong ba dang / chos 'dor ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' la gus par mi byed pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la rnam par zhe sdang ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' la brnyas pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' la khyad du gsod pa dang / chos spong ba dang / chos 'dor ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' la gus par mi byed pa dang /
translated: It is to be hostile to bodhisattvas, to despise bodhisattvas, to look down on bodhisattvas, to abandon the Dharma, to reject the Dharma, to not respect bodhisattvas,

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsnyen bkur mi byed pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par byed pa 'dor ba dang / bla ma dang / sbyin pa'i gnas dang / slob dpon dang / pha ma dang / dge sbyong dang / bram ze yang dag par song ba dang /🔽yang dag par zhugs pa la gus par mi byed pa dang / chos smra ba /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsnyen bkur mi byed pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par byed pa 'dor ba dang / bla ma dang / sbyin pa'i gnas dang / slob dpon dang / pha ma dang / dge sbyong dang / bram ze yang dag par song ba dang / yang dag par zhugs pa la gus par mi byed pa dang / chos smra ba /
translated: to not serve spiritual friends, to abandon the ripening of beings, to not respect gurus, those worthy of honor, teachers, parents, ascetics, and brahmins,🔽to not respect Dharma teachers,

original: chos khyad par can rtogs pa /
analyzed: chos khyad par can rtogs pa /
translated: to not respect those who have realized the special Dharma,

original: chos rgya chen po ston pa theg pa chen po la yang dag par gnas pa /
analyzed: chos rgya chen po ston pa theg pa chen po la yang dag par gnas pa /
translated: to not respect those who teach the vast Dharma, those who abide in the Great Vehicle,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam gyi bya ba shes pa /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam gyi bya ba shes pa /
translated: and those who know the activities of the path to nirvāṇa,
