original: gzungs dang / mdo sde'i rgyal po thob pa rnams la mi 'dud cing brjid byed pa dang / khengs @202b pa yin /
analyzed: gzungs dang / mdo sde'i rgyal po thob pa rnams la mi 'dud cing brjid byed pa dang / khengs @202b pa yin /
translated: It is to be arrogant and to not bow to those who have attained the dhāraṇīs and the king of sūtras.

original: chos dang / chos smra ba la mi gus pa skyed pa dang / sri zhu dang / rim gro mi byed pa dang / chos rgya mtsho chen po bsgrags pa byung na la la zhig dad par gyur na mi rung ngo snyam nas chos smrq aba'i gang zag la legs so zhes bya ba sbyin par mi byed pa dang /
analyzed: chos dang / chos smra ba la mi gus pa skyed pa dang / sri zhu dang / rim gro mi byed pa dang / chos rgya mtsho chen po bsgrags pa byung na la la zhig dad par gyur na mi rung ngo snyam nas chos smrq aba'i gang zag la legs so zhes bya ba sbyin par mi byed pa dang /
translated: It is to not respect the Dharma and those who teach the Dharma, to not serve them or honor them, and to not give the approval of “excellent!” to the Dharma or to those who teach the Dharma, thinking, “It is not appropriate that some should have faith when the great ocean of the Dharma is proclaimed.”

original: bdag shes pa la mi 'jug pa dang / chos la nges par sems pa mi skyed pa dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal bskyed de bsngags par 'os pa'i gang zag rnams kyi bsngags pa bcabs shing mi snyan pa brjod pa dang / pha rol gyi yon tan dang /
analyzed: bdag shes pa la mi 'jug pa dang / chos la nges par sems pa mi skyed pa dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal bskyed de bsngags par 'os pa'i gang zag rnams kyi bsngags pa bcabs shing mi snyan pa brjod pa dang / pha rol gyi yon tan dang /
translated: It is to not engage in self-knowledge, to not give rise to certainty in the Dharma, to give rise to pride, to conceal the praise of those who are worthy of praise, to speak unpleasantly of them, and to not rejoice in the qualities and praise of others.

original: bsngags pa la mi dga' ba yin /
analyzed: bsngags pa la mi dga' ba yin /
translated: It is to not rejoice in the Dharma.

original: gang zag la zhe sdang bas chos la zhe sdang bar byed cing chos spong ba dang / gzhan dag kyang rtsod du 'jug pa dang / stan mthon po 'dod cing thabs tshol ba dang / gzhan las rim gror bya ba bdag gis byed cing mngon par dga' ba dang /
analyzed: gang zag la zhe sdang bas chos la zhe sdang bar byed cing chos spong ba dang / gzhan dag kyang rtsod du 'jug pa dang / stan mthon po 'dod cing thabs tshol ba dang / gzhan las rim gror bya ba bdag gis byed cing mngon par dga' ba dang /
translated: They hate people and so hate the Dharma, and they abandon the Dharma. They cause others to argue. They want high seats and seek out ways to get them. They want to be served by others and take pleasure in that.

original: gnas brtan rgan zhing yun ring du tshangs par spyad pa rnams la rim gro mi byed cing bsu bar mi byed la bzhin khro gnyer can yin /
analyzed: gnas brtan rgan zhing yun ring du tshangs par spyad pa rnams la rim gro mi byed cing bsu bar mi byed la bzhin khro gnyer can yin /
translated: They do not respect or welcome the elders, those who have been celibate for a long time. They have angry, scowling faces.

original: rtag tu sems rtsub cing klan ka tshol ba dang / glags lta ba dang / nga rgyal bskyed nas mkhas pa'i gan du mi 'gro /
analyzed: rtag tu sems rtsub cing klan ka tshol ba dang / glags lta ba dang / nga rgyal bskyed nas mkhas pa'i gan du mi 'gro /
translated: They are always rough, looking for faults, looking for opportunities, and they do not go to the wise ones, having given rise to pride.

original: mi ste na /🔽snyen par mi byed /
analyzed: mi ste na / snyen par mi byed /
translated: If they do go,🔽they do not attend on them.

original: bkur sti mi byed cing dag ba ni gang /
analyzed: bkur sti mi byed cing dag ba ni gang /
translated: They do not respect them.🔽They do not know what is wholesome

original: mi dge ba ni gang /
analyzed: mi dge ba ni gang /
translated: and what is unwholesome,

original: bya ba ni gang /🔽mi bya ba ni gang /
analyzed: bya ba ni gang / mi bya ba ni gang /
translated: what should be done🔽and what should not be done,

original: bya ba ma yin pa ni gang /🔽ci zhig @203a *//
analyzed: bya ba ma yin pa ni gang /🔽ci zhig @203a *//
translated: what is improper🔽and what is proper.

original: byas na yun ring po'i don dang / phan pa dang / bde bar 'gyur zhes mi 'dri ba dang / nges par 'byung bar mi lta zhing rtsod pa mang ba yin te /
analyzed: byas na yun ring po'i don dang / phan pa dang / bde bar 'gyur zhes mi 'dri ba dang / nges par 'byung bar mi lta zhing rtsod pa mang ba yin te /
translated: They will not look to liberation, but will have much dispute.

original: 'jam dpal / de ltar na sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun mi mnyes par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de ltar na sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun mi mnyes par byed pa yin no //
translated: Mañjuśrī, in this way they displease the Buddha, the Dharma, and the Saṅgha.

original: 'jam dpal / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni dbang skur bar 'gyur ba'i gzungs thob par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni dbang skur bar 'gyur ba'i gzungs thob par 'gyur /
translated: Mañjuśrī, bodhisattvas who are supported by a spiritual friend will attain the consecration dhāraṇī.

original: rgya mtsho dam pa'i snying po dri ma med par snang ba 'od gsal ba'i gzungs thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgya mtsho dam pa'i snying po dri ma med par snang ba 'od gsal ba'i gzungs thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will attain the dhāraṇī of the clear light of the stainless essence of the ocean.

original: 'jam dpal / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni bskal ba bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag dpag tu med grangs med pa dag tu sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dvags dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten du gnas par 'gyur ba'i las rnams tshe 'di la rnam par smin par 'gyur te /🔽klad pa tsha bas sam /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni bskal ba bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag dpag tu med grangs med pa dag tu sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dvags dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten du gnas par 'gyur ba'i las rnams tshe 'di la rnam par smin par 'gyur te / klad pa tsha bas sam /
translated: He will experience the ripening of those actions in the form of a headache,🔽or a fever,

original: rims tsha bas sam /
analyzed: rims tsha bas sam /
translated: or a pain in the limbs,🔽or a disturbance in the country,🔽or a disturbance caused by barbarians,

original: rtsi ba logs na bas sam /
analyzed: rtsi ba logs na bas sam /
translated: or a disturbance caused by famine,

original: rgyal srid 'khrugs pas sam /🔽kla klo 'khrugs pas sam /
analyzed: rgyal srid 'khrugs pas sam / kla klo 'khrugs pas sam /
translated: or a disturbance caused by the king,🔽or a disturbance caused by thieves,

original: mu ge'i 'khrugs pas sam /
analyzed: mu ge'i 'khrugs pas sam /
translated: or a disturbance caused by fire,🔽or a disturbance caused by water.

original: lus la gnod pa dang / yid la gnod pa gang yang rung bas brgyad bkag pas kyang tshe gcig la byang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: lus la gnod pa dang / yid la gnod pa gang yang rung bas brgyad bkag pas kyang tshe gcig la byang bar 'gyur te /
translated: He will experience the ripening of those actions in the form of any kind of physical or mental suffering.

original: tha na rmi lam tsam gyis kyang byang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha na rmi lam tsam gyis kyang byang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He will experience the ripening of those actions in the form of a dream.

original: 'jam dpal / dge ba'i bshes @203b gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni sangs rgyas bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag dpag tu med pa dag las dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / dge ba'i bshes @203b gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni sangs rgyas bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag dpag tu med pa dag las dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī, a bodhisattva who is supported by a spiritual friend outshines in a single morning those bodhisattvas who have planted roots of virtue under countless quintillions of buddhas,

original: sbyin pa las byung ba dang / mchod pa las byung ba dang / de dag gi thad nas bslab pa bzung ba las byung ba rnams snga dro gcig gis zil gyis gnon te /
analyzed: sbyin pa las byung ba dang / mchod pa las byung ba dang / de dag gi thad nas bslab pa bzung ba las byung ba rnams snga dro gcig gis zil gyis gnon te /
translated: who have engaged in generosity, who have engaged in offerings, and who have engaged in the precepts in the presence of those buddhas.

original: de ltar dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsnyen bkur bya ba ni yon tan bsam gyis mi khyab bo //
analyzed: de ltar dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsnyen bkur bya ba ni yon tan bsam gyis mi khyab bo //
translated: Thus, the service of a spiritual friend has inconceivable qualities.

original: 'jam dpal / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni gter bcu rnyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni gter bcu rnyed par 'gyur te /
translated: “Mañjuśrī, a bodhisattva who is supported by a spiritual friend obtains ten treasures.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la bgrang bar sbyor pa'i gter dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la nges par sems pa'i gter dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la gzungs snang ba'i gter dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la so so yang dag par rig pa rab tu ston pa'i gter dang /🔽sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la brjod du med pa'i tshul la mkhas pa rtogs par byed pa'i gter dang / sangs rgyas kyi rnam par 'phrul pa dang / cho 'phrul thams cad mngon sum du mthong ba'i gter dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la mnyam pa nyid du sgrub pa la mkhas pa'i gter dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la bgrang bar sbyor pa'i gter dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la nges par sems pa'i gter dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la gzungs snang ba'i gter dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la so so yang dag par rig pa rab tu ston pa'i gter dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la brjod du med pa'i tshul la mkhas pa rtogs par byed pa'i gter dang / sangs rgyas kyi rnam par 'phrul pa dang / cho 'phrul thams cad mngon sum du mthong ba'i gter dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la mnyam pa nyid du sgrub pa la mkhas pa'i gter dang /
translated: the treasure of applying the enumeration of all the qualities of the buddhas, the treasure of ascertaining all the qualities of the buddhas, the treasure of the dhāraṇī illumination of all the qualities of the buddhas, the treasure of teaching the correct discrimination of all the qualities of the buddhas,🔽the treasure of realizing the skill in the way of inexpressibility of all the qualities of the buddhas, the treasure of directly seeing all the miracles and manifestations of the buddhas, the treasure of the skill in accomplishing the sameness of all the qualities of the buddhas,

original: sangs rgyas thams cad mthong ba dang mi 'bral @204a *//
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad mthong ba dang mi 'bral @204a *//
translated: and the treasure of never being separated from seeing all the buddhas.

original: ba'i gter dang / sgyu mar gyur pa'i bskal pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa yongs su 'grub par 'jug pa la mkhas pa'i gter dang / sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la dga' ba dang / mchog tu dga' ba dang / dang ba chen po 'thob pa'i gter ro //
analyzed: ba'i gter dang / sgyu mar gyur pa'i bskal pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa yongs su 'grub par 'jug pa la mkhas pa'i gter dang / sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la dga' ba dang / mchog tu dga' ba dang / dang ba chen po 'thob pa'i gter ro //
translated: the treasure of the knowledge of the accomplishment of the inconceivable eons of the illusory transformations, and the treasure of the attainment of the joy, supreme joy, and great joy of all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.

original: 'jam dpal / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni dbang bcu thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni dbang bcu thob par 'gyur te /
translated: Mañjuśrī, the bodhisattva who is assisted by a spiritual friend obtains ten powers.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: tshe'i tshad bskal pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa dag tu byin gyis rlob pa'i phyir tshe la dbang ba dang / ting nge 'dzin dpag tu med grangs med pa dag la nges par sems pa'i ye shes la 'jug pa'i phyir sems la dbang ba dang /
analyzed: tshe'i tshad bskal pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa dag tu byin gyis rlob pa'i phyir tshe la dbang ba dang / ting nge 'dzin dpag tu med grangs med pa dag la nges par sems pa'i ye shes la 'jug pa'i phyir sems la dbang ba dang /
translated: the power over life, because he can bless the life for inexpressibly inexpressible eons; the power over mind, because he can enter into the wisdom of certainty in the innumerable, incalculable samādhis;

original: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad bkod pa dang / rgyan du mas brgyan pa'i byin gyi rlabs kun tu ston pa'i phyir yo byad la dbang pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du skye ba kun tu ston pa'i phyir skye ba la dbang ba dang /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad bkod pa dang / rgyan du mas brgyan pa'i byin gyi rlabs kun tu ston pa'i phyir yo byad la dbang pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du skye ba kun tu ston pa'i phyir skye ba la dbang ba dang /
translated: It is mastery of requisites because it displays the blessing of all world systems being adorned with many arrays and ornaments.🔽It is mastery of birth because it displays the manifestation of birth in all world systems.🔽It is mastery of action because it displays the blessing of the ripening of actions in accordance with time.

original: dus ji lta ba bzhin du las kyi rnam par smin pa byin gyis rlob pa kun tu ston pa'i phyir las la dbang ba dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad sangs rgyas kyis gang bar byin gyis rlob pa kun tu ston pa'i phyir mos pa la dbang ba dang /
analyzed: dus ji lta ba bzhin du las kyi rnam par smin pa byin gyis rlob pa kun tu ston pa'i phyir las la dbang ba dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad sangs rgyas kyis gang bar byin gyis rlob pa kun tu ston pa'i phyir mos pa la dbang ba dang /
translated: It is mastery of aspiration because it displays the blessing of all world systems being filled with buddhas.

original: dus gang dang / gang gi tshe byang chub mngon @204b par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pa'i dus de dang / der byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing gang dang / gang du 'dod pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dang; der byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'i phyir smon lam la dbang ba dang /
analyzed: dus gang dang / gang gi tshe byang chub mngon @204b par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pa'i dus de dang / der byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing gang dang / gang du 'dod pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dang; der byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'i phyir smon lam la dbang ba dang /
translated: “In order to attain manifest complete enlightenment in whatever buddha realm they wish, they have power over aspiration.🔽“In order to display miracles and manifestations in all buddha realms, they have power over miracles.🔽“In order to display the illumination of the limitless Dharma gateway, they have power over phenomena.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad rdzu 'phrul dang / rnam par 'phrul pa kun tu ston pa'i phyir rdzu 'phrul la dbang ba dang mtha' dang / dbus med pa'i chos kyi sgo snang ba kun tu ston pa'i phyir chos la dbang ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad rdzu 'phrul dang / rnam par 'phrul pa kun tu ston pa'i phyir rdzu 'phrul la dbang ba dang mtha' dang / dbus med pa'i chos kyi sgo snang ba kun tu ston pa'i phyir chos la dbang ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang /
translated: “In order to attain the ten powers of the tathāgatas, they have power over the dhāraṇī gateway.

original: mi 'jigs pa dang / mtshan dang / dpe byad bzang po rnams dang / rdzogs pa'i byang chub kun tu ston pa'i phyir ye shes la dbang ba'o //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa dang / mtshan dang / dpe byad bzang po rnams dang / rdzogs pa'i byang chub kun tu ston pa'i phyir ye shes la dbang ba'o //
translated: He has power over knowledge, because he demonstrates perfect enlightenment.

original: 'jam dpal / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni skra'i khyon tsam gcig la phyogs bcu'i nam mkha' mthas klas pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams rnams 'jug par byed kyang sems can gang la'ang gnod pa dang / sgrib pa med de /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni skra'i khyon tsam gcig la phyogs bcu'i nam mkha' mthas klas pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams rnams 'jug par byed kyang sems can gang la'ang gnod pa dang / sgrib pa med de /
translated: Mañjuśrī, a bodhisattva who is assisted by a spiritual teacher can cause the world systems of the ten directions, as many as there are, to enter into a single hair-tip, without any sentient being being harmed or obstructed.

original: sngon ji lta bar phyis kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: sngon ji lta bar phyis kyang de bzhin no //
translated: Just as before, so afterwards.🔽He can bless an incalculable,

original: bskal pa dpag tu med grangs med //
analyzed: bskal pa dpag tu med grangs med //
translated: incomparable,

original: bsam gyis mi khyab /🔽mtshungs pa med pa rnams yud tsam gcig tu byin gyis rlob cing yud tsam gcig ni bskal pa dpag tu med grangs med /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab / mtshungs pa med pa rnams yud tsam gcig tu byin gyis rlob cing yud tsam gcig ni bskal pa dpag tu med grangs med /
translated: inconceivable,

original: bsam gyis mi khyab par byin gyis rlob ste /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab par byin gyis rlob ste /
translated: immeasurable number of eons to be a single moment, and he can bless a single moment to be an incalculable, incomparable, inconceivable, immeasurable number of eons.

original: bskal pa re re @205a *//
analyzed: bskal pa re re @205a *//
translated: He can bless each eon to be

original: la'ang mes 'jig pa dang / chus 'jig pa dang / rlung gis 'jig pa byin gyis rlob kyang sems can gang la'ang yo byad cis kyang phongs par mi 'gyur zhing lus la gnod pa'am /
analyzed: la'ang mes 'jig pa dang / chus 'jig pa dang / rlung gis 'jig pa byin gyis rlob kyang sems can gang la'ang yo byad cis kyang phongs par mi 'gyur zhing lus la gnod pa'am /
translated: without any harm to their bodies,

original: sems la mi bde ba'ang mi 'byung la /🔽sems can gang ji ltar yongs su smin par 'gyur ba des bya ba de lta bu'ang shes so //
analyzed: sems la mi bde ba'ang mi 'byung la / sems can gang ji ltar yongs su smin par 'gyur ba des bya ba de lta bu'ang shes so //
translated: and without any mental discomfort.

original: 'jam dpal / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni 'dod na phyogs bcu'i phyogs re re'ang sangs rgyas kyi yul gyi mtha' klas pa'i bar gyi 'jig rten gyi khams rnams su /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni 'dod na phyogs bcu'i phyogs re re'ang sangs rgyas kyi yul gyi mtha' klas pa'i bar gyi 'jig rten gyi khams rnams su /
translated: Mañjuśrī, a bodhisattva who is assisted by a spiritual friend, if he wishes, can, in each of the ten directions, in world systems as numerous as the atoms in a buddhafield,

original: 'jig rten gyi khams re re na rdul phra rab kyi rdul re re la sangs rgyas kyi yul gyi mtha' klas pa'i lus rnams kyis lus re res kyang dga' ldan gyi gnas nas shi 'phos pa dang / skye ba dang / mngon par 'byung ba dang /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams re re na rdul phra rab kyi rdul re re la sangs rgyas kyi yul gyi mtha' klas pa'i lus rnams kyis lus re res kyang dga' ldan gyi gnas nas shi 'phos pa dang / skye ba dang / mngon par 'byung ba dang /
translated: In each world system, in each atom, with bodies as numerous as the limits of the sky, each body showing the passing away from Tuṣita Palace, the taking birth, the leaving of home life,

original: dka' ba spyod par sbyor ba dang / byang chub kyi snying por 'gro ba dang / bdud 'dul ba ston pa dang / mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar bskul ba dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'ang ston to //
analyzed: dka' ba spyod par sbyor ba dang / byang chub kyi snying por 'gro ba dang / bdud 'dul ba ston pa dang / mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar bskul ba dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'ang ston to //
translated: the practice of austerities, the going to the seat of awakening, the conquering of the demons, the full awakening, the request to turn the wheel of Dharma, and the passing into the great parinirvāṇa.

original: 'jam dpal; dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni 'dod na phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams re rer rdul phra rab kyi rdul re re la @205b sangs rgyas kyi yul gyi mtha' klas pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnams 'jug par byed
analyzed: 'jam dpal; dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni 'dod na phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams re rer rdul phra rab kyi rdul re re la @205b sangs rgyas kyi yul gyi mtha' klas pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnams 'jug par byed
translated: Mañjuśrī, if a bodhisattva is sustained by a spiritual friend, he can, if he wishes, cause each atom in each world system in the ten directions to be filled with the infinite buddha-fields of the buddhas.

original: cing / phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad kyi rgyan gyi yon tan bkod pa gang dag yin pa de dag zhing gcig tu ston par byed /
analyzed: cing / phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad kyi rgyan gyi yon tan bkod pa gang dag yin pa de dag zhing gcig tu ston par byed /
translated: He can cause the array of the qualities of the adornments of all the buddha-fields in the ten directions to appear in a single buddha-field.

original: zhing gcig gi rgyan gyi yon tan bkod pa gang dag yin pa de dag zhing thams cad du ston par byed /
analyzed: zhing gcig gi rgyan gyi yon tan bkod pa gang dag yin pa de dag zhing thams cad du ston par byed /
translated: He can cause the array of the qualities of the adornments of a single buddha-field to appear in all the buddha-fields.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi 'khor gyi nang na'ang snang la gnas nas kyang mi g-yo'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi 'khor gyi nang na'ang snang la gnas nas kyang mi g-yo'o //
translated: He can appear in the retinue of all the tathāgatas in all the buddha-fields, yet he does not move from his seat.

original: 'jam dpal / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni 'dod na phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi sems can thams cad kyi lus sems can gcig gi lus su ston te /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni 'dod na phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi sems can thams cad kyi lus sems can gcig gi lus su ston te /
translated: Manjusri, if a Bodhisattva who is under the care of a spiritual friend wishes to do so, he can display the bodies of all the sentient beings of all the world systems of the ten directions in the body of a single sentient being.

original: sems can gcig gi lus sems can thams cad kyi lus su ston kyang lus 'dres par yang mi byed de /
analyzed: sems can gcig gi lus sems can thams cad kyi lus su ston kyang lus 'dres par yang mi byed de /
translated: He can display the body of a single sentient being in the bodies of all sentient beings, without, however, mixing up the bodies.

original: sems can gang la'ang gnod par mi 'gyur zhing bya ba de lta bu de'ang ston te /
analyzed: sems can gang la'ang gnod par mi 'gyur zhing bya ba de lta bu de'ang ston te /
translated: He can do this without harming any sentient being, and he can display this activity.

original: lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par sems can rnams kyang yongs su smin par byed do //
analyzed: lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par sems can rnams kyang yongs su smin par byed do //
translated: He can do this spontaneously and nonconceptually, and he can bring sentient beings to full maturity.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams rab 'byams thams cad kyi sangs rgyas thams cad sangs rgyas gcig tu byin gyis rlob cing /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams rab 'byams thams cad kyi sangs rgyas thams cad sangs rgyas gcig tu byin gyis rlob cing /
translated: He can cause all the Buddhas of all the world systems of the whole of space to bless a single Buddha.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa gcig kyang sangs rgyas kyi yul gyi mthas klas pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad du byin gyis rlob la de bzhin gshegs pa @206a *//
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa gcig kyang sangs rgyas kyi yul gyi mthas klas pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad du byin gyis rlob la de bzhin gshegs pa @206a *//
translated: He also manifests as all the thus-gone ones, as limitless as the domain of the Buddha, while remaining a single thus-gone one.

original: rnams 'dres par yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnams 'dres par yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: The thus-gone ones do not merge,

original: lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par bya ba de lta bu thams cad kyang ston to //
analyzed: lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par bya ba de lta bu thams cad kyang ston to //
translated: but he manifests all of these activities, which are spontaneous and nonconceptual.

original: lus gcig gis mnyam par 'jog la /
analyzed: lus gcig gis mnyam par 'jog la /
translated: He enters meditative absorption with one body

original: lus dpag tu med grangs med pa dag gis ldang zhing lus dpag tu med grangs med pa dag gis mnyam par bzhag la lus gcig gis ldang ngo ////🔽bam po gsum pa ste tha ma /
analyzed: lus dpag tu med grangs med pa dag gis ldang zhing lus dpag tu med grangs med pa dag gis mnyam par bzhag la lus gcig gis ldang ngo //// bam po gsum pa ste tha ma /
translated: and arises with countless bodies, and he enters meditative absorption with countless bodies and arises with a single body.

original: 'jam dpal / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni chos kyi dbyings la spyod yul ba'ang yin la sems can gyi khams la spyod yul bar yang snang ngo //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni chos kyi dbyings la spyod yul ba'ang yin la sems can gyi khams la spyod yul bar yang snang ngo //
translated: Mañjuśrī, the bodhisattvas who are sustained by a spiritual friend have the domain of the realm of phenomena and also appear to have the domain of the realm of sentient beings.

original: sangs rgyas kyi spyod yul la mngon par dga' ba'ang yin la bdud kyi spyod yul bar yang rnam par snang ngo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi spyod yul la mngon par dga' ba'ang yin la bdud kyi spyod yul bar yang rnam par snang ngo //
translated: They delight in the domain of the buddhas, and yet they manifest within the domain of Māra.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i spyod yul ba'ang yin la 'khor ba'i spyod yul bar yang snang ngo //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i spyod yul ba'ang yin la 'khor ba'i spyod yul bar yang snang ngo //
translated: They have the domain of nirvāṇa, and yet they manifest within the domain of saṃsāra.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes spyod yul pa'ang yin la byang chub sems dpa'i spyod yul bar yang snang ngo //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes spyod yul pa'ang yin la byang chub sems dpa'i spyod yul bar yang snang ngo //
translated: They have the domain of omniscient wisdom, and yet they manifest within the domain of bodhisattvas.

original: zhi ba'i spyod yul ba yang yin la ma zhi ba dang / rab tu ma zhi ba dang / nye bar ma zhi ba'i spyod yul ba'ang snang ste /
analyzed: zhi ba'i spyod yul ba yang yin la ma zhi ba dang / rab tu ma zhi ba dang / nye bar ma zhi ba'i spyod yul ba'ang snang ste /
translated: They have the domain of peace, and yet they manifest within the domain of the unpeaceful, the very unpeaceful, and the utterly unpeaceful.

original: sems can rnams kyang 'dul lo //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyang 'dul lo //
translated: They tame beings.

original: blang ba med pa dang / dor ba med pa dang / spros pa med pa dang / ma spros pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / dngos po med pa dang / shes par bya ba med pa dang / bar snang dang mtshungs @206b pa spyod yul ba'ang yin la spros pa dang /
analyzed: blang ba med pa dang / dor ba med pa dang / spros pa med pa dang / ma spros pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / dngos po med pa dang / shes par bya ba med pa dang / bar snang dang mtshungs @206b pa spyod yul ba'ang yin la spros pa dang /
translated: They have the domain of the absence of appropriation, the absence of rejection, the absence of conceptual elaboration, non-elaboration, the absence of signs, the absence of entities, the absence of cognition, and the sky, and yet they manifest within the domain of conceptual elaboration, conceptualization, and signs.

original: mtshan ma dang / dmigs pa spyod yul ba'i sems can thams cad kyi nang na'ang snang ngo //
analyzed: mtshan ma dang / dmigs pa spyod yul ba'i sems can thams cad kyi nang na'ang snang ngo //
translated: He appears among all sentient beings who are in the domain of signs and objects.

original: stobs bkod pa'i spyod yul ba'ang yin la gzugs bzang po'i spyod yul bar yang snang ngo //
analyzed: stobs bkod pa'i spyod yul ba'ang yin la gzugs bzang po'i spyod yul bar yang snang ngo //
translated: He is in the domain of the arrangement of powers, and he appears in the domain of a good physical form.

original: chos thams cad skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pas gnyen po spyod yul pa'ang yin la sems can yongs su smin par skyed pa'i spyod yul bar yang snang ngo //
analyzed: chos thams cad skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pas gnyen po spyod yul pa'ang yin la sems can yongs su smin par skyed pa'i spyod yul bar yang snang ngo //
translated: He is in the domain of the antidote, because all phenomena are unborn and unceasing, and he appears in the domain of the production of the full ripening of sentient beings.

original: ye shes dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / rig pa dang / rnam par grol ba'i spyod yul ba'ang yin la phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams rab 'byams thams cad kyi lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang /
analyzed: ye shes dang / rnam par thar pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / rig pa dang / rnam par grol ba'i spyod yul ba'ang yin la phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams rab 'byams thams cad kyi lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang /
translated: He is in the domain of pristine consciousness, liberation, higher knowledge, awareness, and liberation, and he appears in the domain of the gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kiṃnaras, and mahoragas of all the infinite world systems in the ten directions.

original: dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten skyong ba dang / srin po dang / 'byung po dang / yi dvags dang /
analyzed: dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten skyong ba dang / srin po dang / 'byung po dang / yi dvags dang /
translated: He appears to be ripening gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, mahoragas, Śakras, Brahmās, Lokapālas, rākṣasas, bhūtas, pretas,

original: sha za dang / grul bum dang / srul po dang / lus srul po dang / sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro'i skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten du skyes pa dang / sgo nga las skyes pa dang / mngal nas skyes pa dang /
analyzed: sha za dang / grul bum dang / srul po dang / lus srul po dang / sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro'i skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten du skyes pa dang / sgo nga las skyes pa dang / mngal nas skyes pa dang /
translated: piśācas, pūtanas, kaṭapūtanas, beings born in the hells, animals, the world of Yama, those born from eggs, those born from wombs,

original: drod gsher las skyes pa dang / rdzus te skyes pa dang / gzugs can dang / gzugs can ma yin pa dang / 'du shes can dang / 'du shes can ma yin pa dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min nas gzugs med @207a *//
analyzed: drod gsher las skyes pa dang / rdzus te skyes pa dang / gzugs can dang / gzugs can ma yin pa dang / 'du shes can dang / 'du shes can ma yin pa dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min nas gzugs med @207a *//
translated: those born from warm moisture, those born miraculously, those with form, those without form, those with perception, those without perception, those with neither perception nor non-perception, and those up to the formless realm.

original: pa'i bar gyi sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed par yang snang ngo //
analyzed: pa'i bar gyi sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed par yang snang ngo //
translated: He appears to be ripening beings.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod pa dang / mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi bkod pa thams cad kyi spyod yul thob pa'ang yin la nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi cho ga dang / spyod lam yang kun tu ston to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod pa dang / mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi bkod pa thams cad kyi spyod yul thob pa'ang yin la nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi cho ga dang / spyod lam yang kun tu ston to //
translated: They have attained the domain of the conduct of the tathāgatas, their manifest, complete awakening, and all the arrays of buddhas, and they also display the conduct and behavior of all hearers and solitary buddhas.

original: 'jam dpal / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can thams cad kyi sgra sems can gcig gi sgrar 'jug par byed la /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can thams cad kyi sgra sems can gcig gi sgrar 'jug par byed la /
translated: Mañjuśrī, bodhisattvas who are sustained by a spiritual friend can make the sounds of all sentient beings into the sound of a single sentient being,

original: sems can gcig gi sgra sems can thams cad kyi sgrar 'jug par byed cing /
analyzed: sems can gcig gi sgra sems can thams cad kyi sgrar 'jug par byed cing /
translated: and they can make the sound of a single sentient being into the sound of all sentient beings.

original: sgra rnams 'dres par yang mi 'gyur sems can gang gi sgra la'ang sgrib par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgra rnams 'dres par yang mi 'gyur sems can gang gi sgra la'ang sgrib par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They do not mix up the sounds, and they do not obscure the sounds of any sentient being.

original: 'jam dpal / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams rab 'byams thams cad du rang gi lus sa'i khams dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang /🔽rlung gi khams su byin gyis rlob bo //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams rab 'byams thams cad du rang gi lus sa'i khams dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams su byin gyis rlob bo //
translated: Mañjuśrī, the bodhisattva who is sustained by the wisdom teacher, without effort and without discursive thought, in all the infinite world systems of the ten directions, transforms his own body into the elements of earth, water, fire, and wind.

original: 'jam dpal / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can gyi lus la zhing gi lus kun tu ston kyang sems can gyi lus dang 'dres par yang mi byed /🔽zhing gi lus la sems @207b can gyi lus kun tu ston kyang zhing gi lus dang 'dres par yang mi byed do //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can gyi lus la zhing gi lus kun tu ston kyang sems can gyi lus dang 'dres par yang mi byed / zhing gi lus la sems @207b can gyi lus kun tu ston kyang zhing gi lus dang 'dres par yang mi byed do //
translated: Mañjuśrī, the bodhisattva who is sustained by the wisdom teacher, without mixing up the bodies of sentient beings, manifests in the body of a buddha the bodies of all sentient beings.🔽Mañjuśrī, the bodhisattva who is sustained by the wisdom teacher, without mixing up the body of a buddha, manifests in the bodies of all sentient beings the body of a buddha.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sku la nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi lus su kun tu ston kyang sangs rgyas kyi sku dman par yang mi byed do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sku la nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi lus su kun tu ston kyang sangs rgyas kyi sku dman par yang mi byed do //
translated: Mañjuśrī, the bodhisattva who is sustained by the wisdom teacher, without diminishing the body of a buddha, manifests in the bodies of śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas the body of a buddha.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi lus la sangs rgyas kyi sku kun tu ston kyang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi lus rgya chen por yang mi byed do //
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi lus la sangs rgyas kyi sku kun tu ston kyang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi lus rgya chen por yang mi byed do //
translated: He manifests the body of a Buddha in the bodies of the disciples and the solitary sages, without enlarging the bodies of the disciples and solitary sages.

original: spyod pa'i lus la mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i sku kun tu ston kyang spyod pa'i rgyun chad par yang mi byed do //
analyzed: spyod pa'i lus la mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i sku kun tu ston kyang spyod pa'i rgyun chad par yang mi byed do //
translated: He manifests the body of perfect enlightenment in the bodies of those who are practicing, without interrupting the continuity of their practice.

original: mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i sku la spyod pa'i lus kun tu ston kyang mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i sku nyams par yang mi byed do //🔽mya ngan las 'das pa 'khor ba'i rgyun du ston kyang mya ngan las 'das pa la mngon par zhen pa 'ang mi skyed do //
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i sku la spyod pa'i lus kun tu ston kyang mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i sku nyams par yang mi byed do // mya ngan las 'das pa 'khor ba'i rgyun du ston kyang mya ngan las 'das pa la mngon par zhen pa 'ang mi skyed do //
translated: He manifests the bodies of those who are practicing in the body of perfect enlightenment, without diminishing the body of perfect enlightenment.🔽He manifests nirvana in the continuity of cyclic life, without producing any attachment to nirvana.

original: 'khor ba mya ngan las 'das pa kun tu ston kyang gtan du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar yang mi byed do //
analyzed: 'khor ba mya ngan las 'das pa kun tu ston kyang gtan du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar yang mi byed do //
translated: He manifests cyclic life in nirvana, without attaining final nirvana in the eternal.

original: mnyam par yang bzhag la bya ba thams cad kyang ston te /
analyzed: mnyam par yang bzhag la bya ba thams cad kyang ston te /
translated: And while remaining in meditative equipoise, they display all activities.🔽

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: He also displays all activities while remaining in meditative equipoise.

original: 'ong ba dang / 'gro ba dang / 'greng ba dang / nyal bar byed do //
analyzed: 'ong ba dang / 'gro ba dang / 'greng ba dang / nyal bar byed do //
translated: He comes and goes, stands and lies down.

original: spyod lam thams cad kyang kun tu ston la ting nge 'dzin rnam par 'khrug par mi byed do //
analyzed: spyod lam thams cad kyang kun tu ston la ting nge 'dzin rnam par 'khrug par mi byed do //
translated: He displays all forms of conduct without disturbing his meditative absorption.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa gcig gi zhabs kyi drung na chos nyan par yang snang la /🔽phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams rab 'byams thams cad na de bzhin gshegs pa thams @208a *//
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa gcig gi zhabs kyi drung na chos nyan par yang snang la / phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams rab 'byams thams cad na de bzhin gshegs pa thams @208a *//
translated: He appears to be listening to the Dharma in the presence of a single tathāgata.

original: cad kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor dag na gzugs dang / lus dang / kha dog yongs su 'grub pa gzhan dang / gzhan dag gis kyang chos nyan la ting nge 'dzin tha dad par yang mi byed cing /
analyzed: cad kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor dag na gzugs dang / lus dang / kha dog yongs su 'grub pa gzhan dang / gzhan dag gis kyang chos nyan la ting nge 'dzin tha dad par yang mi byed cing /
translated: But in all the infinite world systems of the ten directions, in the retinues of all the tathāgatas, he listens to the Dharma with different forms, bodies, and complexions.

original: chos kyang len la 'dzin te /
analyzed: chos kyang len la 'dzin te /
translated: He does not disturb his meditative absorption, but he receives and holds the Dharma.

original: 'don cing kun chub par yang byed la sangs rgyas de dag las chos nyan pa'i rgyun chad par yang mi byed do //
analyzed: 'don cing kun chub par yang byed la sangs rgyas de dag las chos nyan pa'i rgyun chad par yang mi byed do //
translated: He recites and masters it, but he does not interrupt his listening to the Dharma from those buddhas.

original: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams rab 'byams thams cad du gzugs dang / lus dang / kha dog yongs su 'grub pa tha dad pas sems can rnams yongs su smin par yang byed la lus tha dad par yang mi byed cing gnas nas kyang mi g-yo'o //🔽phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams rab 'byams thams cad du bya ba thams cad kun tu ston kyang ting nge 'dzin tha dad par yang mi byed do //
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams rab 'byams thams cad du gzugs dang / lus dang / kha dog yongs su 'grub pa tha dad pas sems can rnams yongs su smin par yang byed la lus tha dad par yang mi byed cing gnas nas kyang mi g-yo'o // phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams rab 'byams thams cad du bya ba thams cad kun tu ston kyang ting nge 'dzin tha dad par yang mi byed do //
translated: In all the infinite world systems of the ten directions, they bring beings to full maturity, by means of different forms, bodies, and colors, but they do not make their bodies different, and they do not move from their location.🔽In all the infinite world systems of the ten directions, they manifest all activities, but they do not make their meditative absorptions different.

original: sems kyi skad cig sems kyi skad cig la ting nge 'dzin bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag dpag tu med grangs med pa dag kyang mngon par sgrub la ting nge 'dzin tha dad par yang mi byed de /
analyzed: sems kyi skad cig sems kyi skad cig la ting nge 'dzin bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag dpag tu med grangs med pa dag kyang mngon par sgrub la ting nge 'dzin tha dad par yang mi byed de /
translated: In each instant of mind, they accomplish countless quintillions of meditative absorptions, but they do not make their meditative absorptions different.

original: 'jam dpal / rnam grangs des na rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin bsam gyis mi khyab pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi mthas klas pa'i bskal par ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo bskyab pa mngon par sgrub kyang byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo bsgrub pa rnams kyi mthar thug
analyzed: 'jam dpal / rnam grangs des na rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin bsam gyis mi khyab pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi mthas klas pa'i bskal par ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo bskyab pa mngon par sgrub kyang byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo bsgrub pa rnams kyi mthar thug
translated: Mañjuśrī, for this reason, the bodhisattvas who abide in the inconceivable liberation and meditative absorption, even if they were to accomplish the gateway of meditative absorption for eons equal to the limits of the buddha realms, would not reach the end of the accomplishment of the bodhisattvas' gateway of meditative absorption.🔽🔽Mañjuśrī, what do you think?🔽

original: par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Mañjuśrī, for this reason, even if bodhisattvas who abide in inconceivable liberation and meditative absorption were to teach the gateways to meditative absorption for eons equal to the number of atoms in all buddhafields, they would not reach the end of the gateways to the bodhisattvas’ meditative absorption.

original: @208b 'jam dpal /
analyzed: @208b 'jam dpal /
translated: Mañjuśrī,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin phun sum tshogs pa de thams cad ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen las nges par byung ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin phun sum tshogs pa de thams cad ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen las nges par byung ngo //
translated: all the bodhisattvas’ perfect meditative absorptions arise from spiritual teachers.

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du gzungs kyi sgo brjod du med pa /🔽mngon par bsgrub pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du gzungs kyi sgo brjod du med pa / mngon par bsgrub pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī, in the same way, the dhāraṇī gateways are inexpressible,🔽unreal,🔽infinite,

original: mtha' yas dpag tu med grangs med /
analyzed: mtha' yas dpag tu med grangs med /
translated: incalculable,

original: bsam gyis mi khyab /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab /
translated: inconceivable,

original: mtshungs pa med /🔽gzhal du med /
analyzed: mtshungs pa med /🔽gzhal du med /
translated: incomparable,🔽and immeasurable.

original: tshad med pa dag dang / gzungs thob pa phun sum tshogs pa de dag thams cad kyang dge ba'i bshes gnyen las nges par byung ngo //🔽stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa dpag tu med /
analyzed: tshad med pa dag dang / gzungs thob pa phun sum tshogs pa de dag thams cad kyang dge ba'i bshes gnyen las nges par byung ngo // stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa dpag tu med /
translated: All the perfections of the immeasurables and the attainment of dhāraṇī also come from the wisdom teacher.🔽The infinite,

original: grangs med / bsam gyis mi khyab /
analyzed: grangs med / bsam gyis mi khyab /
translated: incalculable,🔽inconceivable,

original: mtshungs pa med /
analyzed: mtshungs pa med /
translated: unequalled,

original: gzhal du med /
analyzed: gzhal du med /
translated: immeasurable,

original: tshad med / brjod du med pa phun sum tshogs pa rnams kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: tshad med / brjod du med pa phun sum tshogs pa rnams kyang de bzhin no //
translated: and inexpressible perfections of the powers, the fearlessnesses, and the unique qualities of the Buddha also come from the wisdom teacher.

original: 'jam dpal / mdor bsdu na de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos bsgrub pa mtha' yas pa thams cad dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos phun sum tshogs pa thams cad ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen las nges par byung ba yin no; ;'jam dpal /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / mdor bsdu na de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos bsgrub pa mtha' yas pa thams cad dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos phun sum tshogs pa thams cad ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen las nges par byung ba yin no; ;'jam dpal /
translated: Mañjuśrī, in brief, in this way all the infinite bodhisattva practices for the attainment of the qualities of the Buddha and all the perfections of the qualities of the Buddha come from the wisdom teacher.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni chos kyi dbyings mtha' yas pa'i sgo la 'jug pa sems can la kun tu ston pa'i yul dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rgyan sna tshogs du ma mngon par sgrub pa 'gro ba thams cad shes par byed pa'i yul dang /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni chos kyi dbyings mtha' yas pa'i sgo la 'jug pa sems can la kun tu ston pa'i yul dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rgyan sna tshogs du ma mngon par sgrub pa 'gro ba thams cad shes par byed pa'i yul dang /
translated: They show them the field of experience that creates the various adornments of all worlds, the field of experience that causes all beings to understand.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du sprul @209a *//
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du sprul @209a *//
translated: They show them the field of experience that creates emanations in all worlds,

original: pa mngon par bsgrub pa'i yul dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku byang chub sems dpa'i lus su mngon par bsgrub pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i lus de bzhin gshegs pa'i skur mngon par bsgrub pa'i yul dang / nam mkha'i khams 'jig rten gyi khams su mngon par bsgrub pa dang /
analyzed: pa mngon par bsgrub pa'i yul dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku byang chub sems dpa'i lus su mngon par bsgrub pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i lus de bzhin gshegs pa'i skur mngon par bsgrub pa'i yul dang / nam mkha'i khams 'jig rten gyi khams su mngon par bsgrub pa dang /
translated: the field of experience that creates the body of a thus-gone one in the body of a bodhisattva and the body of a bodhisattva in the body of a thus-gone one, and the field of experience that creates the realm of space in the world systems.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams nam mkha'i khams su mngon par bsgrub pa'i yul dang / 'khor ba mya ngan las 'das par mngon par bsgrub pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa 'khor bar mngon par bsgrub pa'i yul dang / sems can gyi skad brjod pa gcig gis sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad bstan pa'i yul dang /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams nam mkha'i khams su mngon par bsgrub pa'i yul dang / 'khor ba mya ngan las 'das par mngon par bsgrub pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa 'khor bar mngon par bsgrub pa'i yul dang / sems can gyi skad brjod pa gcig gis sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad bstan pa'i yul dang /
translated: the field of accomplishment of the world in the realm of space, the field of accomplishment of samsara in nirvana and of nirvana in samsara, the field of teaching all the qualities of the Buddha with a single utterance of the language of beings,

original: gdong dang / lus mtha' yas pa kun tu bstan pa lus gcig tu byin gyis brlab cing lus kyi rim pa thams cad mngon par bsgrub pa'i yul dang / lus gcig gis chos kyi dbyings rgyas par 'gengs pa'i yul dang / sems can gcig gis sems bskyed pa rnams la sems kyi skad cig sems kyi skad cig re re la'ang sgo mtha' yas pas bsgrub pa'i byang chub rnam par mi rtog pa'i yul dang /
analyzed: gdong dang / lus mtha' yas pa kun tu bstan pa lus gcig tu byin gyis brlab cing lus kyi rim pa thams cad mngon par bsgrub pa'i yul dang / lus gcig gis chos kyi dbyings rgyas par 'gengs pa'i yul dang / sems can gcig gis sems bskyed pa rnams la sems kyi skad cig sems kyi skad cig re re la'ang sgo mtha' yas pas bsgrub pa'i byang chub rnam par mi rtog pa'i yul dang /
translated: the field of blessing a single body to manifest infinite faces and bodies, the field of accomplishing all the stages of the body, the field of filling the dharmadhatu with a single body, the field of nonconceptual enlightenment accomplished in each instant of mind with infinite doors in each instant of mind with regard to the arousing of the mind of a single being,

original: 'jam dpal / de la sogs pa yul bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag dpag tu med /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de la sogs pa yul bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag dpag tu med /
translated: Manjushri, there are countless hundreds of thousands of millions of such places.

original: grangs med / bsam gyis mi khyab pa de dag byang chub sems dpa' la yang dag par 'grub bo //
analyzed: grangs med / bsam gyis mi khyab pa de dag byang chub sems dpa' la yang dag par 'grub bo //
translated: Mañjuśrī, the bodhisattva who is sustained by the spiritual friend accomplishes such things as these, and many more, in countless, immeasurable, inconceivable, and incomparable world systems.

original: 'jam dpal / dge ba'i bshes @209b gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad 'jig rten gyi khams gcig tu mos shing 'jug go /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / dge ba'i bshes @209b gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad 'jig rten gyi khams gcig tu mos shing 'jug go /
translated: Mañjuśrī, the bodhisattva who is sustained by the spiritual friend considers and engages with all world systems as a single world system.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams gcig 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du mos shing 'jug go /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams gcig 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du mos shing 'jug go /
translated: He considers and engages with a single world system as all world systems.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad padma'i gdan gcig dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gcig gis yongs su khyab par mos shing 'jug go /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad padma'i gdan gcig dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gcig gis yongs su khyab par mos shing 'jug go /
translated: He considers and engages with all world systems as being pervaded by a single lotus seat and a single body of a tathāgata.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad nam mkha'i ngo bo nyid du kun tu ston par mos shing 'jug go /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad nam mkha'i ngo bo nyid du kun tu ston par mos shing 'jug go /
translated: He considers and engages with all world systems as being entirely of the nature of space.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad sangs rgyas kyi rgyan du mos shing 'jug go /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad sangs rgyas kyi rgyan du mos shing 'jug go /
translated: He considers and engages with all world systems as being the adornment of the buddhas.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad byang chub sems dpa'i lus kyis yongs su khyab par mos shing 'jug go /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad byang chub sems dpa'i lus kyis yongs su khyab par mos shing 'jug go /
translated: They imagine and enter into all world systems being pervaded by the bodies of bodhisattvas.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad skra tsam gyi khyon gcig la 'jog par mos shing 'jug go /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad skra tsam gyi khyon gcig la 'jog par mos shing 'jug go /
translated: They imagine and enter into all world systems being placed on a single hair.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad lus gcig tu 'jug pa dang ldan par mos shing 'jug go /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad lus gcig tu 'jug pa dang ldan par mos shing 'jug go /
translated: They imagine and enter into all world systems being contained within a single body.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa gcig gi byang chub kyi shing dang / byang chub kyi snying pos yongs su khyab par mos shing 'jug go /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa gcig gi byang chub kyi shing dang / byang chub kyi snying pos yongs su khyab par mos shing 'jug go /
translated: They imagine and enter into all world systems being pervaded by the enlightenment tree and the seat of enlightenment of a single thus-gone one.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad sgra skad gcig gis go bar byed cing sems can gyi khams sna tshogs kyi sgra la 'jug pas tshim par byed par mos shing 'jug go /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad sgra skad gcig gis go bar byed cing sems can gyi khams sna tshogs kyi sgra la 'jug pas tshim par byed par mos shing 'jug go /
translated: They imagine and enter into all world systems being satisfied by the sounds of the various languages of sentient beings, with a single sound.

original: sems can thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid dang / lus su mos shing 'jug go /🔽sems can gyi khams thams @210a *//
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid dang / lus su mos shing 'jug go /🔽sems can gyi khams thams @210a *//
translated: They imagine and enter into the nature and bodies of all sentient beings.🔽They imagine and enter into all world systems being pervaded by the bodies of bodhisattvas.

original: cad sems can gcig gi lus la 'jug pa dang ldan par mos shing 'jug go /
analyzed: cad sems can gcig gi lus la 'jug pa dang ldan par mos shing 'jug go /
translated: He imagines and enters into the fact that all of them are in the body of a single being.

original: sems can gyi khams thams cad byang chub sems dpa'i khong du song bar mos shing 'jug go /
analyzed: sems can gyi khams thams cad byang chub sems dpa'i khong du song bar mos shing 'jug go /
translated: He imagines and enters into the fact that the entire realm of beings is in the body of a bodhisattva.

original: sems can gyi khams thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i khong du zhugs par mos shing 'jug go /
analyzed: sems can gyi khams thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i khong du zhugs par mos shing 'jug go /
translated: He imagines and enters into the fact that the entire realm of beings is in the body of a tathāgata.

original: sems can gyi khams thams cad sems can gcig gi lus la brten par mos shing 'jug go /
analyzed: sems can gyi khams thams cad sems can gcig gi lus la brten par mos shing 'jug go /
translated: He imagines and enters into the fact that the entire realm of beings is in the body of a single being.

original: sems can gyi khams thams cad sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi snod du mos shing 'jug go /
analyzed: sems can gyi khams thams cad sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi snod du mos shing 'jug go /
translated: He imagines and enters into the fact that the entire realm of beings is a vessel for the Dharma of the Buddha.

original: sems can gyi khams thams cad brgya byin dang; tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten skyong ba gang 'dod pa dang / mos pa'i gzugs dang / lus dang / kha dog dang / rtags la mngon du phyogs pa ston par mos shing 'jug go //
analyzed: sems can gyi khams thams cad brgya byin dang; tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten skyong ba gang 'dod pa dang / mos pa'i gzugs dang / lus dang / kha dog dang / rtags la mngon du phyogs pa ston par mos shing 'jug go //
translated: He imagines and enters into the fact that the entire realm of beings is revealed to be the form, body, color, and marks of Śakra, Brahmā, the Lokapālas, and whatever else they desire, whatever they wish for.

original: sems can gyi khams thams cad nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi gzugs dang / lus dang / kha dog dang / rtags dang / tshul du ston par mos shing 'jug go /
analyzed: sems can gyi khams thams cad nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi gzugs dang / lus dang / kha dog dang / rtags dang / tshul du ston par mos shing 'jug go /
translated: They imagine and enter into the display of the forms, bodies, colors, marks, and ways of life of all beings in the realms of hearers and solitary buddhas.

original: sems can gyi khams thams cad byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan gyi sa legs par brgyan pa'i byin gyi rlas kun tu ston par mos shing 'jug go /
analyzed: sems can gyi khams thams cad byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan gyi sa legs par brgyan pa'i byin gyi rlas kun tu ston par mos shing 'jug go /
translated: They imagine and enter into the display of the qualities of the bodhisattva grounds that are revealed to all beings in the realms of beings.

original: sems can gyi khams thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzugs dang / mtshan dang / dpe byad bzang po dang / gzugs dang / lus dang / kha dog sna tshogs dang / spyod lam dang / spyod pa kun tu @210b ston pa gzhan shes par byed par mos shing 'jug go /
analyzed: sems can gyi khams thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzugs dang / mtshan dang / dpe byad bzang po dang / gzugs dang / lus dang / kha dog sna tshogs dang / spyod lam dang / spyod pa kun tu @210b ston pa gzhan shes par byed par mos shing 'jug go /
translated: They imagine and enter into the display of the forms, marks, excellent signs, bodies, colors, conduct, and ways of life of the thus-gone ones that are revealed to all beings in the realms of beings.

original: 'jam dpal / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni 'dod pa'i khams nas kyang mi g-yo la /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni 'dod pa'i khams nas kyang mi g-yo la /
translated: Mañjuśrī, bodhisattvas who are supported by a spiritual friend do not move from the desire realm.

original: gzugs dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la'ang snyoms par 'jug cing de dag gi dbang gis kyang mi skye'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la'ang snyoms par 'jug cing de dag gi dbang gis kyang mi skye'o //
translated: They also enter the meditative absorptions, the liberations, and the concentrations and attainments of the form and formless realms, but they are not reborn due to their influence.

original: nyan thos kyi lam mngon du shes pa la zhugs pa'ang yin la snying rje chen po'i stobs kyang rgyun mi gcod do //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi lam mngon du shes pa la zhugs pa'ang yin la snying rje chen po'i stobs kyang rgyun mi gcod do //
translated: They also enter the knowledge of the path of the śrāvakas, but they do not interrupt the power of great compassion.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi lam mngon du shes shing mthong ba la mkhas pa'ang yin la snying rje chen po'i stobs kyang rgyun mi gcod do //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi lam mngon du shes shing mthong ba la mkhas pa'ang yin la snying rje chen po'i stobs kyang rgyun mi gcod do //
translated: They also enter the knowledge of the path of the pratyekabuddhas, but they do not interrupt the power of great compassion.

original: g-yog 'khor mang pos yongs su bskor ba'ang yin la /
analyzed: g-yog 'khor mang pos yongs su bskor ba'ang yin la /
translated: They also have a great retinue,

original: lha dang / mi'i g-yog 'khor mang po rnam par dag pa dang yang ldan no //
analyzed: lha dang / mi'i g-yog 'khor mang po rnam par dag pa dang yang ldan no //
translated: but they are endowed with a pure retinue of gods and humans.

original: lha'i bu mo 'bum dag glu dbyangs rjes su sgrogs shing sil snyan 'bum dag sil khrol 'byin pa dang yang ldan la byang chub sems dpa'i lam dang ldan pa'i bsam gtan dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa rnams kyang mi 'dor ro //
analyzed: lha'i bu mo 'bum dag glu dbyangs rjes su sgrogs shing sil snyan 'bum dag sil khrol 'byin pa dang yang ldan la byang chub sems dpa'i lam dang ldan pa'i bsam gtan dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa rnams kyang mi 'dor ro //
translated: He is endowed with a hundred thousand celestial maidens singing and playing music, and yet he does not abandon the concentrations, the liberations, the meditative absorptions, and the attainments that are in accord with the bodhisattva way of life.

original: 'gro ba'i dga' ba dang / rtse ba dang / bzhad gang dang / 'jo sgeg thams cad dang; sems can brkam chags pa'i 'du 'ji thams cad kyi nang na gnas pa'ang yin la sems kyi skad cig gcig la'ang byang chub kyi sems kyi mnyam pa nyid kyang mi 'dor ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i dga' ba dang / rtse ba dang / bzhad gang dang / 'jo sgeg thams cad dang; sems can brkam chags pa'i 'du 'ji thams cad kyi nang na gnas pa'ang yin la sems kyi skad cig gcig la'ang byang chub kyi sems kyi mnyam pa nyid kyang mi 'dor ro //
translated: He is in the midst of all the pleasures, amusements, enjoyments, and delights of the world, and in the midst of all the greed and quarrelsomeness of the world, and yet he does not abandon the equality of the thought of awakening even for a moment.

original: @211a *// 'jig rten las 'das pa'ang yin te /
analyzed: @211a *// 'jig rten las 'das pa'ang yin te /
translated: He is beyond the world,

original: 'jig rten thams cad dang ma 'dras la pha rol tu 'gro ba'i lam la slob par yang snang zhing las dang / nyon mongs par bying ba'i sems can rnams yongs su smin par yang byed do //
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad dang ma 'dras la pha rol tu 'gro ba'i lam la slob par yang snang zhing las dang / nyon mongs par bying ba'i sems can rnams yongs su smin par yang byed do //
translated: and yet he appears to be training on the path that goes beyond the whole world, and he brings to maturity those sentient beings who are sunk in karma and reactive emotions.

original: lam la gnas shing lam la ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa mthong ba la zhugs pa'ang yin la /
analyzed: lam la gnas shing lam la ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa mthong ba la zhugs pa'ang yin la /
translated: They are on the path and have entered the vision of knowing the path as it is.

original: lam ngan par lhung ba'i sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir la ma ngan pa na'ang snang zhing lam de la snying por 'du shes pa'ang ma yin la des dag par 'dod pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: lam ngan par lhung ba'i sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir la ma ngan pa na'ang snang zhing lam de la snying por 'du shes pa'ang ma yin la des dag par 'dod pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: They appear in bad paths in order to ripen beings who have fallen into bad paths, but they do not think of those paths as essential, nor do they want to purify them.

original: lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi las kyi mtha' kha na ma tho ba med pa'ang yin te /
analyzed: lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi las kyi mtha' kha na ma tho ba med pa'ang yin te /
translated: They have no bad actions of body, speech, or mind.

original: rtag tu tshul khrims legs par bsrung zhing de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshul khrims rnam par dag pa la'ang gzhol la sems can tshul khrims 'chal pa yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir byis pa so so'i skye bo phal po'i spyod yul ba la'ang kun tu snang ngo //
analyzed: rtag tu tshul khrims legs par bsrung zhing de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshul khrims rnam par dag pa la'ang gzhol la sems can tshul khrims 'chal pa yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir byis pa so so'i skye bo phal po'i spyod yul ba la'ang kun tu snang ngo //
translated: They always keep moral discipline well, and they are intent on the pure moral discipline of the Tathagatas. But in order to ripen beings who have bad moral discipline, they appear in the sphere of activity of ordinary foolish people.

original: bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs bsags shing byang chub sems dpa'i 'gro ba la'ang gzhol la ngan 'gror skyes pa'i sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro'i skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten dang /
analyzed: bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs bsags shing byang chub sems dpa'i 'gro ba la'ang gzhol la ngan 'gror skyes pa'i sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro'i skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten dang /
translated: They are dedicated to the bodhisattva way of life, and they have accumulated the provisions of merit and wisdom. They manifest birth in the lower realms, in the hells, as animals, in the world of Yama,

original: mi khom pa dang / dbul po'i khyim du skye ba'i 'gro ba'ang kun tu ston la 'gro ba der yang dag par gzhol ba'ang ma @211b yin no //
analyzed: mi khom pa dang / dbul po'i khyim du skye ba'i 'gro ba'ang kun tu ston la 'gro ba der yang dag par gzhol ba'ang ma @211b yin no //
translated: in the unfavorable states of existence, and in poor families, in order to bring sentient beings to maturity.

original: ye shes dang / spobs pa thogs pa med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos la zhugs pas gzhan gyi dring la mi 'jog pa'i ye shes la mkhas pa'ang yin no //
analyzed: ye shes dang / spobs pa thogs pa med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos la zhugs pas gzhan gyi dring la mi 'jog pa'i ye shes la mkhas pa'ang yin no //
translated: They are skilled in the wisdom that does not depend on others, because they have entered the unobstructed wisdom and eloquence of the buddhas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis byin gyis brlabs pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sku dang / lus gzugs gcig tu gyur ba dang / sems can thams cad dang thun mong ma yin pa'i chos kyi tshul dang / dgongs pa snang ba rtogs pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis byin gyis brlabs pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sku dang / lus gzugs gcig tu gyur ba dang / sems can thams cad dang thun mong ma yin pa'i chos kyi tshul dang / dgongs pa snang ba rtogs pa dang /
translated: the realization of the appearance of the transcendent state,🔽the blessing of the sameness of all vehicles,🔽the direct perception of the domain of all buddhas,🔽the praiseworthy one of all migrating beings,

original: theg pa thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyis byin gyis brlabs pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi spyod yul la mngon du phyogs pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad kyis bsngags par 'os pa dang / sems can gyi khams thams cad kyis gdong du lta ba dang /
analyzed: theg pa thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyis byin gyis brlabs pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi spyod yul la mngon du phyogs pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad kyis bsngags par 'os pa dang / sems can gyi khams thams cad kyis gdong du lta ba dang /
translated: the one who is looked at by the realm of all sentient beings,

original: 'gro ba thams cad kyi slob dpon du gyur pa dang / zab cing brtan pa'i rgya mtsho'i chu'i dus rlabs lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis rnam par rtse ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi sku dang / kha dog mtha' yas pa yongs su 'grub pa sgrub pa'i gzungs thob pa'ang yin la chos yongs su tshol ba'i rgyun yang mi gcod do //
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad kyi slob dpon du gyur pa dang / zab cing brtan pa'i rgya mtsho'i chu'i dus rlabs lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis rnam par rtse ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi sku dang / kha dog mtha' yas pa yongs su 'grub pa sgrub pa'i gzungs thob pa'ang yin la chos yongs su tshol ba'i rgyun yang mi gcod do //
translated: They attain the dhāraṇī that accomplishes the infinite buddha bodies and colors, and yet they do not interrupt the continuity of seeking the Dharma.

original: lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin dang / dri zar bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyi slob dpon dam pa'ang yin la /
analyzed: lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin dang / dri zar bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyi slob dpon dam pa'ang yin la /
translated: They become the supreme masters of the world with its gods, humans, asuras, and gandharvas.

original: tsog tsog por 'dug ste thal mo sbyar nas mkhan po dang / slob dpon las chos len par yang kun tu ston cing gus par bya ba thams cad kyi nye bar gnas par yang snang ste /🔽byang chub sems dpa'i @212a *//
analyzed: tsog tsog por 'dug ste thal mo sbyar nas mkhan po dang / slob dpon las chos len par yang kun tu ston cing gus par bya ba thams cad kyi nye bar gnas par yang snang ste / byang chub sems dpa'i @212a *//
translated: They also appear to be seated cross-legged with palms joined, receiving the Dharma from preceptors and masters, and they appear to be present for all acts of respect.

original: lam la gnas nas thabs gang dang / gang gis sems can rnams yongs su smin pa'am /
analyzed: lam la gnas nas thabs gang dang / gang gis sems can rnams yongs su smin pa'am /
translated: They abide on the bodhisattva path and with whatever means they bring sentient beings to full maturity.

original: 'dul bar 'gyur ba'i thabs de dang / de nyid sems can rnams la ston to //
analyzed: 'dul bar 'gyur ba'i thabs de dang / de nyid sems can rnams la ston to //
translated: He teaches them the methods that will tame them.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad shin tu bsdus pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad kyi rtse mor phyin pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis dbang bskur bas dbang bskur ba dang / chos kyi dbang phyug gi bdag po dam pa'i mchog thob pa dang /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad shin tu bsdus pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad kyi rtse mor phyin pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis dbang bskur bas dbang bskur ba dang / chos kyi dbang phyug gi bdag po dam pa'i mchog thob pa dang /
translated: He has gathered together all the roots of virtue, he has reached the peak of all the bodhisattva activities, he has been empowered by all the tathagatas, and he has attained the supreme state of sovereignty over the Dharma.

original: chos kyi cod pan thogs pa med cing dri ma med pas bcings pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du thogs pa med par de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku kun tu ston pa dang / thogs pa med par chos kyi 'khor lo skor ba'i byin gyi rlabs dang /
analyzed: chos kyi cod pan thogs pa med cing dri ma med pas bcings pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du thogs pa med par de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku kun tu ston pa dang / thogs pa med par chos kyi 'khor lo skor ba'i byin gyi rlabs dang /
translated: He is bound by the unattached and stainless diadem of the Dharma, he manifests the body of the tathagata unobstructedly in all world systems, and he has the empowerment to turn the wheel of the Dharma unobstructedly.

original: ldan pa dang / lus gzugs 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du zhugs pa dang ldan pa dang / chos thams cad kyi dbang phyug dam pa'i mchog thob pa dang ldan pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i dbang thams cad thob pa dang / 'gro ba'i zhing thams cad du skye ba ston pa'i shes pa dang ldan pa dang /
analyzed: ldan pa dang / lus gzugs 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du zhugs pa dang ldan pa dang / chos thams cad kyi dbang phyug dam pa'i mchog thob pa dang ldan pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i dbang thams cad thob pa dang / 'gro ba'i zhing thams cad du skye ba ston pa'i shes pa dang ldan pa dang /
translated: They were endowed with the power to enter all worlds in the form of their bodies. They were endowed with the attainment of the supreme sovereignty over all phenomena. They had attained all the powers of a bodhisattva. They had the knowledge to display birth in all the realms of beings.

original: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang yul gcig tu gyur pa'ang yin la byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa'i rgyun yang mi gcod /
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang yul gcig tu gyur pa'ang yin la byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa'i rgyun yang mi gcod /
translated: They were in the same realm as all the thus-gone ones of the past, present, and future, and yet they did not interrupt the continuity of bodhisattva conduct.

original: byang chub sems dpa' mngon par 'du bya ba'i @212b stobs las kyang yongs mi nyams /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' mngon par 'du bya ba'i @212b stobs las kyang yongs mi nyams /
translated: They were not diminished by the power of their bodhisattva activity.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i byin gyi rlabs las kyang thag ring du mi 'gyur /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i byin gyi rlabs las kyang thag ring du mi 'gyur /
translated: They were not distant from the blessings of bodhisattva conduct.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i chos nyid kyang mi 'dor /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i chos nyid kyang mi 'dor /
translated: They did not abandon the true nature of a bodhisattva.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i las kyi mtha' las kyang mi 'da'/
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i las kyi mtha' las kyang mi 'da'/
translated: They do not transgress the bodhisattva’s way of life.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i lam las kyang phyir mi ldog /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i lam las kyang phyir mi ldog /
translated: They do not turn back from the bodhisattva path.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bya ba la zhum par yang mi byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bya ba la zhum par yang mi byed do //
translated: They do not become discouraged in their bodhisattva activities.

original: 'jam dpal / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni chos thams cad la blang ba med pa dang / dor ba med pa dang / 'degs pa med pa dang / 'jog pa med pa dang / sgyu ma dang /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni chos thams cad la blang ba med pa dang / dor ba med pa dang / 'degs pa med pa dang / 'jog pa med pa dang / sgyu ma dang /
translated: Mañjuśrī, bodhisattvas who are sustained by a spiritual friend do not accept or reject, do not lift up or put down, all phenomena.

original: smig rgyu dang / rmi lam dang / mi ga yor dang / gzugs brnyan dang / chu zla dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma mang po dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa dang / brjod du med pa dang /
analyzed: smig rgyu dang / rmi lam dang / mi ga yor dang / gzugs brnyan dang / chu zla dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma mang po dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa dang / brjod du med pa dang /
translated: They are like an illusion, a mirage, a dream, a hallucination, a reflection, the moon in water, emptiness, the absence of marks, the absence of wishes, the absence of composition, the inexpressible, the unborn, the unarisen, the unmanifest, and the unceasing.

original: smrar med pa dang / bsnyad du med pa dang / de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / rnam par 'jig pa med pa dang / mnyam pa nyid dang / dbyer med pa dang / gnyis su med pa zhes bya ba de ni de'i dmigs pa yin te /
analyzed: smrar med pa dang / bsnyad du med pa dang / de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / rnam par 'jig pa med pa dang / mnyam pa nyid dang / dbyer med pa dang / gnyis su med pa zhes bya ba de ni de'i dmigs pa yin te /
translated: The object of that is the absence of mind, the absence of mental objects, non-arising, non-cessation, non-affliction, non-purification, no this side or the other side, no coming or going, and also the inexpressible, the indescribable, suchness, the perfect, the non-disintegrating, sameness, the indivisible, and non-duality.

original: chos thams cad ni gnyen po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni gnyen po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: All phenomena are without an antidote.

original: chos thams cad ces bya ba de ni de'i dmigs pa ste; 'du shes pa 'dzin pa'i phyir dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad ces bya ba de ni de'i dmigs pa ste; 'du shes pa 'dzin pa'i phyir dmigs pa'o //
translated: All phenomena are the object of that, because they are the object of the grasping of perception.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sems med pa la sems su dmigs pa ni 'du shes phyin ci log yin pa'i phyir te /🔽sems phyin ci @213a *//🔽log tu gyur na sems myos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems med pa la sems su dmigs pa ni 'du shes phyin ci log yin pa'i phyir te / sems phyin ci @213a *// log tu gyur na sems myos par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because the object of mindlessness is the perversion of perception.🔽If the mind is perverted, the mind is deluded.

original: sems myos na sems bslad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems myos na sems bslad par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the mind is deluded, the mind is corrupted.

original: sems bslad pa las sems skrag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems bslad pa las sems skrag par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the mind is corrupted, the mind is frightened.

original: sems skrag pa las byang chub kyi sems nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems skrag pa las byang chub kyi sems nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the mind is frightened, the mind of awakening degenerates.

original: 'jam dpal / de lta bas na byang chub sems dpas sems la sems kyi rjes su blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de lta bas na byang chub sems dpas sems la sems kyi rjes su blta bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, Mañjuśrī, the bodhisattva should observe the mind with the mind.
