original: 'jam dpal / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni dbang bcu thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni dbang bcu thob par 'gyur te /
translated: Mañjuśrī, the bodhisattva who is assisted by a spiritual friend obtains ten masteries.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are

original: tshe la dbang ba dang / sems la dbang ba dang / yo byad la dbang ba dang / las la dbang ba dang / skye ba la dbang ba dang / mos pa la dbang ba dang / smon lam la dbang ba dang / rdzu 'phrul la dbang ba dang /
analyzed: tshe la dbang ba dang / sems la dbang ba dang / yo byad la dbang ba dang / las la dbang ba dang / skye ba la dbang ba dang / mos pa la dbang ba dang / smon lam la dbang ba dang / rdzu 'phrul la dbang ba dang /
translated: mastery over life, mastery over mind, mastery over requisites, mastery over action, mastery over birth, mastery over resolve, mastery over prayer, mastery over miraculous powers,

original: chos la dbang ba dang / ye shes la dbang ba'o //
analyzed: chos la dbang ba dang / ye shes la dbang ba'o //
translated: mastery over the Dharma, and mastery over wisdom.

original: rnam par sprul pa bcu'ang thob ste /
analyzed: rnam par sprul pa bcu'ang thob ste /
translated: He also obtains ten kinds of emanations.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are

original: sems can rnam par sprul pa dang / zhing rnam par sprul pa dang // chos rnam par sprul pa dang / lus rnam par sprul pa dang / smon lam rnam par sprul pa dang / spyod yul rnam par sprul pa dang / ye shes rnam par sprul pa dang /
analyzed: sems can rnam par sprul pa dang / zhing rnam par sprul pa dang // chos rnam par sprul pa dang / lus rnam par sprul pa dang / smon lam rnam par sprul pa dang / spyod yul rnam par sprul pa dang / ye shes rnam par sprul pa dang /
translated: emanation of aspirations,🔽emanation of spheres of activity,🔽emanation of wisdom,🔽emanation of superknowledges,

original: mngon par shes pa rnam par sprul pa dang / rdzu 'phrul rnam par sprul pa dang / stobs rnam par sprul pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa rnam par sprul pa dang / rdzu 'phrul rnam par sprul pa dang / stobs rnam par sprul pa'o //
translated: emanation of miracles, and emanation of powers.

original: 'jam dpal / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa'i byang chub @213b sems dpa' ni sems can gyi khams thams cad kyi mos pa la 'jug pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing tha dad pa nyid la 'jug pa dang / phyogs thams cad kyi dri ba rnam par 'byed pa la 'jug pa dang /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa'i byang chub @213b sems dpa' ni sems can gyi khams thams cad kyi mos pa la 'jug pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing tha dad pa nyid la 'jug pa dang / phyogs thams cad kyi dri ba rnam par 'byed pa la 'jug pa dang /
translated: Mañjuśrī, a bodhisattva who is assisted by a spiritual friend enters into the interests of all realms of sentient beings, enters into the differences of buddha realms, enters into the analysis of all directions,

original: 'jig rten gyi khams steng g-yogs med cing gzhi phyal ba'i rgyud thams cad la 'jug pa dang / chos thams cad gcig pa dang / tha dad pa nyid rab 'byams rnam par bzhag pa la mkhas pa la 'jug pa dang / las thams cad bsgyur bar gzhug pa la 'jug pa dang /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams steng g-yogs med cing gzhi phyal ba'i rgyud thams cad la 'jug pa dang / chos thams cad gcig pa dang / tha dad pa nyid rab 'byams rnam par bzhag pa la mkhas pa la 'jug pa dang / las thams cad bsgyur bar gzhug pa la 'jug pa dang /
translated: It is to engage in all the realms of the world without a lid and with an open base. It is to engage in the skill of positing the infinite sameness and difference of all phenomena. It is to engage in the transformation of all actions.

original: 'du shes phyin ci log gis phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i 'jig rten gnas pa tha dad pa nyid kyi 'du shes can tha dad pa nyid la 'jug pa dang / chos thams cad bsgyur ba la 'jug pa'i mtha' nges par 'byung ba gcig la 'jug pa dang /
analyzed: 'du shes phyin ci log gis phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i 'jig rten gnas pa tha dad pa nyid kyi 'du shes can tha dad pa nyid la 'jug pa dang / chos thams cad bsgyur ba la 'jug pa'i mtha' nges par 'byung ba gcig la 'jug pa dang /
translated: It is to engage in the world of beings who are mistaken due to mistaken perception, who have the perception of difference, and who engage in difference. It is to engage in the single definite emergence that is the transformation of all phenomena.

original: chos kyi dbyings thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par sprul par byin gyis rlob pa la 'jug pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad dus gsum la 'jug pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi gdung rgyun mi chad pa la bzhugs pa'i ye shes mngon par sgrub bo //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par sprul par byin gyis rlob pa la 'jug pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad dus gsum la 'jug pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi gdung rgyun mi chad pa la bzhugs pa'i ye shes mngon par sgrub bo //
translated: They are: to enter into the blessing of the entire realm of phenomena as the emanations of the Tathagata; to enter into the three times of all beings; and to actualize the wisdom of abiding in the unbroken lineage of all Buddhas.🔽Mañjuśrī, the bodhisattva who is sustained by a spiritual friend outshines in a single morning the roots of virtue that have been produced from incalculable, innumerable hundreds of thousands of millions of billions of Buddhas by those who have not been sustained by a spiritual friend.🔽Those roots of virtue that have been produced from generosity,

original: 'jam dpal / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni sangs rgyas bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag dpag tu med grangs med pa dag las dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa sbyin pa las byung ba dang / mchod pa las byung ba dang /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni sangs rgyas bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag dpag tu med grangs med pa dag las dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa sbyin pa las byung ba dang / mchod pa las byung ba dang /
translated: from service,

original: de dag gi thad nas bslab pa bzung ba @214a *//🔽las byung ba rnams snga dro gcig gis zil gyis gnon te /
analyzed: de dag gi thad nas bslab pa bzung ba @214a *// las byung ba rnams snga dro gcig gis zil gyis gnon te /
translated: and from taking up the precepts in their presence are outshone.

original: 'jam dpal / de ltar dge ba'i bshes gnyen ni yon tan bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang ldan no; ;'jam dpal /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de ltar dge ba'i bshes gnyen ni yon tan bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang ldan no; ;'jam dpal /
translated: Mañjuśrī, the spiritual friend has inconceivable qualities.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ste de dag phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas pa mu med pa dag tu 'jig rten
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ste de dag phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas pa mu med pa dag tu 'jig rten
translated: Bodhisattvas who are supported by spiritual friends will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood. They will manifest in the worlds of the ten directions,

original: gyi khams re re na'ang rdul phra rab kyi rdul re re la dus gsum la 'jug cing bskal ba'i phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug par bskal par byin gyis brlabs te /
analyzed: gyi khams re re na'ang rdul phra rab kyi rdul re re la dus gsum la 'jug cing bskal ba'i phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug par bskal par byin gyis brlabs te /
translated: in each world system, in each atom, for as long as the three times last, and for as long as the future of kalpas lasts.

original: dus gsum la 'jug pa'i chos ston to //
analyzed: dus gsum la 'jug pa'i chos ston to //
translated: They will teach the Dharma that engages with the three times.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams ni rtag pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams ni rtag pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is because the thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddhas are permanent,

original: brtan pa / ther zug pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtan pa / ther zug pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: stable, and eternal.

original: 'jam dpal / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'du shes phyin ci log tu mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'du shes phyin ci log tu mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Mañjuśrī, the bodhisattvas who are sustained by a spiritual friend do not have distorted perceptions.

original: 'jam dpal / 'du shes phyin ci log gis sems phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i sems can rnams 'di dag ni sangs rgyas kyi chos so //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / 'du shes phyin ci log gis sems phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i sems can rnams 'di dag ni sangs rgyas kyi chos so //
translated: Mañjuśrī, sentient beings whose minds are distorted by distorted perceptions, thinking, ‘These are the qualities of the Buddha,’

original: 'di dag ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma yin no zhes mngon par zhen nas chos spong bar byed do //
analyzed: 'di dag ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma yin no zhes mngon par zhen nas chos spong bar byed do //
translated: cling to them and reject the Dharma.

original: mi dge ba'i las sna tshogs kyang byed do //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i las sna tshogs kyang byed do //
translated: They also engage in various nonvirtuous actions.

original: @214b 'jam dpal /🔽sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ni skye ba'am /
analyzed: @214b 'jam dpal / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ni skye ba'am /
translated: Mañjuśrī,

original: 'gag pa med de /
analyzed: 'gag pa med de /
translated: the qualities of the Buddha are neither produced nor stopped.

original: 'jam dpal / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ni ma skyes pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ni ma skyes pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī, the qualities of the Buddha are unborn,

original: ma 'gags pa /
analyzed: ma 'gags pa /
translated: unstopped,

original: yi ge med pa /
analyzed: yi ge med pa /
translated: without syllables,🔽without sound,

original: sgra med pa; gnyis su med pa /
analyzed: sgra med pa; gnyis su med pa /
translated: nondual,

original: gnyen po med pa /
analyzed: gnyen po med pa /
translated: and without antidote.

original: sgra las yang dag par 'das pa'o //
analyzed: sgra las yang dag par 'das pa'o //
translated: They are beyond sound.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gnyen po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyen po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are without antidote.

original: 'jam dpal / 'di dag ni sangs rgyas kyi chos so //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / 'di dag ni sangs rgyas kyi chos so //
translated: Mañjuśrī, these are the qualities of the Buddha.

original: 'jam dpal / 'di dag ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / 'di dag ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma yin no //
translated: Mañjuśrī, these are not the qualities of the Buddha.

original: zhes bya ba 'di gnyis ni mtha' ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di gnyis ni mtha' ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, these two are extremes.

original: 'jam dpal / mtha' gang yin pa de ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma yin te /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / mtha' gang yin pa de ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma yin te /
translated: Mañjuśrī, that which is an extreme is not the qualities of the Buddha.

original: 'jam dpal / sangs rgyas kyi chos ni mtha' med pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / sangs rgyas kyi chos ni mtha' med pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: Mañjuśrī, the qualities of the Buddha are of the nature of the absence of extremes.

original: 'jam dpal / mtha' med pa'i ngo bo nyid ni mi skye mi 'gag go /🔽'jam dpal / mi skye mi 'gag pa gang yin pa de ni mtha' dang / mtha' med pa yongs su spangs pa ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / mtha' med pa'i ngo bo nyid ni mi skye mi 'gag go / 'jam dpal / mi skye mi 'gag pa gang yin pa de ni mtha' dang / mtha' med pa yongs su spangs pa ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, that which is of the nature of the absence of extremes is unborn and unceasing.🔽Mañjuśrī, that which is unborn and unceasing is free from extremes and the absence of extremes.

original: yi ge med pa dang / sgra med pa /
analyzed: yi ge med pa dang / sgra med pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī, that which is free from extremes and the absence of extremes is without syllables, without sound,

original: sgra las yang dag par 'das pa /
analyzed: sgra las yang dag par 'das pa /
translated: beyond sound,

original: gdags par bya ba ma yin pa /
analyzed: gdags par bya ba ma yin pa /
translated: not something to be designated,

original: gnyis su med pa /
analyzed: gnyis su med pa /
translated: nondual,

original: gnyen po med pa'o //
analyzed: gnyen po med pa'o //
translated: and without antidote.

original: 'jam dpal / gang  gnyen po med pa de ni mi skye mi 'gag go /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / gang  gnyen po med pa de ni mi skye mi 'gag go /
translated: Mañjuśrī, that which is without antidote is unborn and unceasing.

original: gang mi skye mi 'gag pa de ni sangs rgyas kyi bka' yin no //
analyzed: gang mi skye mi 'gag pa de ni sangs rgyas kyi bka' yin no //
translated: Mañjuśrī, that which is unborn and unceasing is the word of the Buddha.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin gshegs pa ni chos kyi sku ste /🔽shin tu ma skyes pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin gshegs pa ni chos kyi sku ste / shin tu ma skyes pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī, the Tathāgata is the body of Dharma,🔽utterly unborn,

original: ma byung ba /
analyzed: ma byung ba /
translated: unoriginated,

original: ma 'gags pa'o //🔽de la ni tshigs med mod kyi sngon gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / spyod pa dang / smon lam @215a *//
analyzed: ma 'gags pa'o // de la ni tshigs med mod kyi sngon gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / spyod pa dang / smon lam @215a *//
translated: and unceasing.

original: gyi stobs bskyed pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis sems can dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: gyi stobs bskyed pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis sems can dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ngo //
translated: In him there are no syllables, but through the blessing of the power of his previous roots of virtue, conduct, and aspirations, sentient beings see the Tathāgata.

original: 'jam dpal / dper na /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / dper na /
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is like this:

original: nor bu rin po che chu 'dang bar byed pa chu'i nang du bcug ma thag tu 'dam rdzab dang / rnyog pa thams cad 'dang bar byed kyang /
analyzed: nor bu rin po che chu 'dang bar byed pa chu'i nang du bcug ma thag tu 'dam rdzab dang / rnyog pa thams cad 'dang bar byed kyang /
translated: As soon as a water-purifying gem is placed in dirty water, all the mud and silt settles and the water becomes clear.

original: 'jam dpal / nor bu rin po che chu 'dang bar byed pa ni mi rtog /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / nor bu rin po che chu 'dang bar byed pa ni mi rtog /
translated: Mañjuśrī, the water-purifying gem does not think or conceptualize,

original: rnam par mi rtog ste; 'on kyang lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par de'i bya ba de 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog ste; 'on kyang lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par de'i bya ba de 'byung ngo //
translated: but nevertheless, without deliberation or conceptualization, that action of it occurs.

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa byung ma thag tu phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams rab 'byams thams cad kyi sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa'i 'dam rdza ba dang / rnyog pa thams cad dang bar byed kyang de bzhin gshegs pa ni mi rtog /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa byung ma thag tu phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams rab 'byams thams cad kyi sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa'i 'dam rdza ba dang / rnyog pa thams cad dang bar byed kyang de bzhin gshegs pa ni mi rtog /
translated: Mañjuśrī, in the same way, as soon as the Tathāgata appears, he purifies the entire mire of afflictions and turbidity of all sentient beings in all the infinite world systems of the ten directions.

original: rnam par mi rtog ste /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog ste /
translated: Yet the Tathāgata is non-conceptual.

original: 'on kyang lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par de'i bya ba de lta bu de 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'on kyang lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par de'i bya ba de lta bu de 'byung ngo //
translated: Nevertheless, that activity occurs spontaneously and non-conceptually.

original: 'jam dpal / dper na /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / dper na /
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is like this:

original: rdza mkhan gyi 'khor lo shin tu myur zhing stobs kyi shugs kyis 'phangs pa ni rdza mkhan gyi dbang gis snod spyad sna tshogs mngon par 'du byed kyang /
analyzed: rdza mkhan gyi 'khor lo shin tu myur zhing stobs kyi shugs kyis 'phangs pa ni rdza mkhan gyi dbang gis snod spyad sna tshogs mngon par 'du byed kyang /
translated: A potter’s wheel, when spun very fast and propelled by the force of his strength, produces various vessels under the potter’s control.

original: 'jam dpal / rdza mkhan gyi 'khor lo ni mi rtog /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / rdza mkhan gyi 'khor lo ni mi rtog /
translated: Mañjuśrī, the potter’s wheel is non-conceptual.

original: rnam par mi rtog ste /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog ste /
translated: It is non-discriminating.

original: 'on kyang lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par de'i bya ba de lta bu de 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'on kyang lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par de'i bya ba de lta bu de 'byung ngo //
translated: Nevertheless, that activity occurs spontaneously and non-conceptually.

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i @215b sangs rgyas kyang sngon gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / spyod pa dang / smon lam gyi stobs kyi byin gyi rlabs kyi shugs kyis sems can gyi dbang gis sems can rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba sna tshogs mngon par 'du mdzad kyang de bzhin gshegs pa ni mi rtog /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i @215b sangs rgyas kyang sngon gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / spyod pa dang / smon lam gyi stobs kyi byin gyi rlabs kyi shugs kyis sems can gyi dbang gis sems can rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba sna tshogs mngon par 'du mdzad kyang de bzhin gshegs pa ni mi rtog /
translated: Mañjuśrī, in the same way, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfect and Complete Buddha, by the power of the blessing of his previous roots of virtue, conduct, and aspirations, creates various roots of virtue for sentient beings through the power of sentient beings.

original: rnam par mi rtog ste /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog ste /
translated: Yet the Tathāgata is without thought and without discrimination.

original: 'on kyang lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par de'i bya ba de lta bu de 'byung ste; sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par de'i bya ba de lta bu de 'byung ste; sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nevertheless, that activity occurs in that way, spontaneously and without discrimination, because he possesses the unshared qualities of a buddha.

original: 'jam dpal / sems can gang dag de bzhin gshegs pa la bshos gsol ba dang / gang dag bshos mi gsol ba dang / gang dag gis mthong ba dang / gang dag gis ma mthong ba dang / gang dag gis bstod pa dang / gang dag mi bstod pa dang /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / sems can gang dag de bzhin gshegs pa la bshos gsol ba dang / gang dag bshos mi gsol ba dang / gang dag gis mthong ba dang / gang dag gis ma mthong ba dang / gang dag gis bstod pa dang / gang dag mi bstod pa dang /
translated: Mañjuśrī, all the activities of those sentient beings who offer food to the Tathāgata, those who do not offer food, those who see him, those who do not see him, those who praise him, those who do not praise him,

original: gang dag gshe ba dang / gang dag mi gshe ba dang / gang dag zhu ba byed pa dang / gang dag zhu ba mi byed pa de dag thams cad kyi bya ba rnams kyang sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gang dag gshe ba dang / gang dag mi gshe ba dang / gang dag zhu ba byed pa dang / gang dag zhu ba mi byed pa de dag thams cad kyi bya ba rnams kyang sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par 'byung ngo //
translated: those who revile him, those who do not revile him, those who ask questions, and those who do not ask questions—all those activities are accomplished effortlessly and nonconceptually by the Buddha’s blessing.

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin gshegs pa'i khyu mchog tu gyur pa thams cad kyang dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin gshegs pa'i khyu mchog tu gyur pa thams cad kyang dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa las 'byung ngo //
translated: Mañjuśrī, all the Tathāgata’s activities as the best of leaders arise from being assisted by spiritual friends.

original: 'jam dpal / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa'i byang chub sems dpas sangs rgyas kyi sku dang / kha dog mtha' yas pa yongs su 'grub pa grub pa'i gzungs thob ste /🔽gzungs de @216a *//
analyzed: 'jam dpal / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa'i byang chub sems dpas sangs rgyas kyi sku dang / kha dog mtha' yas pa yongs su 'grub pa grub pa'i gzungs thob ste / gzungs de @216a *//
translated: Mañjuśrī, a bodhisattva who is sustained by a spiritual teacher attains the dhāraṇī of the accomplishment of the accomplishment of the infinite body and color of the Buddha.

original: thob pas phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad sangs rgyas kyi skus khyab par byed do //
analyzed: thob pas phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad sangs rgyas kyi skus khyab par byed do //
translated: Having attained that dhāraṇī, he pervades all the world systems in the ten directions with the body of the Buddha.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams re rer yang mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i sku ston to //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams re rer yang mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i sku ston to //
translated: In each world system, he displays the body of perfect awakening.

original: lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba grangs med pa dang / chos tha dad pa nyid grangs med pa ston te gnas nas kyang mi g-yo'o //
analyzed: lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba grangs med pa dang / chos tha dad pa nyid grangs med pa ston te gnas nas kyang mi g-yo'o //
translated: He turns the wheel of Dharma spontaneously and nonconceptually, displaying countless numbers of different Dharmas, yet he does not move from his place.

original: 'jam dpal / de ltar na dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams ni yon tan bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de ltar na dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams ni yon tan bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: Mañjuśrī, spiritual teachers possess inconceivable qualities.

original: 'jam dpal / de lta bas na byang chub sems dpas de bzhin gshegs pa la bya ba bzhin du dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams la bsten par bya'o //🔽bsnyen par bya'o //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de lta bas na byang chub sems dpas de bzhin gshegs pa la bya ba bzhin du dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams la bsten par bya'o // bsnyen par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, Mañjuśrī, the bodhisattva should attend upon the spiritual friend as if he were the Tathāgata.🔽He should serve him,

original: bsnyen bkur bya'o //
analyzed: bsnyen bkur bya'o //
translated: and honor him.

original: 'jam dpal / mi dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams ni brag gi bya skyibs rab tu 'bar ba bzhin du yongs su spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / mi dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams ni brag gi bya skyibs rab tu 'bar ba bzhin du yongs su spang bar bya'o //
translated: Mañjuśrī, the spiritual friend should be avoided as one would a burning pit of coals.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: 'jam dpal / mi dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsten na byang chub sems dpa'i sems dang / 'du shes phyin ci log tu 'gyur ro //🔽sems phyin ci log tu gyur na kun tu 'khrul bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / mi dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsten na byang chub sems dpa'i sems dang / 'du shes phyin ci log tu 'gyur ro // sems phyin ci log tu gyur na kun tu 'khrul bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Mañjuśrī, if one attends upon the spiritual friend, one’s mind and one’s ideas become perverted.🔽If one’s mind and ideas are perverted, one becomes confused.

original: sems kun tu 'khrul bar gyur na rnam par rmongs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems kun tu 'khrul bar gyur na rnam par rmongs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one’s mind is confused, one becomes deluded.

original: sems rnam par rmongs na skrag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems rnam par rmongs na skrag par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one’s mind is deluded, one becomes frightened.

original: sems skrag par gyur na byang chub kyi sems 'dor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems skrag par gyur na byang chub kyi sems 'dor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one’s mind is frightened, one abandons the thought of awakening.

original: byang chub kyi sems bor na lha yongs su gtong @216b bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems bor na lha yongs su gtong @216b bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If you abandon bodhicitta, you abandon the deity.

original: lha yongs su gtong na lha rnams kyang de la bsngags pa ma yin pa smra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lha yongs su gtong na lha rnams kyang de la bsngags pa ma yin pa smra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If you abandon the deity, the gods will speak ill of you.

original: klu rnams dang / gnod sbyin rnams dang / dri za rnams dang / mi 'am ci rnams dang / lto 'phye chen po rnams dang / mi rnams dang / mi ma yin pa rnams nas sangs rgyas kyi bar dag kyang de la bsngags pa ma yin pa smra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: klu rnams dang / gnod sbyin rnams dang / dri za rnams dang / mi 'am ci rnams dang / lto 'phye chen po rnams dang / mi rnams dang / mi ma yin pa rnams nas sangs rgyas kyi bar dag kyang de la bsngags pa ma yin pa smra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, kinnaras, mahoragas, humans, non-humans, and even the buddhas will speak ill of you.

original: 'jam dpal / de lta bas na byang chub sems dpas dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams la bsten par bya'o //🔽bsnyen par bya'o //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de lta bas na byang chub sems dpas dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams la bsten par bya'o // bsnyen par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, Mañjuśrī, bodhisattvas should rely on spiritual friends.🔽They should serve them.

original: bsnyen bkur bya'o //
analyzed: bsnyen bkur bya'o //
translated: They should honor them.

original: 'jam dpal / dper na /🔽skyabs zhes bya ba'i sman ni gnod sems kyi sems dang ldan pa'am /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / dper na / skyabs zhes bya ba'i sman ni gnod sems kyi sems dang ldan pa'am /
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is like this:🔽The medicine called “refuge” is seen by those with a malicious mind

original: dang ba'i sems dang ldan pas mthong yang rung ste /
analyzed: dang ba'i sems dang ldan pas mthong yang rung ste /
translated: or by those with a faithful mind.

original: tha na dud 'gro'i skye gnas su song ba de dag gi nad thams cad med par 'gyur yang skyabs zhes bya ba'i sman ni mi rtog /
analyzed: tha na dud 'gro'i skye gnas su song ba de dag gi nad thams cad med par 'gyur yang skyabs zhes bya ba'i sman ni mi rtog /
translated: Even the illnesses of those who have taken birth as animals will be cured, but the medicine called “refuge” will not be conceptualized.

original: rnam par mi rtog ste /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog ste /
translated: Even if all the illnesses of those who have taken birth as animals were to disappear, the medicine called ‘refuge’ would not think or conceptualize.

original: ma 'dres pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i phyir lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par de'i bya ba de lta bu de 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ma 'dres pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i phyir lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par de'i bya ba de lta bu de 'byung ngo //
translated: Because it possesses unmixed qualities, it would spontaneously and non-conceptually perform that function.

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du gnod sems kyi sems dang ldan pa'am /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du gnod sems kyi sems dang ldan pa'am /
translated: Mañjuśrī, in the same way, if someone with a malicious mind or

original: dang ba'i sems dang ldan pa gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku ri mor bris pa'am /
analyzed: dang ba'i sems dang ldan pa gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku ri mor bris pa'am /
translated: someone with a pure mind were to see a painted or sculpted image of the Tathāgata,

original: gzugs su byas pa mthong na tha na dud 'gro'i skye gnas su song ba'ang rung ste /
analyzed: gzugs su byas pa mthong na tha na dud 'gro'i skye gnas su song ba'ang rung ste /
translated: even if they were to take birth as an animal,

original: de dag gi nyon mongs pa'i nad thams cad med par 'gyur yang de bzhin gshegs pa ni mi rtog /🔽rnam par mi rtog ste /
analyzed: de dag gi nyon mongs pa'i nad thams cad med par 'gyur yang de bzhin gshegs pa ni mi rtog / rnam par mi rtog ste /
translated: all their afflictive illnesses would disappear, but the Tathāgata would not think or conceptualize.

original: ma 'dres pa'i chos dang @217a *//
analyzed: ma 'dres pa'i chos dang @217a *//
translated: Because it possesses unmixed qualities,🔽it would spontaneously and non-conceptually perform that function.

original: ldan pa'i phyir lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par bya ba de lta bu de 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ldan pa'i phyir lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par bya ba de lta bu de 'byung ngo //
translated: It is spontaneous and nonconceptual.

original: 'jam dpal / dper na /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / dper na /
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is like this:

original: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor rgya mtsho chen po las mngon par 'phags te /
analyzed: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor rgya mtsho chen po las mngon par 'phags te /
translated: The orb of the sun rises above the great ocean

original: nam mkha'i spyod yul la gnas nas 'od zer bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag grangs med pa btang bas grong dang / grong khyer dang / grong rdal dang / ljongs dang; yul 'khor dang / rgyal po'i pho brang 'khor thams cad du mthong ba sbyin par byed cing mun pa sel bar byed /
analyzed: nam mkha'i spyod yul la gnas nas 'od zer bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag grangs med pa btang bas grong dang / grong khyer dang / grong rdal dang / ljongs dang; yul 'khor dang / rgyal po'i pho brang 'khor thams cad du mthong ba sbyin par byed cing mun pa sel bar byed /
translated: and, abiding in the realm of space, it sends out countless hundreds of thousands of millions of billions of light rays, illuminating all the villages, towns, cities, countries, territories, and royal palaces, dispelling the darkness,

original: 'dam rdzab dang / rnyog pa thams cad skam par byed /
analyzed: 'dam rdzab dang / rnyog pa thams cad skam par byed /
translated: drying up all the mud and mire,

original: padma rnams kyang kha 'bye bar byed do //
analyzed: padma rnams kyang kha 'bye bar byed do //
translated: and causing the lotuses to bloom.

original: rtsva dang / shing gel ba dang / sman dang / nags tshal thams cad kyang skyed par byed /
analyzed: rtsva dang / shing gel ba dang / sman dang / nags tshal thams cad kyang skyed par byed /
translated: It causes all the grass, thickets, herbs, and forests to grow,

original: sman thams cad kyang yongs su smin par byed /
analyzed: sman thams cad kyang yongs su smin par byed /
translated: and it ripens all the crops.

original: las kyi gnas thams cad ni gnas par byed la /
analyzed: las kyi gnas thams cad ni gnas par byed la /
translated: It illuminates all the places of action.

original: chu klung dang / mtshe'u dang / mtsho bran thams cad la'ang dus gcig tu snang ba thob par 'gyur yang gnas las kyang mi g-yo zhing /🔽'jam dpal / nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor ni mi rtog /
analyzed: chu klung dang / mtshe'u dang / mtsho bran thams cad la'ang dus gcig tu snang ba thob par 'gyur yang gnas las kyang mi g-yo zhing / 'jam dpal / nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor ni mi rtog /
translated: It is seen at the same time in all the rivers, ponds, and lakes, and yet it does not move from its place.

original: rnam par mi rtog ste /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, the orb of the sun does not think or conceptualize.

original: 'on kyang ma 'dres pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i phyir lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par de'i bya ba de lta bu de rtag tu 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'on kyang ma 'dres pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i phyir lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par de'i bya ba de lta bu de rtag tu 'byung ngo //
translated: Nevertheless, because it possesses unadulterated qualities, it spontaneously and nonconceptually performs that function constantly.

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyang srid pa'i rgya mtsho las mngon par 'phags te /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyang srid pa'i rgya mtsho las mngon par 'phags te /
translated: Mañjuśrī, in the same way, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfect and Complete Buddha rises above the ocean of saṃsāra.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi @217b nam mkha'i spyod yul la gnas nas ye shes kyi 'od zer bye ba khrag khrig grangs med pa btang bas phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams rab 'byams thams cad du snang ba sbyin par mdzad cing sems can thams cad kyi ma rig pa'i
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi @217b nam mkha'i spyod yul la gnas nas ye shes kyi 'od zer bye ba khrag khrig grangs med pa btang bas phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams rab 'byams thams cad du snang ba sbyin par mdzad cing sems can thams cad kyi ma rig pa'i
translated: Abiding in the space of the realm of phenomena, he sent out countless quintillions of light rays of wisdom, illuminating all the infinite world systems in the ten directions and dispelling the darkness,

original: mun pa mun nag dang / rab rib dang / ling tog rnams rnam par sel bar mdzad /
analyzed: mun pa mun nag dang / rab rib dang / ling tog rnams rnam par sel bar mdzad /
translated: the thick darkness, the cataracts, and the blindness of all beings.

original: nyon mongs pa'i 'dam rdzab dang / rnyog pa thams cad skem par mdzad /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i 'dam rdzab dang / rnyog pa thams cad skem par mdzad /
translated: He dried up all the mud and mire of the afflictions.

original: yun ring po nas gnyid kyis log pa'i sems can gyi khams ni sad par mdzad /🔽sems can thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad ni skye bar mdzad /🔽sems can thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i tshogs thams cad ni yongs su smin par mdzad /
analyzed: yun ring po nas gnyid kyis log pa'i sems can gyi khams ni sad par mdzad / sems can thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad ni skye bar mdzad / sems can thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i tshogs thams cad ni yongs su smin par mdzad /
translated: He awakened the realms of beings who had been asleep for a long time.🔽He caused all the roots of virtue of all beings to grow.🔽He ripened the accumulations of all the roots of virtue of all beings.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sgo thams cad ni rab tu 'jog par mdzad de /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sgo thams cad ni rab tu 'jog par mdzad de /
translated: He established all the gateways to the roots of virtue.

original: dus gcig tu de'i mdzad pa thams cad 'byung yang gnas nas kyang mi g-yo zhing /🔽'jam dpal / de bzhin gshegs pa ni mi rtog /
analyzed: dus gcig tu de'i mdzad pa thams cad 'byung yang gnas nas kyang mi g-yo zhing / 'jam dpal / de bzhin gshegs pa ni mi rtog /
translated: All his deeds occur simultaneously, yet he does not move from his seat.

original: rnam par mi rtog ste /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, the Tathāgata does not think or conceptualize.

original: 'on kyang ma 'dres pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i phyir lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par de'i mdzad pa de lta bu de 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'on kyang ma 'dres pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i phyir lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par de'i mdzad pa de lta bu de 'byung ngo //
translated: Nevertheless, because he possesses unmixed qualities, his deeds occur spontaneously and nonconceptually.

original: 'jam dpal / de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par sems can yongs su smin par mdzad pa'i gnas kyang dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par sems can yongs su smin par mdzad pa'i gnas kyang dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa las 'byung ngo //
translated: Mañjuśrī, in this way, the Tathāgata’s spontaneous and nonconceptual ripening of sentient beings occurs through being embraced by a spiritual friend.

original: 'jam dpal / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni @218a *//
analyzed: 'jam dpal / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni @218a *//
translated: Mañjuśrī, bodhisattvas who are embraced by spiritual friends

original: chos rab tu rnam par 'byed cing dpyod pa la mkhas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: chos rab tu rnam par 'byed cing dpyod pa la mkhas par 'gyur te /
translated: become skilled in discerning and analyzing phenomena.

original: de chos rnams la 'di ltar dpyod do //
analyzed: de chos rnams la 'di ltar dpyod do //
translated: They analyze phenomena in the following way:

original: mig ni gzugs kyi dmigs pa'i rgyu ma yin; gzugs kyang mig dmigs pa'i rgyu ma yin la dmigs pa'i rgyu rkyen nyid kyis kyang rnam par shes pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: mig ni gzugs kyi dmigs pa'i rgyu ma yin; gzugs kyang mig dmigs pa'i rgyu ma yin la dmigs pa'i rgyu rkyen nyid kyis kyang rnam par shes pa 'byung ste /
translated: The eye is not the cause for the form that is its object, and form is not the cause for the eye that is its object. Consciousness arises due to the cause and condition of the object.

original: rnam par shes pa de'ang mig las kyang ma byung /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa de'ang mig las kyang ma byung /
translated: That consciousness does not arise from the eye,

original: gzugs las kyang ma byung zhing rnam par shes pa de ni byung nas zhig la zhu zhing mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs las kyang ma byung zhing rnam par shes pa de ni byung nas zhig la zhu zhing mi gnas pa'o //
translated: nor does it arise from form. That consciousness, having arisen, dissolves and does not remain.

original: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus kyang de bzhin no //
translated: The same is true for the ear, nose, tongue, and body.

original: yid kyang chos kyi rkyen ma yin zhing chos kyang yid kyi rkyen ma yin la dmigs pa'i rgyu rkyen nyid kyis kyang rnam par shes pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: yid kyang chos kyi rkyen ma yin zhing chos kyang yid kyi rkyen ma yin la dmigs pa'i rgyu rkyen nyid kyis kyang rnam par shes pa 'byung ste /
translated: The mind is not the condition for mental phenomena, and mental phenomena are not the condition for the mind. Consciousness arises due to the cause and condition of the object.

original: rnam par shes pa de ni yid las kyang ma byung /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa de ni yid las kyang ma byung /
translated: That consciousness does not arise from the mind,

original: chos rnams las kyang ma byung zhing yid kyi rnam par shes pa de ni byung nas zhig la zhu zhing mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: chos rnams las kyang ma byung zhing yid kyi rnam par shes pa de ni byung nas zhig la zhu zhing mi gnas pa'o //
translated: nor does it arise from mental phenomena. That mental consciousness, having arisen, dissolves and does not remain.

original: de bzhin du dge ba'i rtsa ba'ang byang chub kyi rkyen ma yin /
analyzed: de bzhin du dge ba'i rtsa ba'ang byang chub kyi rkyen ma yin /
translated: In the same way, the roots of virtue are not the condition of awakening,

original: byang chub kyang dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rkyen ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: byang chub kyang dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rkyen ma yin mod kyi /
translated: and awakening is not the condition of the roots of virtue.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba de'ang byang chub kyi rkyen la dmigs pa las sems skye ba rnams kyi sa skye ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba de'ang byang chub kyi rkyen la dmigs pa las sems skye ba rnams kyi sa skye ste /
translated: However, the roots of virtue do arise from the mind that focuses on the condition of awakening.

original: de dag kyang skyes nas zhig cing zhu la mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang skyes nas zhig cing zhu la mi gnas pa'o //
translated: And those, once arisen, cease, dissolve, and do not remain.

original: de la sems gang gis dge ba'i rtsa ba mngon par 'dus byas pa dang / sems gang gis byang chub tu yongs su bsngos pa de gnyis ni phan tshun mi sbyor ro //
analyzed: de la sems gang gis dge ba'i rtsa ba mngon par 'dus byas pa dang / sems gang gis byang chub tu yongs su bsngos pa de gnyis ni phan tshun mi sbyor ro //
translated: The mind that accumulates the roots of virtue and the mind that dedicates them to awakening do not unite with each other.

original: dper na / me ni gang nas @218b kyang mi 'ong /
analyzed: dper na / me ni gang nas @218b kyang mi 'ong /
translated: For example, fire does not come from anywhere

original: gang du mi 'gro ste /
analyzed: gang du mi 'gro ste /
translated: or go anywhere.

original: 'on kyang rgyu dang / rkyen gyis 'bar ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang rgyu dang / rkyen gyis 'bar ro //
translated: Nevertheless, it burns through causes and conditions.

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab kyi me 'bar ba'ang gang nas kyang mi 'ong /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab kyi me 'bar ba'ang gang nas kyang mi 'ong /
translated: Mañjuśrī, in the same way, the burning of a bodhisattva’s wisdom fire does not come from anywhere

original: gang du'ang mi 'gro ste /
analyzed: gang du'ang mi 'gro ste /
translated: or go anywhere.

original: 'on kyang dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rgyu la brten nas byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab kyi me 'bar te /
analyzed: 'on kyang dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rgyu la brten nas byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab kyi me 'bar te /
translated: However, in dependence on the cause of roots of virtue, the fire of the wisdom of the bodhisattvas blazes.

original: shes pa de lta bu dang ldan pa de ni myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
analyzed: shes pa de lta bu dang ldan pa de ni myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
translated: Those who have such knowledge quickly and fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood.

original: 'jam dpal / de ltar na dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams ni yon tan rgya mtsho tshad med pa yin no //🔽'jam dpal / rigs kyi bu'am /🔽rigs kyi bu mo gang la la zhig gis phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rdul snyed kyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' dang bcas /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de ltar na dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams ni yon tan rgya mtsho tshad med pa yin no // 'jam dpal / rigs kyi bu'am / rigs kyi bu mo gang la la zhig gis phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rdul snyed kyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' dang bcas /
translated: Mañjuśrī, the spiritual friends are thus an immeasurable ocean of good qualities.🔽Mañjuśrī, if a son or daughter of good family were to offer to the blessed buddhas, together with the bodhisattvas and śrāvakas, as many as there are atoms in all the world systems in the ten directions, food of a hundred flavors and divine clothing,

original: nyan thos dang bcas pa rnams la rtag par nyin gcig bzhin du zhal zas ro brgya dang ldan pa dang / lha'i na bza' dag phul la /
analyzed: nyan thos dang bcas pa rnams la rtag par nyin gcig bzhin du zhal zas ro brgya dang ldan pa dang / lha'i na bza' dag phul la /
translated: every day,

original: de ltar 'bul ba bskal pa gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag tu phul zhing de bzhin gshegs pa de dag yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas de bzhin gshegs pa re re'i phyir yang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams rab 'byams thams cad du 'jig rten gyi
analyzed: de ltar 'bul ba bskal pa gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag tu phul zhing de bzhin gshegs pa de dag yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas de bzhin gshegs pa re re'i phyir yang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams rab 'byams thams cad du 'jig rten gyi
translated: In this way, they make offerings for as many eons as there are grains of sand in the Ganges river. After those thus-gone ones have passed into parinirvāṇa, they make offerings for each of those thus-gone ones in all the infinite world systems of the ten directions.🔽

original: khams re rer yang mchod rten dzambu'i chu bo'i gser las byas pa /
analyzed: khams re rer yang mchod rten dzambu'i chu bo'i gser las byas pa /
translated: He would make such offerings for as many eons as there are grains of sand in the Ganges River. After those thus-gone ones had passed into parinirvāṇa, he would make offerings to each of them by filling all the infinite world systems in the ten directions with stūpas made of the gold of the Jambū River.

original: nor bu rin po che glog gi sgron mas spras pa /🔽nor bu rin po che 'od thams cad bsdus pa'i @219a *//
analyzed: nor bu rin po che glog gi sgron mas spras pa / nor bu rin po che 'od thams cad bsdus pa'i @219a *//
translated: Those stūpas would be adorned with lightning-lamp jewels,

original: stegs bus yongs su bskor ba /
analyzed: stegs bus yongs su bskor ba /
translated: surrounded by platforms made of the jewels that gather all light,

original: nor bu dang / mu tig dang / rin po che'i phreng bas mdzes par byas pa /🔽gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan bsgreng ba /
analyzed: nor bu dang / mu tig dang / rin po che'i phreng bas mdzes par byas pa / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan bsgreng ba /
translated: and beautified with strings of jewels, pearls, and gems.🔽They would be raised with parasols, victory banners, and flags,

original: dril bu g-yer ka'i dra ba'i bla bre bres pa /
analyzed: dril bu g-yer ka'i dra ba'i bla bre bres pa /
translated: and would be covered with canopies of nets of small bells.

original: tsandan sprul gyi snying po'i byug pas byug pa /
analyzed: tsandan sprul gyi snying po'i byug pas byug pa /
translated: They would be anointed with sandalwood and musk.

original: nor bu rin po che dbang gi rgyal po'i dra bas khebs par byas pa /
analyzed: nor bu rin po che dbang gi rgyal po'i dra bas khebs par byas pa /
translated: They are covered with nets of precious sapphire jewels.

original: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rdul snyed dag byas te /
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rdul snyed dag byas te /
translated: They are as numerous as the atoms in all the world systems in the ten directions.

original: mchod rten de dag la stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i tshad tsam gyi lha'i na bza' dag dang / gdugs kyi sprin dag dang / rgyal mtshan gyi sprin dag dang / ba dan gyi sprin dag dang / me tog gi sprin dag dang / spos kyi sprin dag dang /
analyzed: mchod rten de dag la stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i tshad tsam gyi lha'i na bza' dag dang / gdugs kyi sprin dag dang / rgyal mtshan gyi sprin dag dang / ba dan gyi sprin dag dang / me tog gi sprin dag dang / spos kyi sprin dag dang /
translated: He offers to those stūpas divine garments, parasols, victory banners, flags, flower clouds, incense clouds,

original: nor bu rin po che dbang gi rgyal po'i sprin dag dang / yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che'i sprin dag gis gtor /
analyzed: nor bu rin po che dbang gi rgyal po'i sprin dag dang / yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che'i sprin dag gis gtor /
translated: clouds of precious sapphire jewels, and clouds of wish-fulfilling gems, all of them as vast as the great trichiliocosm.

original: mngon par gtor la nyin gcig bzhin /
analyzed: mngon par gtor la nyin gcig bzhin /
translated: He makes these offerings day after day,

original: de ltar mchod cing bskal pa gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed du mchod la /
analyzed: de ltar mchod cing bskal pa gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed du mchod la /
translated: and continues to do so for eons equal in number to the grains of sand in the Ganges river.

original: sems can gzhan dpag tu med grangs med pa dag kyang mchod pa de nyid la 'god pa bas /
analyzed: sems can gzhan dpag tu med grangs med pa dag kyang mchod pa de nyid la 'god pa bas /
translated: He also establishes countless other beings in the practice of making these offerings.

original: 'jam dpal / rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: Mañjuśrī, if a son or daughter of noble family were to make such offerings,

original: rigs kyi bu mo gzhan gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan dang / ye shes bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i yul la 'jug pa bstan pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs 'di la tha na mos par byed na 'di nyid de bas bsod nams ches grangs @219b med par bskyed do //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gzhan gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan dang / ye shes bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i yul la 'jug pa bstan pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs 'di la tha na mos par byed na 'di nyid de bas bsod nams ches grangs @219b med par bskyed do //
translated: Any other son or daughter of noble family who believes in this Dharma discourse that teaches the inconceivable qualities and wisdom of the thus-gone ones will generate incalculably greater merit than that.

original: 'jam dpal / chos kyi rnam grangs 'di la mos pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni pha rol tu phyin pa bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag dpag tu med grangs med pa dag yongs su rdzogs par byed do //🔽sa bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag dpag tu med grangs med pa dag gnon to //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / chos kyi rnam grangs 'di la mos pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni pha rol tu phyin pa bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag dpag tu med grangs med pa dag yongs su rdzogs par byed do // sa bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag dpag tu med grangs med pa dag gnon to //
translated: Mañjuśrī, bodhisattvas who believe in this Dharma discourse will perfect countless quintillions of perfections.🔽They will master countless quintillions of levels.

original: bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag dpag tu med grangs med pa dag phyir snyil bar byed do //
analyzed: bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag dpag tu med grangs med pa dag phyir snyil bar byed do //
translated: They will purify countless quintillions of eons.

original: sangs rgyas kyi rnam par rol pa bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag dpag tu med grangs med pa dag rab tu shes so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rnam par rol pa bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag dpag tu med grangs med pa dag rab tu shes so //
translated: They will understand countless quintillions of the Buddha’s displays.

original: nga rgyal gyi ri dpag tu med grangs med pa dag rnam par 'jig par byed do //
analyzed: nga rgyal gyi ri dpag tu med grangs med pa dag rnam par 'jig par byed do //
translated: He destroys countless, immeasurable mountains of pride.

original: phrag dog dang / ser sna'i rgyal mtshan dpag tu med grangs med pa dag snyol bar byed do //🔽srid pa'i chu klung dpag tu med grangs med pa dag skem bar byed do //
analyzed: phrag dog dang / ser sna'i rgyal mtshan dpag tu med grangs med pa dag snyol bar byed do // srid pa'i chu klung dpag tu med grangs med pa dag skem bar byed do //
translated: He uproots countless, immeasurable banners of jealousy and stinginess.🔽He dries up countless, immeasurable rivers of existence.

original: skye ba'i rgya mtsho dpag tu med grangs med pa dag las rgal bar byed do //
analyzed: skye ba'i rgya mtsho dpag tu med grangs med pa dag las rgal bar byed do //
translated: He crosses countless, immeasurable oceans of birth.

original: bdud kyi zhags pa dpag tu med grangs med pa dag gcod do //
analyzed: bdud kyi zhags pa dpag tu med grangs med pa dag gcod do //
translated: He cuts countless, immeasurable snares of Māra.

original: nyi zla rnams dang / brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten skyong ba rnams kyi gzi brjid zil gyis mnan te 'dug go /
analyzed: nyi zla rnams dang / brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten skyong ba rnams kyi gzi brjid zil gyis mnan te 'dug go /
translated: He outshines the splendor of the sun, moon, Śakra, Brahmā, and the world guardians.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro'o //
translated: He travels from buddhafield to buddhafield.

original: sems can dmyal pa dang / dud 'gro'i skye gnas dang / yi dvags dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten du skyes pa'i sems can rnams kyi skyabs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can dmyal pa dang / dud 'gro'i skye gnas dang / yi dvags dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten du skyes pa'i sems can rnams kyi skyabs su 'gyur ro //
translated: He becomes a refuge for beings born in the hells, animal realms, and the world of Yama.

original: sangs rgyas rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' @220a *//
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' @220a *//
translated: the buddhas,🔽and the bodhisattvas.🔽

original: rnams dang yang phrad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnams dang yang phrad par 'gyur ro //
translated: He will meet the buddhas and the bodhisattvas.

original: rgya mtsho'i phyag rgya zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //🔽chos thams cad yang dag par 'du ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
analyzed: rgya mtsho'i phyag rgya zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo // chos thams cad yang dag par 'du ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
translated: He will attain the samādhi called the ocean mudrā.🔽He will attain the samādhi called the gathering of all dharmas.

original: chos thams cad la dbang byed pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
analyzed: chos thams cad la dbang byed pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
translated: He will attain the samādhi called controlling all dharmas.

original: rnam par bkod pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
analyzed: rnam par bkod pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
translated: He will attain the samādhi called the array.

original: rin po che 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
analyzed: rin po che 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
translated: He will attain the samādhi called the source of jewels.

original: dga' bar byed pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
analyzed: dga' bar byed pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
translated: He will attain the samādhi called the bringer of joy.

original: padma bkod pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
analyzed: padma bkod pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
translated: He will attain the samādhi called the array of lotuses.

original: nam mkha' mdzod ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
analyzed: nam mkha' mdzod ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
translated: He will attain the samādhi called the sky treasure.

original: 'jig rten thams cad kyi rjes su song ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad kyi rjes su song ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
translated: They also attain the meditative absorption that is called “in accord with all worlds.”

original: dam pa'i chos padma dkar po zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos padma dkar po zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
translated: They also attain the meditative absorption that is called “white lotus of the sacred teachings.”

original: yul la dbang byed pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
analyzed: yul la dbang byed pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
translated: They also attain the meditative absorption that is called “mastery of objects.”

original: cher bsgyings zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
analyzed: cher bsgyings zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
translated: They also attain the meditative absorption that is called “great majesty.”

original: rnam pa dang / sems la dbang byed pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
analyzed: rnam pa dang / sems la dbang byed pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
translated: They also attain the meditative absorption that is called “mastery of aspects and mind.”

original: seng ge bsgyings pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
analyzed: seng ge bsgyings pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
translated: They also attain the meditative absorption that is called “lion’s play.”

original: nyi ma'i sgron ma zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
analyzed: nyi ma'i sgron ma zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
translated: They also attain the meditative absorption that is called “sun-lamp.”

original: mtha' yas 'khyil ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
analyzed: mtha' yas 'khyil ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
translated: They also attain the meditative absorption that is called “infinite coil.”

original: rab tu g-yo ba'i rjes su song ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
analyzed: rab tu g-yo ba'i rjes su song ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
translated: They also attain the meditative absorption that is called “in accord with great shaking.”

original: rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor @220b zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
analyzed: rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor @220b zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
translated: They also attain the meditative absorption called vajra maṇḍala.

original: rdo rje'i rgyal mtshan zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //🔽rdo rje lta bu zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
analyzed: rdo rje'i rgyal mtshan zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo // rdo rje lta bu zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
translated: They also attain the meditative absorption called vajra banner.🔽They also attain the meditative absorption called vajra-like.

original: rdo rje lte ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
analyzed: rdo rje lte ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
translated: They also attain the meditative absorption called vajra navel.

original: sa 'dzin zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //🔽lhun po sgron ma zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
analyzed: sa 'dzin zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo // lhun po sgron ma zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
translated: They also attain the meditative absorption called earth holder.🔽They also attain the meditative absorption called Meru lamp.

original: lhun po rgyal mtshan zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
analyzed: lhun po rgyal mtshan zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
translated: They also attain the meditative absorption called Meru banner.

original: rin po che'i mdzod ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
analyzed: rin po che'i mdzod ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
translated: They also attain the meditative absorption called jewel treasury.

original: sems la dbang byed pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
analyzed: sems la dbang byed pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
translated: They also attain the meditative absorption called controlling the mind.

original: sems can thams cad kyi sems la dbang byed pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi sems la dbang byed pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
translated: They also attain the meditative absorption called controlling the minds of all sentient beings.

original: spyod pa thams cad kyi yul las nges par 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
analyzed: spyod pa thams cad kyi yul las nges par 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
translated: They also attain the samādhi called definite emergence from all objects of activity.

original: sbyor ba zab cing gsang ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
analyzed: sbyor ba zab cing gsang ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
translated: They also attain the samādhi called profound and secret application.

original: sna tshogs snang ba'i spobs pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
analyzed: sna tshogs snang ba'i spobs pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
translated: They also attain the samādhi called eloquence of the appearance of variety.

original: bltar mi mthong ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
analyzed: bltar mi mthong ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
translated: They also attain the samādhi called invisible.

original: chos thams cad la rnam par lta ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
analyzed: chos thams cad la rnam par lta ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
translated: They also attain the samādhi called observing all phenomena.

original: rnam par rol pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
analyzed: rnam par rol pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
translated: They also attain the samādhi called display.

original: mngon par shes pa thams cad las nges par skyes pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa thams cad las nges par skyes pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
translated: They also attain the samādhi called born from all higher cognitions.

original: bdud kyi dkyil 'khor rnam par 'joms pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
analyzed: bdud kyi dkyil 'khor rnam par 'joms pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
translated: They also attain the samādhi called destroying the maṇḍala of Māra.

original: gzugs thams cad kun tu ston pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin @221a *//🔽kyang 'thob bo //
analyzed: gzugs thams cad kun tu ston pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin @221a *// kyang 'thob bo //
translated: the samādhi called Displaying All Forms,

original: gzugs thams cad kyi khyad par zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
analyzed: gzugs thams cad kyi khyad par zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
translated: the samādhi called Distinguishing All Forms,

original: lus rnam par 'jig pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
analyzed: lus rnam par 'jig pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
translated: the samādhi called Destruction of the Body,

original: spyod pa thams cad la 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
analyzed: spyod pa thams cad la 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
translated: the samādhi called Engaging in All Conduct,

original: shes rab sgron ma zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
analyzed: shes rab sgron ma zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
translated: the samādhi called Lamp of Wisdom,

original: mngon sum du byang chub snang ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
analyzed: mngon sum du byang chub snang ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
translated: the samādhi called Illumination of the Appearance of Enlightenment,

original: so so yang dag par rig pa rin po che bstan pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa rin po che bstan pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
translated: the samādhi called Teaching the Jewel of Analytical Knowledge,

original: yon tan gyi rnam pa thams cad la 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
analyzed: yon tan gyi rnam pa thams cad la 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
translated: and the samādhi called Engaging in All Aspects of Qualities.

original: chos thams cad 'dul bar rnam par nges par bstan pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
analyzed: chos thams cad 'dul bar rnam par nges par bstan pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
translated: They also attain the meditative absorption called “teaching the ascertainment of the discipline of all phenomena.”

original: rab tu zhi ba rnam par nges pa'i cho 'phrul zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
analyzed: rab tu zhi ba rnam par nges pa'i cho 'phrul zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
translated: They also attain the meditative absorption called “ascertaining the miracle of peace.”

original: dpa' bar 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
analyzed: dpa' bar 'gro ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob bo //
translated: They also attain the meditative absorption called “heroic progress.”

original: zab cing brtan pa'i rgya mtsho'i chu'i dus rlabs zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob ste /
analyzed: zab cing brtan pa'i rgya mtsho'i chu'i dus rlabs zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang 'thob ste /
translated: They also attain the meditative absorption called “the ocean’s waves of profound and stable water.”

original: de dag la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag grangs med pa dag 'thob bo //
analyzed: de dag la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag grangs med pa dag 'thob bo //
translated: They attain countless quintillions of such meditative absorptions.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sku dang / kha dog mtha' yas pa yongs su 'grub pa sgrub pa'i gzungs kyang 'thob bo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sku dang / kha dog mtha' yas pa yongs su 'grub pa sgrub pa'i gzungs kyang 'thob bo //
translated: They also attain the dhāraṇī that accomplishes the infinite forms and colors of the buddhas.

original: ye shes dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i gzungs kyang 'thob bo //
analyzed: ye shes dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i gzungs kyang 'thob bo //
translated: They also attain the dhāraṇī called “endowed with wisdom.”

original: sgra dbyangs rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba'i gzungs kyang 'thob bo //
analyzed: sgra dbyangs rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba'i gzungs kyang 'thob bo //
translated: They also attain the dhāraṇī called “pure melody.”

original: mi zad pa'i za @221b ma tog ces bya ba'i gzungs kyang 'thob bo //
analyzed: mi zad pa'i za @221b ma tog ces bya ba'i gzungs kyang 'thob bo //
translated: He also obtains the dhāraṇī called inexhaustible treasure.

original: mtha' yas 'khyil ba zhes bya ba'i gzungs kyang 'thob bo //🔽rgya mtsho'i phyag rgya zhes bya ba'i gzungs kyang 'thob bo //
analyzed: mtha' yas 'khyil ba zhes bya ba'i gzungs kyang 'thob bo // rgya mtsho'i phyag rgya zhes bya ba'i gzungs kyang 'thob bo //
translated: He also obtains the dhāraṇī called infinite coil.🔽He also obtains the dhāraṇī called ocean seal.

original: padma bkod pa zhes bya ba'i gzungs kyang 'thob bo //
analyzed: padma bkod pa zhes bya ba'i gzungs kyang 'thob bo //
translated: He also obtains the dhāraṇī called lotus array.

original: chags pa med pa'i sgor 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i gzungs kyang 'thob bo //
analyzed: chags pa med pa'i sgor 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i gzungs kyang 'thob bo //
translated: He also obtains the dhāraṇī called entering the door of nonattachment.

original: so so yang dag par rig pa rnam par nges pa la 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i gzungs kyang 'thob bo //
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa rnam par nges pa la 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i gzungs kyang 'thob bo //
translated: He also obtains the dhāraṇī called entering the ascertainment of analytical knowledge.

original: sangs rgyas kyi rgyan gyis byin gyis brlabs pa zhes bya ba'i gzungs kyang 'thob bo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rgyan gyis byin gyis brlabs pa zhes bya ba'i gzungs kyang 'thob bo //
translated: He also obtains the dhāraṇī called blessed by the ornaments of the buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sku dang / kha dog mtha' yas pa yongs su 'grub pa zhes bya ba'i gzungs kyang 'thob ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sku dang / kha dog mtha' yas pa yongs su 'grub pa zhes bya ba'i gzungs kyang 'thob ste /
translated: He also obtains the dhāraṇī called accomplishing the infinite body and color of the buddhas.

original: de dag la sogs pa gzungs bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag grangs med pa dag kyang 'thob bo //
analyzed: de dag la sogs pa gzungs bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag grangs med pa dag kyang 'thob bo //
translated: He obtains dhāraṇīs such as these, countless quintillions of dhāraṇīs.

original: chos thams cad la spyod pa'i khyad par nyid kyang 'thob bo //
analyzed: chos thams cad la spyod pa'i khyad par nyid kyang 'thob bo //
translated: They will attain the special practice of all dharmas.

original: chos thams cad la gzhan la rag ma las pa'i shes pa'ang 'thob bo //
analyzed: chos thams cad la gzhan la rag ma las pa'i shes pa'ang 'thob bo //
translated: They will attain the knowledge of all dharmas that is not dependent on others.

original: chos thams cad la som nyi gcod pa nyid kyang 'thob bo //
analyzed: chos thams cad la som nyi gcod pa nyid kyang 'thob bo //
translated: They will attain the elimination of all doubts about the Dharma.

original: sangs rgyas kyi rnam par rol pa stong phrag grangs med pa dag kyang 'thob bo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rnam par rol pa stong phrag grangs med pa dag kyang 'thob bo //
translated: They will attain the countless thousands of displays of the buddhas.

original: sems can thams cad kyi spyod pa'i bye brag la mkhas pa'ang 'thob bo //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi spyod pa'i bye brag la mkhas pa'ang 'thob bo //
translated: They will attain skill in the different behaviors of all sentient beings.

original: 'jam dpal / dper na /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / dper na /
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is like this:

original: ri'i rgyal po ri rab ni ri thams cad zil gyis mnan nas lam me /
analyzed: ri'i rgyal po ri rab ni ri thams cad zil gyis mnan nas lam me /
translated: Mount Sumeru, the king of mountains, outshines all the mountains,

original: lhan ne / lhang nge'o //
analyzed: lhan ne / lhang nge'o //
translated: and it shines, glows, and radiates.

original: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du chos kyi rnam grangs 'di la mos pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang sems can thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad @222a *//🔽zil gyis mnan nas lam me /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de bzhin du chos kyi rnam grangs 'di la mos pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang sems can thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad @222a *// zil gyis mnan nas lam me /
translated: Mañjuśrī, in the same way, the bodhisattvas who aspire to this Dharma discourse outshine all the roots of virtue of all sentient beings,

original: lhan ne / lhang nge'o //
analyzed: lhan ne / lhang nge'o //
translated: and they shine, glow, and radiate.

original: de nas 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sgrib pa thams cad rnam par sel ba la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sgrib pa thams cad rnam par sel ba la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the youthful Manjushri said to the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sarva­nīvaraṇa­viṣkambhin:🔽“Noble one, it is excellent, excellent, that you have such great compassion for beings and have asked the Tathāgata about this matter.🔽

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras /
translated: Then the youthful Manjushri said to the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sarva­nīvaraṇa­viṣkambhin, “O son of the victorious ones!

original: byang chub sems dpas gang dag la mos pas yon tan gyi khyad par 'di dag dang / gzhan dag kyang 'thob pa'i chos kyi bye brag gzhan dag kyang yod dam /🔽de skad ces smras pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sgrib pa thams cad rnam par sel bas 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas gang dag la mos pas yon tan gyi khyad par 'di dag dang / gzhan dag kyang 'thob pa'i chos kyi bye brag gzhan dag kyang yod dam / de skad ces smras pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sgrib pa thams cad rnam par sel bas 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Are there any other specific qualities that bodhisattvas can aspire to in order to attain these and other excellent qualities?”

original: 'jam dpal / byang chub sems dpas gang dag la mos na /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / byang chub sems dpas gang dag la mos na /
translated: When this was said, the bodhisattva Sarva­nīvaraṇa­viṣkambhin said to the youthful Manjushri, “Manjushri, when bodhisattvas aspire to these five qualities,

original: yon tan gyi khyad par 'di dag dang / gzhan dpag tu med pa dag kyang 'thob pa'i chos lnga po 'di dag ste /
analyzed: yon tan gyi khyad par 'di dag dang / gzhan dpag tu med pa dag kyang 'thob pa'i chos lnga po 'di dag ste /
translated: they will attain these excellent qualities and countless others.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are these five?

original: chos thams cad gnyen po med pa dang / ma skyes pa dang / ma 'gags pa dang / brjod du med par mos pa dang / rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par skad cig skad cig la de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod pa dang / spyod lam la 'jug pa'i gnas dzambu'i gling gi rdul phra rab kyi rdul las kyang lhag pa dag la lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par 'jug par mos pa dang /🔽seng ge bran bzang gi bu'i rtogs pa brjod pas sems can yongs su smin par byas pa de bcom ldan @222b 'das sh'akya thub pas /
analyzed: chos thams cad gnyen po med pa dang / ma skyes pa dang / ma 'gags pa dang / brjod du med par mos pa dang / rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par skad cig skad cig la de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod pa dang / spyod lam la 'jug pa'i gnas dzambu'i gling gi rdul phra rab kyi rdul las kyang lhag pa dag la lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par 'jug par mos pa dang / seng ge bran bzang gi bu'i rtogs pa brjod pas sems can yongs su smin par byas pa de bcom ldan @222b 'das sh'akya thub pas /
translated: They are interested in the fact that all phenomena are without antidotes, are unborn, unceasing, and inexpressible. They are interested in the fact that, without any effort and without any concepts, the tathāgatas constantly and uninterruptedly engage in conduct and activities that are beyond the number of atoms in the world.🔽The Blessed One Śākyamuni ripened beings by telling the story of Siṃha, the son of Bhadrika.

original: bskal pa gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed nas mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te mdzad par mos pa dang / mar me mdzad kyis lung bstan pa nas bzung ste mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i bar der /
analyzed: bskal pa gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed nas mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te mdzad par mos pa dang / mar me mdzad kyis lung bstan pa nas bzung ste mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i bar der /
translated: He is interested in the fact that the Blessed One Śākyamuni, from the time he attained buddhahood eons ago, as many eons ago as there are sand grains in the Ganges river, until the present, has been working for the welfare of beings.

original: bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa gang yin pa de thams cad sangs rgyas kyi yul gyi mtha' klas pa'i bskal pa nas mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas bstan pa yin par mos pa dang / sh'akya thub pas bstan pas sems can yongs su smin par byas pa gang yin pa de sangs rgyas kyi yul gyis mthas klas pa'i bskal pa nas bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas mdzad pa yin par mos pa ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa gang yin pa de thams cad sangs rgyas kyi yul gyi mtha' klas pa'i bskal pa nas mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas bstan pa yin par mos pa dang / sh'akya thub pas bstan pas sems can yongs su smin par byas pa gang yin pa de sangs rgyas kyi yul gyis mthas klas pa'i bskal pa nas bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas mdzad pa yin par mos pa ste /
translated: They believe that all the bodhisattva deeds of the Bhagavat Shakyamuni were taught by him after he had attained perfect buddhahood in a time gone by, a time that was as limitless as the realm of the Buddha. They believe that the Bhagavat Shakyamuni, after attaining perfect buddhahood in a time gone by, a time that was as limitless as the realm of the Buddha, performed all the deeds by which he ripened beings through the teachings of Shakyamuni.

original: 'jam dpal / lnga po de dag ni byang chub sems dpas gang dag la mos pas yon tan gyi khyad par 'di dag dang gzhan dpag tu med pa dag kyang thob pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / lnga po de dag ni byang chub sems dpas gang dag la mos pas yon tan gyi khyad par 'di dag dang gzhan dpag tu med pa dag kyang thob pa yin no //
translated: Manjusri, these are the five things in which the bodhisattva should believe in order to attain these and other limitless special good qualities.

original: 'jam dpal / rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: Manjusri, if a son or daughter of good lineage

original: rigs kyi bu mo gang la la zhig gis 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rdul snyed kyi dgra bcom pa mngon par shes pa drug dang ldan pa /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang la la zhig gis 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rdul snyed kyi dgra bcom pa mngon par shes pa drug dang ldan pa /
translated: “Son of a good family, if someone were to give rise to the thought of complete awakening for the first time, and if another son or daughter of good family were to establish as many worthy ones endowed with the six superknowledges as there are atoms in all world systems in the state of irreversibility from the three vehicles,🔽

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad la bsam gtan pa rnams la nyin gcig bzhin du lha'i zas ro brgya dang ldan pa dang / lha'i gos dag byin te /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad la bsam gtan pa rnams la nyin gcig bzhin du lha'i zas ro brgya dang ldan pa dang / lha'i gos dag byin te /
translated: “Mañjuśrī, suppose some gentleman or lady were to give to each of the arhats who possess the six superknowledges and are absorbed in the eight liberations, as numerous as the atoms in all the world systems, divine food of a hundred tastes and divine clothes every day,

original: de ltar byin pa bskal pa gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag tu byin pa bas /🔽'jam dpal / rigs @223a *//
analyzed: de ltar byin pa bskal pa gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag tu byin pa bas / 'jam dpal / rigs @223a *//
translated: and were to give in this way for aeons equal to the sands of the Ganges river.🔽“Mañjuśrī, suppose another gentleman or lady were to give food for one day to a single solitary buddha.

original: kyi bu'am / rigs kyi bu mo gzhan gang zhig gis rang sangs rgyas gcig la nyi ma gcig zas byin na de ni de bas bsod nams ches grangs med par bskyed de //🔽'jam dpal / rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: kyi bu'am / rigs kyi bu mo gzhan gang zhig gis rang sangs rgyas gcig la nyi ma gcig zas byin na de ni de bas bsod nams ches grangs med par bskyed de // 'jam dpal / rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: The latter would produce goodness immeasurably greater than the former.🔽“Mañjuśrī, suppose some gentleman or lady were to establish in the ten wholesome courses of action all the sentient beings in all the world systems in the ten directions.

original: rigs kyi bu mo gang la la zhig gis 'jig rten gyi khams re rer yang gtsug lag khang dzambu'i chu bo'i gser las byas pa /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang la la zhig gis 'jig rten gyi khams re rer yang gtsug lag khang dzambu'i chu bo'i gser las byas pa /
