translated: “Mañjuśrī, suppose some gentleman or lady were to build in each of the world systems temples made of the gold of the Jambu River,

original: nor rin po che glog gi sgron mas spras pa /
analyzed: nor rin po che glog gi sgron mas spras pa /
translated: It was adorned with precious jewels and lightning lamps.

original: nor bu rin po che 'od thams cad bsdus pa'i stegs bus yongs su bskor ba /
analyzed: nor bu rin po che 'od thams cad bsdus pa'i stegs bus yongs su bskor ba /
translated: It was surrounded by platforms of precious jewels that gathered all lights.

original: nor bu dang / mu tig dang / rin po che'i phreng bas mdzes par byas pa /
analyzed: nor bu dang / mu tig dang / rin po che'i phreng bas mdzes par byas pa /
translated: It was beautified by strings of pearls and precious jewels.

original: gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan bsgreng ba /🔽dril bu g-yer ka'i dra ba'i bla bre bres pa /
analyzed: gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan bsgreng ba / dril bu g-yer ka'i dra ba'i bla bre bres pa /
translated: It was raised with parasols, victory banners, and flags.🔽It was covered with nets of small bells.

original: tsandan sprul gyi snying po'i byug pas byugs pa /
analyzed: tsandan sprul gyi snying po'i byug pas byugs pa /
translated: It was anointed with the perfume of uragasāra sandalwood.

original: nor bu rin po che dbang gi rgyal pos khebs par byas pa /
analyzed: nor bu rin po che dbang gi rgyal pos khebs par byas pa /
translated: It was covered with precious jewels of sovereign power.

original: rgya mtsho na gnas pa'i rin po che rnam par dag pa bkod pa kun nas 'od zer snang ba'i nor bu rin po che'i ka ba mang pos dkrigs pa; nor bu rin po che'i seng ge ral pa zhes bya ba'i spang leb bres pa /
analyzed: rgya mtsho na gnas pa'i rin po che rnam par dag pa bkod pa kun nas 'od zer snang ba'i nor bu rin po che'i ka ba mang pos dkrigs pa; nor bu rin po che'i seng ge ral pa zhes bya ba'i spang leb bres pa /
translated: It was filled with many pillars of precious jewels that were the pure jewels of the ocean, shining with light rays, and with floors of precious jewels called lion manes.

original: nor bu rin po che seng ge rgyal mtshan gyi rtse mo las byas pa'i sgo khang dang / rta babs dang / skar khung gis brgyan pa /
analyzed: nor bu rin po che seng ge rgyal mtshan gyi rtse mo las byas pa'i sgo khang dang / rta babs dang / skar khung gis brgyan pa /
translated: It has a gatehouse made of the precious jewel lion victory banner, and it is adorned with archways and windows.

original: dar gyi lda ldi mang pos bres pa /
analyzed: dar gyi lda ldi mang pos bres pa /
translated: It is draped with many silk tassels.

original: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rdul snyed dag byas te /
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rdul snyed dag byas te /
translated: He makes as many of them as there are atoms in all the world systems in the ten directions.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi gnas stong phrag grangs med pa @223b dag dang / rang sangs rgyas de dag la nyin gcig bzhin lha'i zas ro brgya dang ldan pa dang / lha'i gos dag kyang byin zhing de ltar byin pa bskal pa gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag tu byin pa bas /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi gnas stong phrag grangs med pa @223b dag dang / rang sangs rgyas de dag la nyin gcig bzhin lha'i zas ro brgya dang ldan pa dang / lha'i gos dag kyang byin zhing de ltar byin pa bskal pa gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag tu byin pa bas /
translated: He gives to each of those solitary buddhas, every day, divine food of a hundred flavors and divine clothes, and he gives in this way for as many eons as there are grains of sand in the Ganges River.

original: 'jam dpal / rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: Mañjuśrī, if some other son of a good family

original: rigs kyi bu mo gzhan gang zhig gis sangs rgyas she'am /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gzhan gang zhig gis sangs rgyas she'am /
translated: or daughter of a good family were to say, ‘Buddha,’

original: 'jig rten gyi mgon po zhe'am /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi mgon po zhe'am /
translated: ‘Lord of the World,’

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zhe'am /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zhe'am /
translated: ‘Tathāgata,’🔽‘

original: thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya ba'i sgra thos na 'di ni de bas ches bsod nams grangs med par skyed na gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku ri mor bris pa'am /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya ba'i sgra thos na 'di ni de bas ches bsod nams grangs med par skyed na gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku ri mor bris pa'am /
translated: If hearing the words “omniscient one” generates so much merit, then what need is there to mention making an image of the Tathagata?

original: gzugs su byas pa mthong ba lta ci smos te /
analyzed: gzugs su byas pa mthong ba lta ci smos te /
translated: If hearing the words ‘omniscience’ generates so much merit, what need is there to speak of seeing a tathāgata’s body painted on a wall or fashioned out of clay?

original: 'di nyid de bas ches bsod nams grangs med par skyed do //🔽gang gis mar me phul ba'am /
analyzed: 'di nyid de bas ches bsod nams grangs med par skyed do // gang gis mar me phul ba'am /
translated: This generates merit that is incalculably greater.🔽What need is there to speak of offering a lamp,

original: bdug pa'am / spos sam /
analyzed: bdug pa'am / spos sam /
translated: or incense,

original: me tog dag gam /
analyzed: me tog dag gam /
translated: or flowers,

original: rol mo'i sgra'am /
analyzed: rol mo'i sgra'am /
translated: or music,

original: mchod pa sna tshogs gzhan dag byed pa lta ci smos te /
analyzed: mchod pa sna tshogs gzhan dag byed pa lta ci smos te /
translated: or any other kind of worship?

original: 'di nyid de bas ches bsod nams grangs med par bskyed do //
analyzed: 'di nyid de bas ches bsod nams grangs med par bskyed do //
translated: This generates merit that is incalculably greater.

original: gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i phyir nyi ma gcig bslab pa gcig srung ba lta ci smos te /
analyzed: gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i phyir nyi ma gcig bslab pa gcig srung ba lta ci smos te /
translated: What need is there to speak of someone who, for the sake of the Tathāgata, observes a single precept for a single day?

original: 'di ni de bas ches bsod nams grangs med par skyed do //
analyzed: 'di ni de bas ches bsod nams grangs med par skyed do //
translated: This generates merit that is incalculably greater.

original: 'jam dpal / rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: Mañjuśrī, if a son or daughter of noble family

original: rigs kyi bu mo gang la la zhig gis de bzhin gshegs pa byang chub sems dpa' dang bcas pa /🔽nyan thos dang bcas pa phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rdul phra rab snyed rnams la nyin @224a *//
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang la la zhig gis de bzhin gshegs pa byang chub sems dpa' dang bcas pa / nyan thos dang bcas pa phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rdul phra rab snyed rnams la nyin @224a *//
translated: “Son of a good family, if someone were to make offerings to as many tathāgatas, together with bodhisattvas,🔽and śrāvakas as there are atoms in all the world systems in the ten directions,🔽

original: gcig bzhin du lha'i zas ro brgya dang ldan pa dang / lha'i na bza' dag kyang 'bul la /
analyzed: gcig bzhin du lha'i zas ro brgya dang ldan pa dang / lha'i na bza' dag kyang 'bul la /
translated: Suppose, noble sir, that some man or woman were to offer every day divine food of a hundred tastes and divine clothes to as many tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly awakened buddhas together with their communities of disciples and bodhisattvas as there are atomic particles in all the world-realms in the ten directions,🔽and were to do so for aeons equal in number to the sands of the Ganges river,

original: de ltar 'bul ba bskal pa gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag tu 'bul zhing sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas kyang de bzhin gshegs pa re re'i phyir mchod rten tshad gling bzhi pa tsam /
analyzed: de ltar 'bul ba bskal pa gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag tu 'bul zhing sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas kyang de bzhin gshegs pa re re'i phyir mchod rten tshad gling bzhi pa tsam /
translated: and were to offer such things after the parinirvāṇa of those buddha bhagavāns, for each tathāgata, a stūpa the size of a world-realm,

original: rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa /🔽yon tan thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa dang ldan pa dang / dzambu'i chu bo'i gser las byas pa /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa / yon tan thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa dang ldan pa dang / dzambu'i chu bo'i gser las byas pa /
translated: adorned with all the finest ornaments,🔽made of the finest sandalwood,

original: nor bu rin po che glog gi sgron mas spras pa /
analyzed: nor bu rin po che glog gi sgron mas spras pa /
translated: and inlaid with precious gems,

original: nor bu rin po che 'od thams cad bsdus pa'i stegs bus yongs su bskor ba /
analyzed: nor bu rin po che 'od thams cad bsdus pa'i stegs bus yongs su bskor ba /
translated: a platform of all-gathering light,

original: nor bu dang / mu tig dang / rin po che'i phreng bas mdzes par byas pa /🔽gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang; ba dan bsgreng ba /🔽dril bu g-yer ka'i dra ba'i bla bre bres pa /
analyzed: nor bu dang / mu tig dang / rin po che'i phreng bas mdzes par byas pa / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang; ba dan bsgreng ba / dril bu g-yer ka'i dra ba'i bla bre bres pa /
translated: adorned with strings of jewels, pearls, and gems,🔽with raised parasols, banners, and flags,🔽covered with nets of small bells,

original: tsandan na sprul gyi snying po'i byug pas byugs pa /
analyzed: tsandan na sprul gyi snying po'i byug pas byugs pa /
translated: smeared with sandalwood and uragasāra,

original: nor bu rin po che dbang gi rgyal po'i dra bas g-yogs pa /
analyzed: nor bu rin po che dbang gi rgyal po'i dra bas g-yogs pa /
translated: and covered with nets of vaiḍūrya jewels.

original: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rdul snyed dag byas te /
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rdul snyed dag byas te /
translated: He would make as many stūpas as there are atoms in all the world systems in the ten directions.

original: mchod rten de dag la nyin gcig bzhin du stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i tshad tsam gyi lha'i gos dag dang; gdugs kyi sprin dag dang / rgyal mtshan gyi sprin dag dang / ba dan gyi sprin dag dang / me tog gi sprin dag dang /
analyzed: mchod rten de dag la nyin gcig bzhin du stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i tshad tsam gyi lha'i gos dag dang; gdugs kyi sprin dag dang / rgyal mtshan gyi sprin dag dang / ba dan gyi sprin dag dang / me tog gi sprin dag dang /
translated: Every day he would offer to those stūpas divine garments and clouds of parasols, clouds of banners, clouds of flags, and clouds of flowers, each as vast as the great trichiliocosm.

original: spos kyi sprin dag dang / rin po che'i sprin dag dang / @224b dang; rol mo'i sgra'i sprin dag dang / rgyan gyi sprin dag dang / seng ge rgyal mtshan gyi rtse mo'i zla ba'i sprin dag dang / lha'i sil snyan dang / pheg rdob pa dang /🔽glu dbyangs kyi sgra'i sprin rnams kyis gtor /
analyzed: spos kyi sprin dag dang / rin po che'i sprin dag dang / @224b dang; rol mo'i sgra'i sprin dag dang / rgyan gyi sprin dag dang / seng ge rgyal mtshan gyi rtse mo'i zla ba'i sprin dag dang / lha'i sil snyan dang / pheg rdob pa dang / glu dbyangs kyi sgra'i sprin rnams kyis gtor /
translated: and clouds of the sounds of divine musical instruments, cymbals, and songs.🔽Having scattered and offered them,

original: mngon par gtor la chos kyi rnam grangs 'di la mos pa bas /
analyzed: mngon par gtor la chos kyi rnam grangs 'di la mos pa bas /
translated: compared to the one who is devoted to this Dharma teaching,

original: 'jam dpal / rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: Mañjuśrī, if another son or daughter of noble family

original: rigs kyi bu mo gzhan gang zhig de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan dang / ye shes bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i yul la 'jug pa bstan pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs 'di la mos shing tha na dud 'gro'i skye gnas su song ba'i sems can gcig la zan kham gcig byin na 'di nyid de bas ches bsod nams grangs med par skyed do
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gzhan gang zhig de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan dang / ye shes bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i yul la 'jug pa bstan pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs 'di la mos shing tha na dud 'gro'i skye gnas su song ba'i sems can gcig la zan kham gcig byin na 'di nyid de bas ches bsod nams grangs med par skyed do
translated: were to enter the inconceivable domain of the Thus-Gone One's qualities and wisdom, and teach this Dharma teaching, and if they were to give even a single morsel of food to a single being born in the animal realm, the latter would generate incalculably greater merit than the former.

original: // 'jam dpal /
analyzed: // 'jam dpal /
translated: Mañjuśrī,

original: mdo sde 'di la mos pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gang la la zhig gis mdo 'di las ji skad smos pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la mchod pa byed pa bas /
analyzed: mdo sde 'di la mos pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gang la la zhig gis mdo 'di las ji skad smos pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la mchod pa byed pa bas /
translated: If some bodhisattva who has faith in this sutra were to make offerings to the Tathagatas as described in this sutra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' mdo 'di nyid la mos pa gzhan gang zhig gis mdo 'di nyid la mos pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gzhan zhig mthong nas byang chub sems dpa' 'di ni mdo 'di nyid la mos pa'o snyam ste dga' ba dang / mchog tu dga' ba chen po rnyed la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' mdo 'di nyid la mos pa gzhan gang zhig gis mdo 'di nyid la mos pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gzhan zhig mthong nas byang chub sems dpa' 'di ni mdo 'di nyid la mos pa'o snyam ste dga' ba dang / mchog tu dga' ba chen po rnyed la /
translated: and if some other bodhisattva who also has faith in this sutra were to see another bodhisattva who also has faith in this sutra and think, “This bodhisattva has faith in this sutra,” and were to find joy and supreme joy in this,

original: de sems dad pas langs te /
analyzed: de sems dad pas langs te /
translated: and if, with faith in his heart, he were to rise from his seat,

original: de la thal mo sbyar nas phyag btsal te ci nus ci lcogs su de la yongs su bzung ba byas na /🔽'di nyid de bas ches sangs rgyas kyi ye shes thob @225a *//
analyzed: de la thal mo sbyar nas phyag btsal te ci nus ci lcogs su de la yongs su bzung ba byas na / 'di nyid de bas ches sangs rgyas kyi ye shes thob @225a *//
translated: bow down to him with palms joined, and do whatever he could to serve him,

original: par 'gyur ba'i bsod nams grangs med pa skyed do //
analyzed: par 'gyur ba'i bsod nams grangs med pa skyed do //
translated: the latter would generate incalculably greater merit than the former for attaining the wisdom of the Buddha.

original: 'jam dpal / de lta bas na sangs rgyas kyi ye shes 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpas chos kyi rnam grangs 'di mnyan pa'i phyir 'jig rten gyi khams mes yongs su gang ba gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag kyang brgal te 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / de lta bas na sangs rgyas kyi ye shes 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpas chos kyi rnam grangs 'di mnyan pa'i phyir 'jig rten gyi khams mes yongs su gang ba gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag kyang brgal te 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, Mañjuśrī, a bodhisattva who wishes for the wisdom of the Buddha should cross over even as many world systems filled with fire as there are grains of sand in the Ganges river in order to hear this Dharma teaching.

original: 'jam dpal / byang chub sems dpa' gang la la zhig gis bskal pa bye ba stong phrag brgyad du pha rol tu phyin pa lnga la spyad pa bas /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / byang chub sems dpa' gang la la zhig gis bskal pa bye ba stong phrag brgyad du pha rol tu phyin pa lnga la spyad pa bas /
translated: Mañjuśrī, if some bodhisattva were to practice the five perfections for a hundred thousand eons,

original: 'jam dpal / byang chub sems dpa' gzhan gang zhig de bzhin gshegs pa ni rtag pa'o snyam du mos par byed na 'di ni de bas ches bsod nams grangs med par skyed do //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / byang chub sems dpa' gzhan gang zhig de bzhin gshegs pa ni rtag pa'o snyam du mos par byed na 'di ni de bas ches bsod nams grangs med par skyed do //
translated: Mañjuśrī, another bodhisattva who thinks, ‘The Tathāgata is permanent,’ would generate merit immeasurably greater than that.

original: 'jam dpal / byang chub sems dpa' gang la la zhig gis sangs rgyas phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rdul phra rab kyi rdul snyed dag la lha'i zas ro brgya dang ldan pa dang / lha'i na bza' dag nyin gcig bzhin du 'bul zhing /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / byang chub sems dpa' gang la la zhig gis sangs rgyas phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rdul phra rab kyi rdul snyed dag la lha'i zas ro brgya dang ldan pa dang / lha'i na bza' dag nyin gcig bzhin du 'bul zhing /
translated: Mañjuśrī, suppose some bodhisattva were to offer to as many buddhas as there are atomic particles in all the world-realms in the ten directions divine food of a hundred tastes and divine clothing every day,

original: de ltar 'bul ba bskal pa gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag tu 'bul ba bas /
analyzed: de ltar 'bul ba bskal pa gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag tu 'bul ba bas /
translated: and were to make such offerings every day for as many eons as there are grains of sand in the Ganges river.🔽Mañjuśrī, suppose another bodhisattva were to have admiration for a bodhisattva who believes in this Dharma discourse called Entering the Inconceivable Dharma of the Tathāgatas and the Realm of Wisdom, and were to think, ‘Excellent, excellent!

original: 'jam dpal / byang chub sems dpa' gzhan gang zhig de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan dang / ye shes bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i yul la 'jug pa bstan pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs 'di la mos pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la ngo mtshar du 'dzin par gyur nas khyod chos kyi @225b rnam grangs 'di la mos pa legs so //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / byang chub sems dpa' gzhan gang zhig de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan dang / ye shes bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i yul la 'jug pa bstan pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs 'di la mos pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la ngo mtshar du 'dzin par gyur nas khyod chos kyi @225b rnam grangs 'di la mos pa legs so //
translated: You believe in this Dharma discourse!

original: legs so // khyod ni lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis phyag bya ba'i 'os yin no //
analyzed: legs so // khyod ni lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis phyag bya ba'i 'os yin no //
translated: You are worthy of being worshipped by the world with its gods, humans, and asuras!’

original: zhes bsam pa thag pa nas legs so zhes bya ba byin la /
analyzed: zhes bsam pa thag pa nas legs so zhes bya ba byin la /
translated: Having given your consent with a sincere thought, Excellent!

original: khyod de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsang ba'i gnas rnams su zhugs la chos kyi 'khor lo skor cig ces byas nas /
analyzed: khyod de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsang ba'i gnas rnams su zhugs la chos kyi 'khor lo skor cig ces byas nas /
translated: and having said, You have entered the secret places of all the Tathagatas, turn the wheel of the Dharma!

original: 'jam dpal / byang chub sems dpa' de ni de bas ches bsod nams grangs med par 'phel te /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / byang chub sems dpa' de ni de bas ches bsod nams grangs med par 'phel te /
translated: Mañjuśrī, that bodhisattva will generate incalculably more merit than that.

original: bsod nams mngon par 'du bya ba 'di la sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams snga ma des brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro /
analyzed: bsod nams mngon par 'du bya ba 'di la sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams snga ma des brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro /
translated: Compared to the previous merit that arose from generosity, this merit does not approach even a hundredth part,

original: stong gi cha dang / 'bum gyi cha dang / bye ba'i cha dang / bye ba brgya'i cha dang / bye ba stong gi cha dang / bye ba 'bum gyi cha dang / bye ba khrag khrig phrag 'bum gyi cha dang / grangs dang; cha dang /
analyzed: stong gi cha dang / 'bum gyi cha dang / bye ba'i cha dang / bye ba brgya'i cha dang / bye ba stong gi cha dang / bye ba 'bum gyi cha dang / bye ba khrag khrig phrag 'bum gyi cha dang / grangs dang; cha dang /
translated: a thousandth part, a hundred thousandth part, a ten millionth part, a billionth part, a ten billionth part, a trillionth part, a count, a fraction,

original: bgrang ba dang / dpe dang / zla dang / rgyur yang mi bzod do //
analyzed: bgrang ba dang / dpe dang / zla dang / rgyur yang mi bzod do //
translated: a number, an example, or a comparison.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gnang ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gnang ste /
translated: The Blessed One has given his permission.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sgrib pa thams cad rnam par sel bas de skad ces smras nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sgrib pa thams cad rnam par sel bas de skad ces smras nas /
translated: The bodhisattva Sarva­nīvaraṇa­viṣkam­bhin having said this,

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' de dag dang / nyan thos chen po de dag dang / lha dang / mi dang; lha ma yin dang / dri zar bcas pa'i 'jig rten yi rangs te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' de dag dang / nyan thos chen po de dag dang / lha dang / mi dang; lha ma yin dang / dri zar bcas pa'i 'jig rten yi rangs te /
translated: the bodhisattva Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta, those bodhisattvas, those great śrāvakas, and the world with its gods, humans, asuras, and gandharvas rejoiced.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par bstod do //🔽'phags pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan @226a *//
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par bstod do // 'phags pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan @226a *//
translated: They praised what the Bhagavat had said.

original: dang; ye shes bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i yul la 'jug pa bstan pa zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo rdzogs so ////
analyzed: dang; ye shes bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i yul la 'jug pa bstan pa zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo rdzogs so ////
translated: The noble Great Vehicle Sūtra “The Teaching on Entering the Domain of the Inconceivable Qualities and Wisdom of the Tathāgatas” is completed.

original: rgya gar gyi mkhan po dzny'a na garbha dang / zhus chen gyi lo ts'a ba bande ye shes sdes bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa'o //
analyzed: rgya gar gyi mkhan po dzny'a na garbha dang / zhus chen gyi lo ts'a ba bande ye shes sdes bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa'o //
translated: It was translated, edited, and finalized by the Indian preceptor Jñānagarbha and the translator-editor Bandé Yeshé Dé.
